description: This was my first time and went here with my boyfriend. My boyfriend has been there a few times and all I say is the food is delicious. I will definitely come back again
author: Linh P.

description:
I wish i could give 0 star for todays experience.
We never went there but once we had to go order Chiken kadai and it was so delicious the best kadai we had in sf so today as Ramadan is going on and i was not feeling well so think to get to go order from this place and so my husband bought Prawns Masala and it was like they have blended tomatoes and little onion with lots of water and added into the 6 pieces of prawns and also one of the prawn was not properly cleaned. It has the skin and legs on it.. ewww... there was no salt no oil no chilli or any kind of masala... the worst experience as after Fasting a whole day we got a food like this.
We cooked that gravy by adding some masalas and oil and salt into it and then had it... so there is no point of having to go order from restaurant. Despite of not feeling well i should have cooked on my own rather bringing food
Being an Indian i can say that it was disgusting and waste of money...
author: Shirin S.

description: I ordered a lamb biriyani and it was nothing like the biriyani I've had at pakwan, sharlimar or Lahore-karahi. It was kinda oily ,had tomatoes in it, which is quite unusual for a biriyani. I'm not Indian or Pakistani so I dont know if it's a different style of biriyani. All in all it didn't taste good either. That's why this place deserves 2 Stars.
author: Madhu J.

description: They are going downhill.  Been here like 2-3 years ago and it was good.  Now, they don't seem to care with poor customer service.  I had the chicken tikka masala and I felt like I was eating red food coloring.  Vegetable korma either was made with frozen veggies or cooked way too long.  I have teeth and don't like eating mushy veggies.  They need more enthusiasm and better customer service.
author: H C.

description: Only because I could not give negative ratings. First things first, the guy who answers the phone calls is super rude. Looks like he is not interested in what his customers need. I ordered via uber eats and put in a comment in bold that the food should have no cilantro. I also called and the guy said if its in the order, they will not put any cilantro. Sure enough there is cilantro in the food. The daal is sprinkled with a handful. When I called the guy says we do not put any cilantro in the veg Korma, he did not wait to hear me say its the daal. Moreover, he said he did not want to listen to what I had to say. This is poor customer service. All the best to the owner of the restaurant, the man answering the calls is taking you down. And if you sir are the owner, God bless you and your enterprise.
author: Amit P.

description:
I like food here, service is not good but I knew it while coming here, good for family large group... 
when I'm with a group this place definitely on my first list.
author: Marco G.

description: This is not a fancy spot, but it serves great food, really good prices, and very large portions. Service was also fast and friendly. We had lamb tikka masala, chicken tikka masala, prawn curry, lamb curry, rice and garlic naan I love all of them. Although the place is kind of sketchy and loud, I enjoy doing dine-in here.
author: Zeynep D.

description: I had such high expectations out of the food here. I was so disappointed! The food was mediocre at best.
author: A M.

description: This is as ghetto as it gets!! I would not call it an indian restaurant first of all, that would be a disgrace! Pain points are many but to start with it is the cleanliness which seems to be the major issue. Staff leaning on cooking counters, no gloves, using cellphone and wearing earphones that are falling off on kitchen counters, broken ceramic plates and much.more. I.would actuay give 0 stars if I could. We ordered chicken tikka masala where chicken had a bad bad smell/ after taste to it. We left the majority food untouched. I wonder if this.place has a sanitation inspection done, they would fail badly and will be shut down if it was ever inspected. My recommendation: STAY AWAY!!!
author: Ruchi M.

description: Excellent!!!!! Not greasy or too spicy, just right!!! It has been our "go to" place for decades!!! Cooks and owners have changed over the years, but fantastic now!!!! Must go!!
author: Barb M.

description: I liked chicken tandoori, full value for money, soft and juicy. Nihari was also good, I am not disappointed. Service could be better. Had to remind waiter multiple times for my dessert. Dessert (kheer) was fine.
author: Salman M.

description: I love the food here, it's so good. I took so many people and they keep going back. I love the chicken tikka masala, potato naan, fish and the biryani. So cheap too.
author: Amal H.

description: I ordered delivery and received the most disgusting and inedible food I have ever encountered from a restaurant. Items were missing from the order and I had to file a claim with Caviar to get a refund. The chicken vindaloo looked like a scrap pile of bones and fat swimming in a watery brown broth. The chicken tikka masala was so tough it was like eating rubber. The only item that was edible was the garlic naan, but it was a tiny piece that really wasn't even enough for one person -- I expected an order of naan to be enough for 1-2 people. Steer clear of this restaurant.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Filling! 

I'm not that into Indian/Pakistani food but, went here after a 1 hour swim at Aquatic Park with a group of friends. I only had half a lamb wrap and I was full!!!! The meat was deliciously smoky. I wrapped it to go and shared it with my friend and he loved that smoky flavor.
author: Jray M.

description:
The small one block stretch on Jones between Geary & O'Farrell hosts three Pakistani/Indian restaurants namely Shalimar, Chutney and Pakwan that I decided to try, to find one that I could stick with on a regular basis. After trying Shalimar, I decided to try Chutney. Chutney is located in the heart of the hood so apart from letting you know that you have to basically ignore panhandlers on your way here and back, I'm going to spare you other details.

Chutney seems to be slightly bigger than Shalimar and is also a lot cleaner compared to Shalimar. The carpet definitely needs cleaning, but it does look like the floors and tables are cleaned periodically unlike Shalimar where they seem to be simply wiped down.

At the peak dinner hour Chutney too was almost full but not as packed as Shalimar across the street. I decided to get the Chicken Tikka Masala ($8.99) and a couple of naan ($1) to-go. Wait time again was around 20 minutes which was not too bad.

Taste wise the Chicken Tikka Masala was nicely cooked. It was hot but not overly spicy. The naan was also nicely cooked without it being overly soft and chewy or hard and brittle. Overall this was a pretty good meal. After my first visit I've been back a couple of times to try out a couple more of their chicken and lamb dishes all of which are around the $10 mark. Similar to Shalimar the quantity of food that you get when you dine-in is much less when compared with to-go, but they seem to be a little more generous than Shalimar.

Price-wise Chutney is about 15% more expensive than Shalimar across the street and 15% less expensive than Pakwan that is on the next block. Taste-wise and consistency wise it is on the top followed by Shalimar and then Pakwan. Chutney is my preferred choice when I want to dine-in.
author: Ahmad J.

description: I could give 3.4 star for this restaurant. The lamb was not very tender, it was little but hard and hardly tasted the flavor of lamb. It has good value since lamb is expensive and it comes with a salad. We also ordered the kebab, which tastes really bad, too much flour in it, not 100% meat, would not recommend the cheapest kebab.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: This place has the best tikka Masala if your not used to spicy or hot masala you would love this place . So it's western indian  and Pakistani  joint. If you want to burn your asshole then go to Shalimar across the street.
author: Rushdy H.

description:
The guy was very rude 
He took my order 30 min and he left the food on the table until became cold and he said tha food just came now he was lying.
This is the worst restaurant I have never seen before. There are too many restaurants in SF where you can find delicious food such as Pakwan.
Really bad and rude guys
author: Kahhun A.

description: My husband and I were walking back to our hotel from the piers and passed this place.  The menu was posted in the window and we were hoping to try something new.  We ordered the skewers appetizers-chicken, lamb and beef.  The portion size was great for the price and the meat was delicious.  The sauces were also very good.  If you can avoid the homeless outside this place it's not so bad.  I should note that the employees do try to keep the homeless away from their patrons.  Sadly, they're everywhere in San Fran.
author: Venus Z.

description: Came in around noon time. Ordered the seekh kabob and naan. The naan was good, soft and fluffy just the way I like it, but the seekh kabob was dryer than the Sahara desert and bland
author: Mario L.

description: Came in and ordered chicken Tikka masala. It tasted good then I saw a roach run by on the floor.. extra protein.. I got in my Lyft and felt sick and as soon as I got out I puked my food out. I don't get car sick ever. The place didn't seem bad or dirty initially but it's not everyday I puke after eating.
author: Alexander S.

description:
My review is a bit biased, since after living in Fremont I came to know the other Chutney location like an old friend. The SF location pales a bit in comparison, but there are several hold-overs that also make this place a local gem, especially for the Tenderloin. 

And yes, the biggest detractor for me is that this place is in the Tenderloin. I'm not a fan - never have been, never will be. The interior of this Chutney seems to have taken on the dark, inexplicably grungy vibe of the Loin', but the service is fast and the food is generally great. 

Two things I would skip are the Raita ($1) and, sadly, the Saag Paneer (~$8). The raita has the consistency of Elmer's glue - almost elastic and slime-like. Really off-putting. The Saag was fairly bland (but still tasty) and had large chunks of barely-heated paneer in it. The Bengan Bharta was better, but similarly uninspired. Both lack a depth of flavor and richness that places like Naan n Curry are able to achieve. 

That said, Chutney continues to be the heavyweight champs of Chicken Tikka Masala. It's one of the few - if only - places that actually grills their chicken in a tandoor oven, and the sauce is amazing: rich, creamy, spicy, complex, and super flavorful. Paired with their aromatic rice (studded with cardamom), it's a dream dinner. 

Two thumbs up for the free chai, plates of fresh veggies, and some killer Tikka. Next time we're craving our old fave, we'll definitely return!
author: Laura B.

description: The worst experience in my whole life. I ve been to this place with a friend. We ordered couple plates to share. When i was "enjoying" the rice i figure out there is some extra meat offered by the house for free. The picture will describe the whole situation. Then when i complained the cashier was having an attitude like i ve had some chicken instead of lamb . I m having bad time eating any kind of food in any other place. My point is not to harm this business but i m mostly thinking about other people facing the same issue. There is families that eat at this spot i will not appreciate my kids or any human being face the same experience that we ve had.
author: Mickael E.

description:
Tasty food , good customer service , reasonable prices , I always order lamb masala , it is really delicious.
But what I hate is very hard to find parking in that area
author: Mo'ad A.

description:
Love this place.
Good food
Good service
Cleaner and nicer than most of the other indopak restaurants in the area.
My must haves are the ctm, tandoori chicken, mango ice cream and the complimentary chai.
author: Amana C.

description:
We have been going to Chutney for about 5 years and it is definitely our favorite Indian/Pakistani food in the city.  The Tandoori is particularly good, with the meat well cooked without being dry and the naan perfectly prepared.  We especially like the curry dishes, very spicy without being overly hot.  
I also experienced the incident another reviewer witnessed with the homeless lady and while it was rather sad and unfortunate in the way it was handled, I truly don't know what choice the owner had.  Unlike the other reviewer, who had no contact with the lady before she was removed, this lady came up to our table, drooled on the floor, begged for money, and then grabbed my drink and drank it.  She then proceeded to sit down at another table with some guests.  
While picking her up and depositing her outside was probably not the way I would have handled it, it was done gently and quickly and didn't appear to hurt the lady.  This lady apparently comes into this business often and causes the same type of scene.  As someone who works in healthcare and comes in contact with the homeless daily, I recognized this lady as extremely mentally ill and therefore I believe she was not someone who could be reasoned with.  I believe if they would have asked her politely to leave, that she would have just made an even bigger scene.  And forget about SFPD as the previous reviewer suggested to the owner.  This would have been an extremely low priority call for them and they would likely not have responded in time to do anything.  
We will continue to come here and support this business.
author: Steve C.

description:
In at least one conceivable universe I would offer up four stars. The food is quite good, though I've had better, and the service is reasonably prompt, though some places bring it out faster. But I'm going to bump it up to five based on how well they've kept to their program in the midst of the ocean of haterade whiny entitled San Franciscans are pouring on them below.

I enjoy their food. It comes well-spiced and in large portions. Their tikka masala will win no awards for creativity but is thick and creamy, satisfying, and addictive. The veggie curries don't all make full use of the Bay Area's bounteous locavore harvest, but the flavors leave my mouth wonderfully happy. They could up their game on their free chai and on their naan. The rice is already perfect as is.

More to the point, this is a value restaurant. That doesn't mean it's a total dive: The room is actually fairly spacious and attractive given its downtown location, the affordable prices, and order-at-the-counter bring-your-number-to-your-table service dynamic. A single diner can get away for under $10 and a group of four can stuff themselves silly without going far beyond $40.

Plus they're open until midnight, which makes this a great if heavy post-bar option and a good one for a quick bite when I'm on my way home to do more work. On all of these counts we should be encouraging them to keep doing what they're doing, and hope that anyone with issues kindly take them to less affordable, more precious establishments.
author: James D.

description:
Authentic, delicious and affordable Indian food!

== Food ==
Garlic Naan (5/5)
Tikka Masala Chicken (4/5)
Tandoori Fish (3/5)
Paneer (2/5)
Mango Lassi (4/5)
Papadum (5/5)

Complimentary Tea for patron available at the back. 

== Service / Ambience ==
For its location and price, the place was well maintained and a nice ambience. The smell of the Indian food does get onto your clothing and hair. 

Food service was rather slow, figured they wanted to serve everything at a go vs separate dishes. 

Street parking along a very busy street so be prepared to circle around. There's a garage just next to the restaurant but I did not check what their rates are.
author: Cindee T.

description: Good price and good food. Everything is fresh and made in the spot. I always go eat there when i am in Sf
author: Zak A.

description:
Just didn't like the flavors of dishes I usually love.
Chicken tikka masala 3
Vegetable Korma mix 2.5
Rice 4
Naan 4
Chai tea (free w meal) 4
author: Andrew S.

description: The last time I ate here was in 2005. I found the same taste and exceptional quality of the food in 2018. Awesome BBQ and overall great place to eat.
author: Mr F.

description:
If you can get past the counter guy's general attitude issues, the food is average at best. Prices are also not as low as the some of the other places. 

Best Goat Karahi and Biryani are at Tikka Masala down the block. Desi truck driver kinda places, but the food there is amazing!
author: Saad Z.

description: Once a gain chutney is a total let down watered down masala over cooked tandaroori fish burned naan bread salad really hand tossed REALLY rice exceptional service terrible cheers chutneys U DID IT AGAIN
author: Iz F.

description:
Decent indian/pakistani food for affordable prices. Don't expect anything else apart from tasty food, and you'd be satiated. Had a late night bite here about 10:30pm, food came promptly and tasted yum. We had garlic naan (7/10), chana masala (7/10), chicken seekh kebab (8/10) and lamb chops (6/10). We dined in, which I would not recommend. They do takeout through various apps so I'd suggest that instead.
They had ran out of lamb seekh and beef seekh kebabs, so keep that in mind for late night bites. 
7.5/10, would likely grab take-out from here again some
author: Gia P.

description:
Warning: In Turk/ Tenderloin (TL). I highly wouldn't recommend bringing a date in the area, unless you're feeling a little adventerous and aren't phased by the homeless on the street. Also, street parking can be a bitch. I circled around for 15-20 min. on a week night to find a metered spot (after 6 PM free parking). Plus, semi-close to Union Square; smack dab in downtown SF. I would drive cautiously, because SF is known for jay walkers and people crossing without even looking for traffic. Keep in mind TOURISTS are always in the city too.


On Wednesday evening (12/14/16) decided to grab some Indian/ Pakistani cuisine. We originally wanted to try out Shalimar, but there was a line of at least 6-8 people infront. Since, we didn't want to wait to eat, we noticed Chutney across the street and was like "why not, let's try that out."

We proceeded to walk into the restaurant, ordered 3 entrees and several Naans.

1. Chicken Tikka Masala
2. Lamb Curry (mild)
3. Daal Masala
4. Garlic Naan $2.99/pc
5. Naan (2 pcs) $1/pc

I sat down while my two friends ordered on what we agreed upon. A waiter brought a pitcher of water, cups, plates, utensils, napkins and a plate of salad (tomato slices, raw onions, iceberg lettuce & lime wedges).
 
After about 5-10 min, another waiter brought our food to the table and set them down. 1 star for fast service. The restaurant is spacious, and can fit maybe a crowd of 20-30 people tops. 1/2 star for room.

Food came pipping hot, so did the naan. 1/2 star for hot food. 

If you love Chicken Tikka Masala, DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT... order their Chicken Tikka Masala. It is all wrong here. Tasted more like tomato bisque (sour & alot of tomatoes). It felt like it was missing the cream/ yogurt and the spices that make it a Masala. It definately wasn't even the same category as Chicken Tikka Masala. My bestfriend and I were so disappointed about this dish, because you know a place is great for their most commonly knowm dish... we were so disgruntled about it. Knowing that we were hungry, we ate it but vowed never to come back to this establishment. We compared it to our go-to's back in East Bay (Hayward) and South Bay (San Jose/ Santa Clara).

Naan is very typical. Nothing much to rave about. It came hot, was a large piece of bread, & dry. Not fluffy. 

Lamb Curry: very gamey if you preferr to have that distinct smell or taste with your food. I can't say I like or dislike it. It's not something I would order on my own.

Daal Masala: I wish they had Daal Makhani. Which is the best because it's so creamy and lucious. But no where on the menu did it have that specific dish, so I settled on Daal Masala. It's not great, and it seemed like it consisted of the same oils and spices as the Lamb Curry. I would not recommend getting.

Overall experience: 2 stars. 

Don't be scared to try new places. Our expectations were a bit higher, because my best friend and I would frequently eat Indian food back in San Jose during the time we both were students at San Jose State University. FYI, we were pretty disappointed and bummed that we didn't get a great Chicken Tikka Masala. We felt we could've made a better one than this restaurant.
author: Vivian V.

description: This is simply the best Indian restaurant in SF. Their food is always fresh, tasty and CHEAP. I always get chicken tika masala, chicken Biryani, tandoori, naan, white rice, and kabob.  All these dishes are so good.
author: Salem S.

description: The food is really good this review isn't based on the food just on the experience we faced today. We ordered a Tikka masala and they gave us a broken lid and our food spilled all over the bag.
author: Adam L.

description: Aauthentic dish, great price, and quick service. The veggie samosas and lamb biryani are amazing. It's not to try complementary chai masala  and salad with my meal.
author: M K.

description: The tiki Marsala and the naan bread are awesome, I could eat just those and be satisfied. The service is quick and they are able to accommodate larger groups easily. I've never been here when it's super busy, so it always seems relaxed. I recommend it!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
This was my favorite spot to go to when I worked in SF. Their tandoori chicken was second to none with bursting flavors from the start that did not die down by the last bite. I went here and the mounting disappointment overtook my faint heart.  The tandoori chicken tasted bland and had rubbery texture. The chicken tika Masala was way too sweet for my taste. The only thing that didn't change in 11 years was the lamb vindaloo, which was still very flavorful yet not overpowering.

I don't think I will visit again as I do not want to taint my fond memories here. After all, this is the first place I had Indian food.
author: D P.

description: Here I am trying to eat my first meal of the day so I decided to order Chutney for a Chicken Tikka Masala.  Not only did they forget my sprite, the chicken tikka masala was not even a chicken tikka masala.  It was a potato tikka masala or whatever you may call it.  But it had no chicken at all.  I was even trying to look carefully for any pieces of chicken thinking they probably adjusted the recipe.  It was a cup full of potatoes, peas, and some other stuff i dont even know what it is.  Now I'm sitting here starving like wtf am I eating.  Thank You Chutney for ruining my fucking night.
author: Eric L.

description: Very dirty place and they have  no customer services and l can't go back there anymore even their food test good but that place is not clean enough my last time was ther l order a food and a while l was waiting for it l saw a mouse running between the tables l was scared and l left the place without the food because that is the bad experience I ever
author: Kaddour A.

description:
Worst Indian food I've ever had in America. Seriously.
Malai kofte and veggie tikka masala. God(s)!
author: Piarpreet K.

description: Hands down favorite place. Everything is so cheap and tastes delicious. My husband and I have been coming here for over 4 years now even though it takes us 30 minutes to drive here, definitely worth the drive. We usually get the chicken tikka masala with rice and garlic naan. We will continue to come here as long as this place is open. Also big thank you to the nice employees
author: Gunjinlkham A.

description:
This place is a joke. The manager was a JERK, the service was slow, the food was so sub-par it wasn't even funny.

For an example, look at the photo I attached of the "salad". Yes, they expect you to eat this as if you're a horse. It's shameful and must contribute to a ton of food waste as nobody will eat it.

I got a sternum bone in my Chicken Tikka, wtf? It's like they gave me the absolute cheapest scraps of what was once a chicken. I paid top dollar to be treated and fed like a stray dog.

Save yourself the trouble and visit the other spectacular Indian restaurants in the area. This one should not be worth your time and money.
author: Alec A.

description: One of our best meals while in San Francisco. Absolutely incredible. Did not have anything that was not spit on. The naan, the curry, so many things that were ordered family style I can't recall all of them. I'd just say ask the server and it will be worth it.
author: Darren O.

description:
Again had a bad stomach. 

Anything with spinach gives a very bad stomach. 

I don't know what they are doing.

It's a shame coz it taste good.
author: Sam B.

description:
The prices here are very reasonable and the food is quite tasty.  I love the smell of the place when I walk in.  The spices and the roasting meat.  It's in the Tenderloin where you may sit and enjoy a good meal while watching the street creatures slowly moving about at their craft of staying comfortable or trying to score at their unique street enterprise.  Sometimes scary but usually just peculiar.

My favorite at Chutney is goat biryani.  Sometimes they have a brain masala which is rich creamy and packed with flavor.  That will be on the "specials" board... and more often than not, the owner smiles at me and says, "Sorry, we are all out."  Makes me think of my mother when she use to talk about people who didn't have enough brains to come in from the rain... only at Chutney, they didn't have enough brains to make my masala.  Mother was packed with wisdom and wit.

I like the owner.  He's always friendly and helpful.  It's a place for regulars.  Since it's run down and you have to figure out how to take care of yourself.  The Alec A. review is a good example of someone who doesn't belong.   Chutney is a different kind of experience - and the food is downright delicious!
author: Steve S.

description: This is probably the  best Indian food I've had in my life.  No joke!  I come here every time I'm in San Francisco now.  Amazing flavors.
author: Derek A.

description:
When the owner of a restaurant physically picks up a woman who appeared to be homeless and forcibly removes her from the premises without warning or conversation (not one word was spoken), it's not okay. 
Let me repeat, regardless of cultural background, previous experiences, personal opinion, etc - it is NOT OKAY to put your hands on another human being. I have no doubt that there is a lot of history between this woman and this restaurant, but to me, it doesn't matter. I have been going to Chutney's for years and taking friends and out of town visitors with me, but no longer. I will not support a business or an owner who dehumanizes people, and then instead of apologizing to his customers for his behavior, proceeds to publically argue with them to justify his actions. There is no place for this sort of prejudice and abuse in the Bay Area. Help me in NOT supporting this behavior in our city!
author: Mary K.

description:
Pretty mixed.

Palak paneer - great
Lamb boti - tasty but insanely dry
Prawn masala - weird flavor but pretty good
Guy at register - awful. Rude, condescending, wouldn't answer questions, generally acted like he was disgusted that we had dared to come in.

The food may have been decent but I wouldn't ever go back based purely on the guy we had to deal with when ordering. What's worse, I had to deal with him not once, but twice, since you go to the register and place your order, then go back to the register and pay after you're done.
author: Jason F.

description:
This place doesn't really deserved a star, worst  food quality and the worst treatment ever.
 I ordered lamb chops but I couldn't eat it, it was a tire chops then I told them see how bad is it I can't eat it, imagine the answer he said "sorry you "ll pay or I will call the police" I felt that time how cheap I'm in this garbage place. So, I gave him the $15 and I didn't eat, but someone in the line asked me to tell them to make it again and he will take it, So, I told them that and I left.
author: Moaaz D.

description: Chutney serves hard to find specials like HALEEM (pureed chicken)  and NIHARI (beef shank curry) on a daily basis. These dishes will do the trick in a pinch but, in terms of sheer quality and authenticity, Chutney is not a match to its competitor, Pakwan, which is just down the street.
author: Javid S.

description:
Try: 
Chicken Vindaloo
Paneer Tikka Masala

You might be reading about poor service at this restaurant in other reviews, and I won't dispute that. From my experience, service was indifferent, and a little on the slower side, but not offensively slow.

What a start to a review that has 4 stars! Why 4? The food is simply outstanding. Indian food is difficult to prepare, and the meals here were regularly delicious. My favorites (at the top) were highlights for me. Definitely get yourself some naan to combat the spiciness.

I did not dock much from my rating because of the nature of the restaurant. It's a bit of a hole in the wall in the Tenderloin. Quick and professional service is all I expect, any kindness and courtesy is a bonus. If you go to a hole in the wall in the Tenderloin, don't be shocked when service is brusque.
author: Carlos G.

description: Rude staff, very depressing architecture, and quite dark. Good food though, but won't be coming here again.
author: Parsa M.

description: This place went downhill. It used to be good. The last few times its been going down. The quality of the food went downhill. It's gross to find a hairball in your food. Yes, a hair ball, not a single hair. It was a few pieces of hair mangled in the food. It's already happened twice. Idk why I decided to give them a second chance after the first time. The first time it was a single hair. The second time was the mangled hair/food ball. I don't see any female workers so where did the hair come from?! Makes me question the sanitation of this place. The chicken has a weird texture as well. I will never come back to this place again. I'm totally disgusted. What a shame. Not to mention I heard the health dept closed them down once before. Hmmmmm
author: Suzy D.

description: Fast service and amazing Indian food. I would suggest the Chicken Tikka Masala or Lamb Tikka Masala.
author: Roselyn S.

description: Amazing food , every day eating jus wow, recommended for sf ppl  , chicken tikka massala just somghing to talk about, hala food as well
author: Ray M.

description:
Last time, was here about over two years ago and was enthralled by the food and prices.  This last time, not so much.  Prices have gone up a lot while quality has gone down a lot.

The first visit here, I saw people queuing up outside and seats procured through waiting..  This time, place was mostly empty with people leaving food behind on their plates.  There's nothing so damming as a review where your patrons don't bother to finish the food they order.

I will be the first to tell you I don't know a lot about the sf food scene.  Must be a tough crowd with so many options and fads when it comes to what is trending.  But I will say that the owners of chutney should pay closer attention to why the patrons they do attract leave without finishing their food.
author: Lan C.

description: Naan is amazing, service is good and place looks clean as well. Cheap good food. City is too expensive for everything but its good to know that there is a nice place with logical prices.
author: Guler Y.

description: Definitely one of the best indian resturaunts in sf. Dont expect service, its all about flavor.
author: Mustafa M.

description:
I am making an update to my previous review . 


A few days ago , i've ordered seekh kebab and it was lunch time , and it was spoiled meat . And at the first time when the same thing happened couple month ago , I thought its just a mistake , but this time , I think I have to let you guys know about it . Meat was spoiled and even smelling bad ! It was very bad ! I usually eat in this place at least 2 times a week , and this was big disappointment for me ! 



Update #3 :

I still go there because i like their briani and tikka masala and Vindaloo.
As I can see owner renovated the place and its clean now . However they use old potatoes for vindaloo and old meat for seekh keBab.


Please , do not do this. 

Thanks...
author: Jay M.

description: My go to place for when I'm craving Indian/Pakistani food. The manager (owner?) is very friendly at the cash register. My favorite things to order are the chicken tikka masala (so flavorful and rich) and the lamb saag (meat melts in your mouth). The vegetarian dishes are also great. Their green chutney is amazing, and you get free tea!
author: Muna A.

description:
Great spot for some delicious Indian food. 

PROS:
1. Opens pretty late- till midnight
2. Decent price- average $7-10 per plate
3. Fast service
4. Large portions
5. Good food
6. Takes card- but not AMEX

CONS: 
1. located in the TL which can be real sketch and difficult to find street parking at times
2. Can get crowded sometimes

You order your meal at the cash register then you're handed a number. It's open seating and first come first serve. You then pay when you're done and return your number to the register.

What we ordered: lamb biryani, chicken vindaloo, and garlic naan total came to $20.

Everything was delicious and one order of naan was able to feed 2. I recommend ordering the lamb biryani too. The vindaloo could have been a little spicier. They also give complimentary lettuce, onions, and tomatoes. They also have complimentary Chai tea in the back. Don't forget their sauces too! I highly recommend their green sauce which you grab yourself in the back fridge with the drinks.

Will definitely be back to try their chicken tikka masala. They also carry brain which many other Yelpers recommended, but I'm just not outgoing enough for that.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Heard good things about this place but I was completely disappointed. The food not good at all. Ordered chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori, rice and naan. There was barely any chicken on the tikka masala and the tandoori had really dry pieces. So not memorable. Not only was the food not good but it also made us sick. Save yourself the disappointment and the food poisoning and try the place across. Shalimar is way better and the food actually tastes fresh.
author: Antonella H.

description:
Yummy! Delicious! Mouth watering!
Just an average looking kinda restaurant in downtown San Fran with excellent quality of food.

I was blown away with the variety of selections of appetizers and entrees you can choose from. That's right, the prices were literally cheap.

I ordered my usual - lamb vindaloo with naan and it immediately hit a nerve.

Well cooked, not too spicy, the meat was tender and had a distinguishing taste with the curry.

Highly recommended if craving for Indian food!
author: Gatangalie S.

description: Very good value for Indian food in the area.  However, I ordered my food to be spicy and it was too mild.  It was still delicious though.
author: Anthony F.

description:
I crave soup for lunch after a night of drinking. For dinner, I crave Indian food! Not sure why. It's just warm and comforting to me. I can never make the minimums for delivery when ordering for myself. Plus I've been bored with all the Indian places in my neighborhood. Last Friday, I decided to pick up take out by work on the way home. Ordered via Eat24 since I had a $2 off code.

*Vegetable samosa (2 pieces): crispy puffs filled with potatoes and green peas ($3.99)
-The Samosas were big and the shell crispy. I like that they gave me 2 sides of mint sauce since I normally need a little more than one for both samosas.

*Chicken tikka masala: boneless chicken cooked with special bombay sauce ($7.99)
-Yum! I loved the creaminess of the sauce. Wished it were a little spicier since I like a kick with my curry.

*Onion naan: naan topped with chopped onions ($1.99)
-I wasn't a huge fan of their naan. I liked the chewiness of it, but it didn't have much onion flavor.

*Garlic naan: naan topped with garlic and cilantro ($1.99)
-Same with the galic naan. Not much garlic flavor.

*Rice pullao: saffron flavored basmati rice ($1.99)
-Good base for the curry. I normally don't want rice when eating mains, but with curry, they just pair so well together, I have to have some!

I wish there were better Indian options like Chutney in my neighborhood. At least I have great options like this by work!
author: Elena N.

description: Pretty standard Indian spot. Clean. Cheap and no minus points. I have been there already 3-4 times and yet to find a better Indian restaurant.
author: Christian D.

description: The best chicken Jalfrazy in the the whole wide world. The bar is set high and ever place I been to around the world doesn't even come close. I tried to make it at home and can't get right. Something secret ingredient is missing .
author: John C.

description: When you first walk in you notice that this place is really loved by people because it is always packed. The customer service here is amazing and the workers are friendly. I been coming here for about 10 years and I can honestly say that the food here is great especially the Chicken Tikka Masala which you can get for under 10 dollars.
author: Dean A.

description: Friendly service. Exceptionally clean space. Great lunch specials. Will be coming by to experience their dinner service; updated review to follow.
author: Jason D.

description:
Ordered a delivery order from this place through delivery.com. Food order was not complete, delivered 30 mins late based on 45 min commitment per the restaurant and the food was cold. This is the worst experience I have had at this place. Me owner your service sucks and has gone down and so has your food quality and customer service. Even after reporting, the owner could not correct the situation. I am taking an action and reporting it to delivery.com and City of San Francisco tomorrow.

If this is not corrected and I don't get a full refund, report will be filed tomorrow.
author: Harpreet W.

description: Me and my family went to have lunch there and we ordered a lot of food and it's way better than the one in Fremont
author: Ali G.

description: Authentic!! authentic!! authentic!!! And did I mention that it's authentic? This traditional Indian/Pakastani restaurant will have you coming back for more. Please try the tandoori chicken.  Like most authentic Indian restaurants, to a certain extent, you have to serve yourself with the water and milk tea, but this is traditional stuff. It gets a little stuffy inside with all the aromas, but like i said: his is authentic as you can get, right at the heart of the Tenderloin!!  I've rated food quality is great and the spot is "relatively" clean. I rate this 4 stars!
author: Stephen G.

description:
NOTE: My baseline for 5 stars are French Landry, Gary Danko, Vik's Chaat, Per Se, Peter Lugar's, Nobu_Malibu, Binions_Vegas, and Bern's Steakhouse.

I prefer to goto Vik's Chaat, but thats in the East Bay....so I goto Jones street where Pakwan, Shalimar, and Chutney
author: TAGUSA G.

description: Ordered a delivery through Yelp/Eat24 and one hour later found that this place doesn't deliver. I wasted over one hour waiting for nothing.  Thank you Yelp/Eat24 and Chutney
author: Eliseo C.

description: Love this place!! The garlic naan was incredible,very soft and super fresh. The chicken tikka masala was delicious, I ordered extra spice and it was amazing!
author: Jika M.

description:
I have been coming here since I was younger. The food is delicious, especially the buttered chicken & lamb biryani. The place is old, not somewhere you would bring a date. But def family friendly. The sanitary conditions can be improved though. 
Pros: the food is amazing. 
Cons: rude cashier workers, old place. 

I give this place 4 stars because I have been coming here for so long and it has become family tradition. I really do hope the owners renovate. Im sure they have the money to do so :)
author: Fatima A.

description:
This is for sure! My favorite indian food restaurant in downtown SF. I love their chicken tikka masala sauce and clay oven baked "tandoori nan" bread! The personal is well educated , and always friendly , 
I would recommend this place for indian food lovers!
author: Erkinbek S.

description:
Country Mouse seeking good Indian Food in the big city...I even went to the scurrrry Tenderloin to get it!

If you were to look at the photo that accompanies this review you will see that I ordered a lot of food.  Chicken Tikka Masala, Rice, and Naan size of my face.  My intent was to take some home for my husband but he missed out because it was so good that I finished it all, yes all.  

Chicken Tikka Masala: semi-sweet, creamy/buttery, and spicy!  I am not sure there is a better combo of flavors.  I particularly like that the chicken was not dry but was juicy enough to cut with my fork.

Rice: buttery and some other flavors I can't place but butter is the important one.

Naan:  If it had butter on it it would have been the best but it didn't so it qualifies as really good.

All of that was $13 plus tip.
author: Melissa R.

description: Great food! Tandoori fish is my choice everytime I come here! Location sucks but it's worth it because the food is excellent
author: Crystal M.

description: Amazing experience! Very nicely decorated, I went in on a Wednesday late night for a quick late dinner. It was around 10:30PM. The man who took our order was very courteous and treated us as if we were the first order of the day, rather than a "it's been a long day I just want to go home" type of demeanor. Food is priced fair and I ordered the chicken tikka masala. Within 5-8 minutes food was hot and ready! Tasted delicious and seasoned to perfection I was very satisfied with the taste. The garlic naan was amazing nice and fluffy. Will be eating there again when in SF.
author: Yerry F.

description:
Not bad, my friends, not bad at all. 

I had my reservations coming into this place because it reminded me of Naan & Curry from the set up and ambiance - but rejoice the food is WAY better both in terms of quality and flavor. The chicken tikka masala tasted like fresh roasted tomato sauce, the masala prawns are DELICIOUS, and the papadum - YUMMMMY. 

This is a hole in the wall, so remember to keep ambiance expectations to a minimum - but in their defense the food makes up for the interior.
author: Raji R.

description: Ordered naan and paneer makhani, my friend ordered chicken tikka. Both of us fell sick after eating here, strongly advise against eating here.
author: Pranav J.

description:
The infatuation recently came out with a first timers guide to Indian restaurants and Chutney fit quite nicely into its qualifications of a legit indian restaurant: They were terrible service, less than updated ambiance, no wine list, and packed with Indian families. Obviously this doesn't hold true for every single indian restaurant, but by and large I feel like the food suffers a little when the restaurant focuses on being fancy/ nice. ( I can think of a handful in SF) 

My point is, this is one of the better Indian restaurants in SF and you just have to put up with some of the shortcomings in terms of service in order to get to the delicious food. When I went, you order at the counter and I felt kind of rushed because they already wanted to get to the next person in line. Once you order they bring out your food and thats it. We were missing a fork and when I went to ask for another one I was pointed to where I can get them myself. Same for the chutney sauce. But then, you taste your food and its so good you completely forget about everything I just mentioned. I would rather have great food in a sketchier place than mediocre food in a really nice place. 

The food truly sets itself apart from most Indian restaurants in SF (which, there are a lot). It isn't a sort of Naan-n-Curry extremely thick-creamy-greasy food, and it also isn't watered down. I was so glad to have finally found a decent Indian place in SF that compares to the Indian food in the East Bay (I'm just gonna say it now... the East Bay has better indian food overall than SF). 

WHAT I GOT:
Because this is getting long, let me just get to what I actually had while here. 
Naan (was perfect and fresh! fluffy and warm) 
Samosas - small but good 
Chicken Vindaloo Yees 
Baigan Bhartha Yeeees! 
Saag Paneer YEAAAS 
Mango Lassi - Standard 

One more thing I liked about this place is they aren't afraid to spice your food if you ask for it. I asked for Spicy and spicy is what i got! The only other comparable Indian restaurant in SF that I found thus far was in the Outer Sunset. So this is the real deal. Your taste buds AND wallet will thank you.
author: Thielson D.

description: I really like the food but the manger or may be he is cashier is sooo rude and very lazy to tell what is the best items in a menu I asked him a very simple question and he being soo rude
author: Rahul P.

description:
4.5 Stars 

What a delightful find courtesy of Yelp yet again! 

We needed a place to grab a bite before bar crawling in the Tenderloin/Union Square area. After some research Chutney stood out as the clear winner. 

I decided to get the Chicken Jalfrezi special that night. Man, did it pack a punch of flavors. There was such a great deal of intricacies happening in my mouth that I didn't know what to make of what I was eating. All I knew was the heat was addicting, it was savory and made me want to go back for more. 

Everything is a la carte so make sure to order a side of rice or naan. I loved that they make each naan to order and even offer special options. In addition to that, the rice itself is great. There is a good amount of flavor to the rice without overwhelming and it was cooked well. 

Portion for both the rice and dish was quite good and easily satisfied my hungry. The price was also reasonable for what you get. 

Overall Thoughts

I am glad to find a place that sticks to their roots and not afraid to push the boundaries of flavors
author: Eddie W.

description: I love the fact that they have many fish items and their tandoori fish is something to die for and the garlic naan is amazing as well. I have also tried their chicken biriyani, sheekh kebab. The biriyani was cooked differently at different times since I go there often. Sometimes it was dry and tasteless and other times it was flavorful and tasty. Their restaurant is cleaner than Lahore karahi and Salimar. People who work here has this weird attitude which I hate. Otherwise it is okay.
author: Nujhat Nashia R.

description: Best curry in town. Today the have the trout. Real fresh and tasty. Eggplant is delicious as usual. Goat curry had to be taken home. No room.
author: Ed S.

description:
This review is years overdue. I have been dining at Chutney longer than I will admit to. I used to work around the corner from here and went twice a week for several years. I have had almost everything on the menu with the exception of the briyanni and the tandoori's. I am sure they are both good I just prefer the saucey stuff. There has never been a dish I have had here that hasn't caused to me to lick the plate. 

Keep in mind this is no Dosa or Amber India. It is just divie and delicious.

As of September 5,  2016 the interior has been remodeled. Food is just as great, but now decor is a little nicer. New paint, chairs, and tables.
author: Angela P.

description:
Oh yes... Oh yes.

On a block FULL of Indian restaurants - this is the one that stands out. No wonder the other Indian restaurant next door got converted into a chicken wings joint.

OK let's be clear here - If you're expecting absolute cleanliness and great customer service... YOU SHOULDN'T BE AT A CHEAP INDIAN FOOD RESTAURANT! Yeah, this place looks crappy and smells funny (depending on the day it could smell real funny). BUT - If you want cheap, quality food that makes your eyes teary because you asked for "mild" and you got super-spicy, come on right in! You'll be coming back for more!

Dishes are under $10 and full of flavor. Seriously though, be careful what you wish for when you say "I want it spicy, please". I'm a big fan of the chicken biryani here and order it with a side of raita, and the chicken tikka massala is great every time with that side of garlic naan!

Tip: Go to the back for free chai tea.
Tip 2: Whatever you're wearing there... Throw it in the washing machine right after you leave. You can't smell it on you, but everyone else can.
author: Nizar S.

description:
I've been coming to Chutney ever since the early 2000's.  The price has increased steadily over the years (just like everywhere else), but the quality has been pretty even for me.  I like their food because it seems that the spice is still there, not the spiciness, but the overall richness and complexity of the food.  And not all dishes are executed equally, if you come here, I would recommend that you avoid Chicken Tikka Masala and go for Nihari and Vindaloo and Bengen Barta instead.  The food still satisfies me, the price and value are still hard to beat.

Love the free chai too.  If you need libation, just get yourself a bottle of cheap beer from the convenience store across the street.  If you want a posh date-y place, this ain't it unless your date is the cool and not afraid of something a little urban.  But a good place to have an honest meal w/ friends in this expensive city.
author: Jj S.

description:
Even though it's a scary world outside of the restaurant, inside it's surprisingly clean and cheery. The food is affordable and tastes way better than my usual chain Naan and Curry. The workers are friendly and even put a plate of lettuce, onions, and tomatoes and a pitcher of water upon choosing a desired seat. 

We ordered lamb tikka masala, chicken korma curry, Lamb Seekh Kabab, one plain naan, one garlic naan, and Rice Pullao. This was enough for 3 people (we had 2) so we had to pack some to go! The tikka masala curries are always a favorite and the lamb was so tender and flavorful. The Chicken korma curry also had tender chicken and the curry was filled with many different spices but just wasn't my taste. The lamb kabab wasn't that special to me either and wouldn't recommend it if we have the same type of taste. The naans were nice and fluffy and I especially love the garlic naan. Lots of bits and pieces of roasted garlic. Yum! Everything else was delicious! 

There's also free milk tea at the back. You pay after you eat.
author: Lauren K.

description: Good and wholesome Indian cuisine. We had tika masala - chicken and the prawns - 2 dishes. Naan and the garlic naan is saved for our friend who will arrive in one minute - smells potent. All the food was well made. Tea that they had for post-meal satiety was so good. Perfect for this rainy afternoon outing down in the city of San Francisco.
author: H K.

description: The best indian restaurant I ve been on san francisco . Very affordable and yummy, the people who work here are nice too. Masala is must try, and they serve salad from the house. Go there veey often!
author: Nashua J.

description:
(Rating: +++ is perfect)
Atmosphere++:

Service+++:
Friendly
Free Chai is nice service.

Value+++:
inexpensive
_________________
Chicken Saag++:
It was so healthy. What many spinach!  

Tandoori Chicken++:
 The lamb was well done, so it dried out a little bit . 
 
Salted Lassi++:
This was the first time to try, which was so herbal and tasty.
author: Hiromi S.

description: This place is really 10 Stars not only is the food next level amazing. I mean like take the best Indian food you've ever had and times it by a hundred. The portion the perfect the flavors a savoury succulent sensational and spectacular. And the best part is they can literally make food tailored to your taste buds. For example if you like food lukewarm they'll make sure the food doesn't come out as hot. If you like it spicy they'll make sure you need bread Water Ice and the fire department. If you want your food super flavorful they can do that. And then to top it all off you get the most amazing milk tea (Chai) that is on planet Earth. And it's not like it's an upcharge anything this is free F-R-E-E. You can go and have as much as you like no one's going to be over your shoulder trying to stop you from getting refills.
author: Ras U.

description:
For the price, it is incredible. Definitely worth the 25 point Zagat food rating it received.

Sort of a self-service where you walk up to place an order and are given a number where the waiter brings out your food. Carls Jr. style.

I really think the Chicken Tikki Massala and Chicken Briyani were amazing. Really good.
Complimentary tea was served.
Naan is huge and fresh. Samosas are great too.

One of the best small restaurants in the area for sure.
author: Kay K.

description:
Better value

Open to Midnight!

Free chai!
author: BigJohnS F.

description: Delicious, reliable and consistently scrumptious! We began coming here for Ramadan and now we're hooked. I had only eaten Arabic food before, but this has enough of a variety to ease me into my first Indian/Pakistani dish. The Chana masala is soooo good.
author: Sarah Y.

description:
I'm not a negative person and not the kind of writing reviews... but after this bad evening i felt i had to!
we have been there for the dinner with my freinds the food really bad! nothing indian and pakistani just like [--] served on plates! i took a combination wich couldn't eat (it was so bad) my freinds had fajitas, he finished it, result: sick the whole day!!! If you really want to have some indian and pakistani then at less, avoid this one!
And very bad customer service and resturant smell so bad.
author: Tahir P.

description:
Best Indian food in SF. We've never lived or worked in the Tenderloin and yet we make regular trip to the neighbor just to go to Chutney. (We finally broke up with Pak Wan on 16th and Valencia after 5 years of decline. Al Hamra didn't quite fit the bill.)

Excellent CTM like many other Indian/Pakistani places, but Chutney's Benghan Bharta is the star: it's best Benghan Bharta I've ever had. Great spice combination and perfect amount of cream.

Gobi Ghohst (sp?) is my husband's favorite and it's not on too many menus in the city. It's a lamb cauliflower dish.

Palak paneer is, well, not as good as saag paneer. I'd skip it. We need to start ordering other menu items not just favorites. What the word for being "stuck in rut on top of the world?"
author: Ana D.

description:
Ridiculous customer service. They shouldn't have someone on phone who is hard of hearing. I am not making it up.

I called to place a delivery order and the person answering the phone didn't even take my address. I called a second time and he said he is hard of hearing. 

I went there in person to pick it up and they just leave all to-go orders lying on one desk. You have to go identify your food on your own amongst all the to-go orders. 

What a shifty customer service. Pathetic.
author: Sahil B.

description:
I have been going to this place for more than 3 years, this place is most authentic Indian food.
Still the food very tasty and delicious.
Affordable price and great food.
author: Mohammad Z.

description: I usually come here for my curry fix. Its usually pretty good but last night I got my usual two lamb tikka masala it was either really bad or the last of the pot . It was sour and the flavor was disgusting . By far the worst tikka masala I've had . My fiancé had the prawn masala which came out ten minutes later tasted right and good . I think they messed up on our order real bad . This might be the reason why I find a new curry place
author: d n.

description:
Eating here I've witnessed Blatant discrimination of LGBT customerson on enough occasions that I won't be going here anymore. 

It's nearly 2017 guys not 500a.d.  time to get over your religious supremacist bullshit and it's time for us to stop tolerating it.  I encourage everyone to boycott this restaurant this kind of hatred should have no place in our city.
author: John W.

description:
Their chicken tikka masala has the perfect balance of sweet, savory, and spicy. I didn't care for the huge chicken chunks, they were a little dry.  I ordered a side of rice, which was so flavorful and delicious.  They give you a big portion, so you'll most likely take some to go. 

TIPS:
- It's located in a shady neighborhood. This is not an ideal first date restaurant. Unless you want a reason for your girl to clutch onto you a little harder, then go right ahead. ;)
- You order your food at the register, and they give you a number. Sit down anywhere and they'll bring your food to you. Then go back to the register to pay. 
- The to go containers are in the back, near the kitchen.
- Wear your ugly clothes to this restaurant. Because you will smell like bbq and curry for the rest of the day.
author: Nari C.

description: I am not a fan. They food is bland and not spicy at all.  In my opinion this is not authentic Pakistani or Indian food. There sauces at watered down and old.  I don't know why they cheap out on the sauces.  Never eating here again.
author: Faraz S.

description: Good food, service is a bit bad. Not to be racist, but the Indian guy at the register maybe the owner he's kind of rude, the Mexican workers/servers they're nice. The food yeah it was better then the service the beef nahari is really good with the naan. The briyani  it was eh, it was really moist not bad but have had better. Kind of cool they give you some chai at the end it's free, self served. This place is in the heart of Frisco, if you catch my drift.  Parking if you don't find street parking(it's in the city if you find it you're lucky) they have parking on the side of chutney it's $10.
author: Sharifa P.

description:
This place should be primarily known for their Brain Masala (goat/lamb brain)/demagh/mughas/bejha. For $10 you get an entire place filled with brain, no fillings, no special funny stuff, all brain. This dish has more than a kick, it'll initiate that first sweat which will turn into a waterfall (jk maybe i just have a bad sweating problem). 

Their chana and karahi is also very good here. I think the chicken tikka masala is overrated, samosa is pretty good, mango lassi, and they take debit/credit with no minimum.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
I like the dishes here.Reasonably priced.Freshly cooked.
Great place to have to-go dishes.
author: R P.

description:
I picked this place because I really enjoyed the food at Pakwan Restaurant in Mission and so was really craving Indian food. But Pakwan was too far from me and this was a fairly close restaurant with a good priced menu and lots of Yelp reviews, so I tried this place out. 

I like that it is self service: you order at the counter so you don't have to pay extra tip. The food was around $10 or less, which is great. I was disappointed with the portion sizes though. I finished my whole entree...which could either mean I was an extra fatty that day or portion size was indeed small. I prefer to believe the latter ;) 

I got the lamb biryani which was spicier than the same dish I got at Pakwan. Personally, I like a milder dish so I liked Pakwan's better. But if you like a spicier dish, Chutney's is for you.

All in all, compared to Pakwan, I definitely prefer it a lot more than Chutney. The prices were great, atmosphere was lively, and the portion sizes were big. I just wish it was closer to downtown SF!
author: Vio C.

description:
Situated literally across the street from Shalimar, I'd imagine there's a serious turf war going on similar to that of Pat's and Geno's in Philly. Arrived here half an hour before closing and ordered the naan, chicken tikki masala, and lamb biriyani. It was BOMB and as fresh can be. 

chicken tikki masala - creamy, buttery, and super flavorful from all the spices. PERFECT pairing with a naan to sop up every last drop of grease :P

lamb biriyani - melt-in-your-mouth pieces of tender lamb on a delicate bed of rice, simmered with Indian herbs, onion, and garlic. I only wished the plate was bigger!

I'm gonna stop writing and head there right now. Meet you by the COMPLIMENTARY CHAI table!
author: Darren L.

description:
Solid Indian food. My first time here was in 2011, and Chutney has become an obligatory pit-stop to grab some delicious garlic naan and Palak Paneer while in town. The classic Chicken Tikka Masala is a solid one, if you're not feeling too adventures. Haven't had anything that I didn't like, so with that said, just get whatever you're craving, or pick something you've never tried before. 

Chutney will not disappoint you!

They have free Chai that you can drink prior, during, and after your meal. All in all, a really good restaurant that will make you want to come back.
author: Sina N.

description:
Horrible Place:( 





I ordered Chicken Kabab Wrap and ordered no spicy but they give me spicy very spicy 




Cashier so mean and rude
author: Damir R.

description: $42 of take out later, I find out the Curries have no protein - they are just sauce with a little scrap of protein. Never again.
author: Anna M.

description:
Came for quick takeout and was pleasantly surprised. 

So I initially ordered a mango lassi and an order of samosas. While waiting, I watched one of the chefs make a keema naan and knew I had to try it. So I asked if I could change my order and did with no questions asked and then patiently waited. After about 5 mins, i received my order and the server said he added on the samosas as well. So obvs an extra star for kindness and free food!!

Also obvs waaaaay too much food for 1 gal, but I went for it. I'm so glad I ordered the naan bc the samosas were terrible! So oily and too much bland potato mixture. 1 bite and I was done. But, wow the keema naan definitely made up for it. The keema was perfectly spicy, favorable and evenly distributed in the naan. Also the mango lassie is amazingly decadent and a great drink/dessert. 

So why only 3 stars?? Free food is money, but only if it's actually good. Also the restaurant was filled with smoke from the kitchen. Just in the 5 min I was there, my eyes were watering and my clothes smelled like they had been in a terrible fire. 

Bottom line, worth a try, but maybe call ahead for takeout and skip the samosas.
author: Vaish P.

description:
I came to this place after reading the reviews on here... I have to say, I'm glad I tried it out but it's now a place I can place on my list of "do not return". 
aloo naan was ok but smelled and tasted burnt, although it wasn't
veggie samosas were excellent perfect flavor and spice
chicken tikka masala was horrible, chicken was dry and the sauce didn't have a good flavor either
only thing I would order again is the veggie samosas
author: Marley M.

description:
Great Indian spot in the TL and they're open pretty late too. 
-Tandoori meats are awesome. 
-Chicken tikka masala is my general go to. --Aloo ghobi and Chana masala are excellent as well. 

Don't forget to snag some plum sauce and green sauce from the back fridge if you dine in.
author: De B.

description:
This place is without a doubt the worst Indian food I've ever eaten. Ever. 

I came here with high hopes, after being slightly disappointed with the Indian fare at another popular SF spot. I knew it was a hole in the wall, and honestly that is an advantage in my book because it speaks to the restaurant's authenticity. Or so I thought...

My partner (who was born and raised in India) and I came in somewhat late and were encouraged by the large crowd in the restaurant. That's usually a good sign! We ordered at the front counter and the guy taking our order was really friendly. We ordered the chicken tikka masala and bhindi gosht (lamb with okra). Our food came out within 10 minutes of ordering, along with a couple of naan and some raita on the side. 

The chicken tikka masala looked good but was bland, bland, bland. Besides a slight spicy (hot) kick, it tasted like chicken that had been plopped into some cream. The chicken itself was dry as a bone and not chicken tikka, which is normally what you see in chicken-based curry dishes (especially a dish called chicken TIKKA masala). The dry chicken was especially difficult to choke down as we had not received water or anything to drink at all. 

My partner's lamb with okra was very bland and tasted like plain stewed okra with lamb meat. The okra was limp, slimy, and cooked to the point where it was beyond mushy. There was very little spice to it at all. He is usually the type to finish any dish even if it is mediocre, but he left over half of the serving untouched. 

All in all, I would recommend that people go elsewhere. I don't care that the food isn't really all that authentic- I know everyone has their own take on certain recipes. But the food here was bland, heavy, and left us wishing we had eaten elsewhere. The whole area is chock full of Indian restaurants. I suggest choosing one of the others- any of them- besides this one!
author: Kate B.

description: I used to like their service, but tonight I found a chewed gum inside their bread /Nan, I was about to through up. I can't eat here anymore.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Came here on a busy Saturday night with some of my good friends craving Indian food. The restaurant was busy but I guess we came at the right time as tables were open without any wait. My group of 5 decided to order family style and share all of our dishes. We decided to order the Chicken Tiki Marsala, Aloo Vindaloo (I love the name of this dish!), Aloo Ghobi, Lamb Biryani and Bengan Bharta with Garlic, Keema  (beef), Onion and plain Naan. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Chicken Tiki Marsala: Delicious as usual. Probably the most popular Indian dish and this place makes it to perfection. Creamy sauce, perfectly seasoned and chicken wasn't over cooked. Highly recommended if you are new to Indian food or don't feel adventurous ordering Lamb.  

Lamb Biryani: Holy crap this was spicy. I have a low tolerance for spiciness but I took a few bites and I was sweating and panting. I had to refill my cup with milk tea 2 or 3 times to counter the capsaicin in my mouth. However, of all the dishes we ordered, this was the best and had the most powerful seasoning. You could definitely taste each unique herb and spice placed in the dish and the lamb was delicious without any gamey taste. 

Bengan Bharta: YUM! Who would think eggplant could be prepared so well? The dish is a puree of eggplant and other veggies into a paste or thick salsa like texture which goes perfectly with the Naan. Lots of flavor and I liked the texture. 

Aloo Ghobi: This dish was quite flavorful and the texture of the cauliflower was perfect. A good alternative if you don't like the saucy curry to dip your Naan in. 

Aloo Vindaloo: Although I love the name, the dish was subpar. This was the only dish I didn't like because it was very bland. The curry had no taste and we had to add salt. I'm not sure if they forgot to add seasoning or if the dish is purposely bland but I probably wouldn't order this again. 

Garlic, Keema  (beef), Onion and plain Naan: all were good but I probably wouldn't spend extra on the Keema (Beef) Naan next time. The dishes come with enough flavor and doesn't need beef to compliment an already delicious dish. Garlic was my favorite but when it comes to Naan, everyone has their own favorites. 

**********************************************************************
Overall, excellent service and great good. Unlimited milk tea which I love. The secret to the optimal sugar-tea ratio is one full cup to two table spoons of sugar. Although the milk tea runs out quickly, the waiters are very efficient in refilling without much wait time. Also the waiters and cashier are extremely polite and nice. They aren't afraid to recommend dishes if you're indecisive. Many of the Indian restaurants I've been to have had unfriendly workers but not this place. As for the food, Chicken Tiki Marsala,Lamb Biryani and Bengan Bharta are highly recommended. Solid 4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Never again. -5000000 stars!

Would you imagine HATING a place because the workers are SOOOO RUDE.

I ordered Chicken Tika Masala, the order came literally very very small and few 
pieces of chicken in a huge plate fall of sauce!!!!!

seemed like I'm ordering sauce 
Instead of apologizing, the rude workers said "Oh that's how it is" 

Never again/ Never again
author: Mahmoud Z.

description:
3.5 stars
You order, pay and sit down.

Had the chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, garlic & cheese naan, and lamb vindaloo.  The tikka masala is creamy and good and the lamb vindaloo was nice too.  The only thing was that all the meats in the dishes were way overcooked and dry.
The garlic naan was better than the cheese naan here. 

It's a good meal for the price.
I think it's better than Shalimar across the street.
author: Heejin L.

description:
This place is DELICIOUS AND CHEAP!! There's no better combo. 

I came here with a group of 7 or 8 other people. It was a little cramped but we made it work. It's a budget restaurant with budget decor, but I can't stress enough how good the food was. I got mixed vegetable tikka masala, some pickle (saltier than other pickle I've had and a little less spicy, but good), and raita (a little watery). Others got lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and the cheese cube masala (paneer?). Everyone said it was great. We got a big basket of naan too, two vegetable biryanis, and one thing I'd plain rice. We had tons of rice left over and didn't finish the raita, but everything else was gone. 

Food came out relatively fast.

I have no idea what the difference is between Pakistani and Indian food--it seemed the same to me, but I guess I'm not really educated about it.
author: Levi P.

description:
Best Indian food ever! Grabbed a quick and delicious dinner before leaving to the airport and Wishing they would deliver to LA!!!!!! 

Five stars... Order the Chicken tikka masala, the naan and cumin flavored rice. Can't go wrong with authentic Indian food!
author: D P.

description: I really enjoy their chicken curry. The chicken tiki masala is a favorite but is a little in the creamy side for me. Great naan! Garlic naan is good.
author: Kyle P.

description: To start the cashier was rushing us to put in our order when we had 30min until closing. Then the cashier was handling food and money without washing hands. I received my food in a messy manner that it was clearly they made it in a rush and lacked flavor.
author: Tyko N.

description:
Chicken tikka masala!! And tandoori chicken- That's all I get every time.
Not too spicy, just right served with lemons and a small portion of lettuce and carrots.

Be sure to order as you walk in!
author: Anisa A.

description: Very oily, which lent some authenticity, but got sick from the food along with my other friends too. Would not recommend :(
author: Food E.

description: Ooooowooooooow lol good place great authentic Indian Paki food fresh been coming here for a while, good service as well will be back again and again :)
author: Mohammad A.

description: I was working in the area and thought I give this restaurant a try and was it great.  Ordered the Lamb Tikka Masal and the sauce was so great I cleaned the plate. Lamb was plentiful and will go back. The area is not the best but if you're close by try it if you like curry.
author: LL Y.

description:
omg the best chicken tikka masala I've ever had (I don't know if that means much haha) there's no hint of spiciness in it so add some if you need it, my only complaint is that the chicken chunks were HUGE so I had to spend time cutting them down to bite sized pieces 
I also tried the chana masala garbanzo beans, i like the sour flavor. The garlic naan was perfect but if you order online double check that you got the naan because sometimes they miss that addition (it's in a smaller print). Although it gets super busy, the cashier knows how to hold it down, good job.
author: Kathy N.

description:
Location? It's the T.L. So you can't rate these guys based on the T.L. Especially if you live in the T.L. (To that women who rated this place 3 stars because it's in her ghetto neighborhood). Enough about location concerns! 
This place is a top rated restaurant in the city with the recognition of yelp to this awesome place where they 99.9% of the time have the best meat you can buy! Grade A+ kosher&Halal.
Food taste so good!
Price that no one can beat!
Tandoori (breast), masala CTM, lamb kabob, and naun, and white rice! Num num num! Mango juice too! But I usually stick to coke Pepsi or sunkist! It's a lot of food! Too cheap I can't believe it! Best Indian restaurant in town!
author: Mahmoud A.

description:
Chutney is very close to where I live and work, and all my friends really love the place. Needless to say, I come here a fair amount of times. I enjoy getting their vegetable dishes, but I tend to order something different each time I go. 

The Chicken Tikka Masala is a favorite with my friends. I enjoy the Chana Masala, Aloo Vindaloo, and Aloo Ghobi. The garlic naan is good, but can be burnt at times. I honestly enjoy the naan at Shalimar and Lahore Karahi more than Chutney's. Actually, this is true for a lot of their dishes. However, if you have a large group, Chutney has a large space to accommodate said group. The earlier you come, the easier it is to find seating. The restaurant gets fairly crowded after 7:30.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I came here for a cheap meal while on vacation with my fiance.
After running around SF and trying more upscale restaurants, I must say that I like this place more!

The atmosphere might not be fancy, but the service is prompt. The food is SUPERB. The prices are very, very reasonable. $1 for a HUGE thing of naan? YES!

Ordering and paying are done up at the counter, but do NOT leave your food alone if you want to go ask for a to-go box at the counter. The workers will clean everything up before you can blink. I lost half a plate of chicken tikka masala that I wanted to take home. However, after overhearing me complain to my fiance about this, an employee had a fresh thing of naan made and gave it to us to take home for free as consolation. So nice!

Still, this place gets 5 stars just for being SO DANG GOOD. That chicken tikka masala will haunt my dreams forever.
author: Jaimie C.

description:
I'm a New Yorker who loves my great dives.  My fave Pho Tan Hoa place up the street (see review) was closed at sundown and I was starving.   Frankly, scared to walk the block past crack heads again.   Thankfully, I saw Chutney full of patrons that clearly braved the dangers on the street so it must be a sign.   Crowd was diverse including women who were clearly more brave than me to get tasty Indian food at this Zagats 25 food rating dive!   This was my first time so I cannot speak to the consistency of the quality.   

I had the lamb vindaloo, veggie samosa, papadam and naan.    I'm not sure why they offer free salad as it was one thing I wouldn't touch.   

If you are in NY, hit the Bukkhara Grill lunch buffet in midtown.  It's the place for "in the know" lovers of Indian buffet.  Very high quality.
author: Loc V.

description:
One of the most authentic Indian Food restaurants - actually it is Pakistani but same as North Indian food. Of course till not too long ago both countries were the same country. Indian Food is not divided between borders rather regions like North and South. Anyway, this restaurant serves one of the best tasting North Indian food. I have been going there now for 10+ years. The owners and the staff are very friendly. food is always fresh and very affordable. Just last night we went as party of 5 after work. For one person it was his first time. We had Kabobs (both Chicken and Beef), Daal, Chicken Karahi and Brain Masala. 
Food was served hot and tasted very fresh. I highly recommend this place and all of my group want to go back. Good job Chutney folks!
author: Edward N.

description: I usually go to Pawkan and their food and service is great. I decided to try this one and I'm sure I'm never going there again. I ordered $40 worth of stuff to go and they told me it'll take about 20min. I'm waiting right there and I see the food got ready but obviously I don't know that's my order so I'm still waiting, after 30min I approach and they hand me the one that's been sitting there for 15min. After I come home I notice they gave me 2 less Naan like are you freaking kidding me. This is just horrible service. Never again.
author: Amit K.

description:
I did not like this place at all.

Food was high volume and flavorless

The order takers were rude

Dirty place

Packed with tables, no place to move

No sweeteners

Never going back
author: Hemant D.

description:
Okay, so this place came as a recommendation. And while the food overall was good and cheap, there were a few negative things that stuck with me. The samosas lacked flavor and weren't crispy enough. And they ran out of dessert. While it was Christmas Day and very crowded, Indian dessert seems like a staple. 

However the chicken tikka masala and paneer tikka were very flavorful. And the rotis were v big and fresh, and bihriyani rice was full of flavor. 

Oh it's byob, but there's a beer/wine store across the street in case you aren't prepared (like me)!
author: Leena K.

description:
Lol the host was adorable! I was gonna tip but he said that was unnecessary. What? Haha. 

Clean space, tables well arranged. Very busy but they work in a very efficient way!

The food is absolutely delicious!!

I normally don't respond well to exotic food but I fell in love with the chicken tikka masala with the naan immediately! Must try!
author: Iris H.

description:
Watch out for your bill, make sure you use your own calculator .
3 separate times the cashier added $ 10-20 
Over the amount , when confronted they always come up with a lame excuse.
I asked why don't you use the cash register , his answer always the same its slow.
Over all the food is good, but will never go back .
author: Ayman S.

description: Not the spiciest lamb vindaloo but very tasty with garlic naan.  Fast, efficient and tasty.  What I want in fast Indian food.
author: Doug S.

description:
Okay so mediocre, good at best.
I was blown away when I ate here in 2010. I was unhappy with both my visits in 2014. It's just sad how the quality of food dropped. Almost like the chef forgot to love his job while he was doing it.
The naan is soft and fantastic that gets 5 stars. But if you own an Indian restaurant then knowing naan is not called art at all. The curries were fine. I ate without complaint but it was not spectacular. Not even great.
author: Neha K.

description:
I went to this place so excited and left totally unsatisfied. Granted, this was probably my 3rd or 4th time eating Indian cuisine so I'm no expert on how the best should taste.
