However, I felt like Chutney prepared their food half-heartedly and the ingredients used to prepare the dishes weren't that fresh.

I tried four things from here; the garlic naan, the chicken tikka masala, the lamb boti and the palak aloo methi. My "favorite" dish was probably the palak aloo methi, which was spinach cooked with potatoes. I used the garlic naan to mop up the spinach and made vegetarian tacos. I know, genius right? The chicken tikka masala and lamb boti was nothing to rave about. I know I'm going against the grain here but the chicken was chewy and rough to eat. It tasted like pre-boiled chicken covered in the bombay sauce - not good at all. The lamb was over-cooked and wasn't tender like I'm used to.

The prices were decent at 7-12 dollars per dish but I expected more based on the great reviews.
author: Quoc N.

description: The best place ever. Iv tried all kind of resturants u can imagin but thiss my favorite place. And it deserves 10 stars
author: Hamzah A.

description:
Worse Chicken Tika Masala and Naan I've ever had! They even ran out of Samosas. Would never eat here again or recommend. :-(

The chicken Tika Masala had no spice at all, just sweet. Oh it did have a nice hair in it!

The Naan was just awful and think.

The bathroom is disgusting!

I'm very disappointed at all the other people who have posted such high reviews about this place. My friend and I are really curious if you've ever eaten good Indian food before. We only came here because of the reviews. We were misled and are very sad since Indian is our favorite food. We have had such a wonderful day and now we are leaving the city with disdain!
author: Wyndy G.

description: My family & I have been coming here for almost a decade, and honestly - nothing beats Chutney. We have tried Indian food in San Jose, LA, and even overseas, yet nothing compares to how delicious the plates you get served here. Don't expect to have your Michelin dish here, but you'll definitely taste authentic Indian food that's well prepared. Also, I've tried Pakwan & Shalimar that are within close proximity to this restaurant, and they don't come close to Chutney. The complimentary chai is definitely a plus & a nice way to end or start your meal.
author: Nour A.

description: Our office ordered from here for everyone. All the curries and daals had a copious and disgusting amount of oil in it - imagine an entire 1/4 inch layer of it on top. No flavor. The samosa was undercooked. And to top it all off, I found two hair in my naan and samosa. Had to throw it away and get another lunch from somewhere else. I'm so disgusted.
author: Raj K.

description:
1 star for the free Chai. . .it was good
2nd Star for the Rice. . it was good

After eating at this place, by the time I got back to my hotel, about 10 min. away, I had to run to the bathroom.  The food was really greesy and I felt so full after eating here. Not good. . .not good at all.
author: Louise G.

description:
My favorite Indian/Pakistani restaurant. The food is flavorful, comes out fast, and their prices are affordable.

You order your food first at the register, they give you a number, grab a seat, and they'll serve you the food at your table. When done eating, you go back to the register and pay w/ your number.

Water is self-serve, meaning you get your own water. The servers will not put water on the table for you.

What I normally would order here:
- Chicken Tikki Masala curry ($7.99)
- Rice Pullao: saffron flavored basmati rice ($1.99)
- Naan: wheat bread cooked in clay oven ($1.00)
- Keema Naan: naan stuffed w/ spicy ground beef ($2.99)

This is not a fancy or nicely renovated restaurant, but the food here is delicious and I would recommend anyone to come here for Indian/Pakistani food.
author: B. R.

description: nice place just like back home food , i love it will come again , spicy chink bbq fresh bread everything just nice
author: Omar N.

description:
There was a lot of hype around going to chutney when I visited SF. Unfortunately I didn't meet my expectations. I expected a busy and crowded restaurant since it was Christmas Day and we didn't get a table till 930 after waiting for over 30 mins. On the plus side there was a beer store across the street so we bought some and drank while waiting in line. 

Onto the food...which was nothing out of the ordinary. To start the samosas weren't good at all. The crust was very soft and the filling was not tasty at all. We ordered chicken tikka and paneer tikka masala. The at the counter said they had different tastes and he was right! The sauce of the chicken had this smokey flavor which was great. Paneer was standard. The veg biryani was okay quite oily though. On the plus side, the roti was gigantic! Definitely something to get. We were told they ran out of kheer and gulab jamun which are dessert staples for Indians. 

Overall, this place wasn't any different than other Indian restaurants I have dined at. For me, the samosa is the benchmark good for determining the quality of the restaurant and here it didn't not taste good.

Very cheap food for the portions so that's a plus.
author: Salil K.

description:
Consistently, one of the best Indian food places in town...clean place, well priced, great for take out, or for eating at....some of their good dishes are -

 1. Chicken or Lamb Saag
 2. Yellow Daal Fry
 3. Tandoori Fish
 4. Naan

I also like the people who work there...thanks guys for the awesome job that you all do !!!
author: Raj D.

description:
BYYYY far my most favorite Indian restaurant in SF!!!!!!

I stumbled across this place on yelp after telling my mom how bomb indian food and telling her how she must try it. Ever since then, I always come here when I'm craving indian food when I'm around the area. 

Can't ever go wrong with their chicken tikka masala and their naan and of course the mango lassi!

Service can be a bit slow sometimes because it is always packed here but it's absolutely worth the wait!
author: Kelly L.

description: When my favorite Indian place in the Tenderloin closed, I found this spot.  Nothing fancy, but the food was fresh and tasty.  However, the naan and roti was a little dry.
author: Glenn H.

description: Amazing food and delicious Kabab as well as mint chutney my amazing experience in this restaurant very nice staff
author: Syed A.

description:
Moved to this city recently and tried chutney after reading many reviews:

Tandoor: Got Chicken Leg and Seekh Kabob. Chicken was great but lets not discuss Seekh kabob. It can be done better. The meat felt it was under cooked. 

Curries: CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA was amazing. We had their Jalfrazi and it was great too. 

Dessert: Mango lassi was NOT good. It felt that the yogurt had gone bad. I asked the guy at the counter and he gave me a refund.

Seating is adequate and as most reviews said that it is cleaner that most Indian/Pakistani places. They are few more restaurants nearby so we will give them a shot as well.
author: Begum L.

description:
Solid, good Indian food.

If you are ever in the TL/Nob Hill/Tender Nob area and looking for a fulfilling and affordable meal, go here! Additionally, it has a clean, comfortable atmosphere.
author: Nicolette S.

description:
So this place is really really good for the price not the cleanest spot but the food was awesome I can't lie and super cheap the chicken tikka Marsala is bomb like everyone says 
I say drop in and try it out it's worth a visit
author: Anthony A.

description:
My friend and  I were lucky enough to stumble upon this jewel. I have been here 3 times this week and food is consistently satiating my appetite. Even if I have to walk through tenderloin area dodging urine and flies it worth the trek. Opens late and is usually packed for late dinner.

Chicken tikka masala best I've ever had ate my fingers because i ran out of naan( MUsT ORDER)
Lamb biryani tender, aromatic ,spicey (GET)

Chicken boti bit to dry for my taste(good portion though)
Lamb curry while the lamb fell off the bone and felt it was bit flat in flavor

I'm going to rank the Naan bread
Aloo naan(the potatoes complimented the curry harmonously) 
onion nan(sweet and tastey),garlic nan(wish it was more garlicky)

Mango lassi deliciously sweet only complain if it was chilled longer

Two host up front are super nice (guy who wears the hat), price are cheap, tables are clean, free chai tea, and that squirt bottle with that mint sauce is amazingggggggg.
author: Harrison P.

description: I am from Los Angeles and honestly best Pakistani I ever had! Very happy that my friend brought me here
author: Kathleen Y.

description:
We got the lamb biriyani, chicken tikka masala, aloo ghobi and two naans. The food here is definitely a step up from naan-n-curry and I like that it's not as chocked full of large pieces of inedible spices that I have to spit out.

Everything here tasted great. The naans were large and fluffy; the chicken tikka masala, well, I can dip bread in that sauce all day. The rice in the biriyani was el dente and they actually had a few large pieces of damn yummy lamb in there. The potato in the aloo ghobi was waxy and creamy and the cauliflower was tender but not too mushy.

Next time, i'll probably do a takeout order. It's not exactly the cleanest of restaurants and can get loud.
author: Alice W.

description:
I haven't eaten Indian and Pakistani food before. When I studied in San Francisco, I met some Saudi and Lybian friends. They took me to Chutney Restaurant. I want to recommend this restaurant because the food here is awesome. When I went to Chutney, there was a long line outside. I asked my friends for the best food suggestions. They recommended chicken masala and naan. 

The first time I saw chicken masala, it reminded me of chicken curry in my country. Chicken masala is an orange color same color as chicken curry in my country. However, it is better. A taste of chicken was tasty. The masala sauce was creamy. It was marvelous. Moreover, I ate chicken masala with the naan. Naan is a type of bread. It was crispy because they made naan in the oven. When I ate naan with chicken masala, the taste of the naan was soft and juicy. 

One more thing I like about this restaurant is the sauces that I ate with. They have 2 sauces. One of the sauces is a green color. It was not too spicy, not too salty and not too sour. They mixed the ingredients together and it was very good. Another sauce is brown color. It was sweet, but not too sweet. I like to eat both together. 

After that I went to Chutney again and tried more food. I recommend that you bring your friends because you can order different dishes. I love Chutney!
author: Nin N.

description:
"I wanna tell you something that you prolly should know

This that Slumdog Millionaire Bollywood flow

And uuuuuuhhhhh, 

My real yelp friends never hearin' from me

Fake yelpers write the wrong answers on  yelp for me

That's why I pick and choose, I don't get reviews confused

I got a small circle, I'm not with different crews

We walk the same path, but got on different shoes

Eat in the same spots, but we got different views.."


Similar to Drake flows, Chutney is a pretty popular spot for Indian Cuisine.  I needed to check it out for myself.  So I walked up to the counter for the cashier to take my order.  Not formal at all, simple process, order food at register, they bring the food to your table.

Here's what I ordered:

Naan:  Just simple bread, kind of like pizza crust without anything on top. 

Chicken Biryani:  Wonderful spicy fried rice with chunks of chicken.  It was great.  Just hope I don't get heart burn.. Check back in three hours.

Seekh Kabab: meaty, savory stick of joy, like a sausage but not..

Tandoori Chicken: A flavorful chicken breast cooked in the clay oven.


There wasn't much to service or a formal waiter. You order, they bring it.   For me it's all about the Seekh Kabab and Biryani.  Just spicy and delicious.  From my view, Chutney makes good Indian cuisine at a fair price.

A lot of times when people think of Indian food.  They think curry.  I'm not a big fan of curry myself.  The strong scent and flavor isn't my favorite.  But to think Indian cuisine is only curry isn't accurate.  It's so much more and all you got to do is check it out for yourself.
author: Michael L.

description:
I came here with my dear friend (who comes several times a week) and we dined very well. 

I got the veggie marsala with naan & she had chicken marsala. The Indian tea (tea +milk) was very tasty once I added sugar. 

I like the concept. Order. Eat. Pay. Leave.
author: Court S.

description:
The tandoori chicken here was awesome.  Buttery enough to be a guilty pleasure, but a pleasure none-the-less.  The owner even offered to give me extra rice on the house.  

One thing that I will always remember is that after I left, the owner followed me out and asked if I had paid.  I was confused since I paid with credit card and he apologized when I explained to him that I paid before I sat down.  I guess most people pay after in cash.  

However, he did redeem himself a little by chasing me down a second time to return the sunglasses I forgot.  

On the food and price alone, I have to give it a 4 star review.
author: Richard T.

description: Really fast, efficient and even friendly service for a hole- in - the - wall where you order at the counter. There is no air in here so you will be stifling and freezing depending on the weather outside. Good portions and prices are hard to beat. You don't come here for the atmosphere but it's a comfortable place to eat.
author: Czarina B.

description: Yesterday I had dinner with my friend, the food so good no complain but the restaurant so dirty wall,tables and cups also I don't know if I can go there next time that was awful
author: Otto D.

description:
Wow.. this place...

I really don't like giving bad ratings but tonight I had the worst Curry I have ever had at this place.. It's way up there in my top 5 worst meals of all time too!!
I'm not particularly picky when it comes to eating out but I do have  a few simple requirements: Hot Food, clean warm restaurant and (preferably) Boneless meat. This met none of these.

After reading such good reviews here husband and I decided to give it a try being huge Indian and Curry fans. I really cannot understand why so many people rate this food so highly, the only thing I can think is that those that enjoy the food don't know any better.

The 'restaurant' (I use that term loosely) was freezing cold even sat there wearing 3 (yes 3 one being my winter coat!) layers. It's also more like a take out that the owners just put a few tables in to make it dine in.

We ordered our food and although it wasn't on the menu my husband asked for a Chicken Madras. The guy at the till said this was fine. 

When our food came the 'Madras' was actually BBQ Chicken according to the server. He didn't have a clue what we were talking about when we told him what it was supposed to be so my husband went for the Vindaloo instead.

The food:

My Chicken Korma (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/atXwmmJOrBLOaq-OROY2EA?userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA#gBAfUT50_AEbaBy0dhzRtQ) was not like a Korma at all. Typically it is made with yoghurt, cream or coconut milk ect and is of thick consistency. This was more like oily runny gravy and had very little flavour at all. The meat was also on the bone and pink - Yuk. By the time I had picked what little meat there was off of the bone it was freezing cold due to the temperature inside the place.
My husbands was pretty much the same maybe with a little bit more spice. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/atXwmmJOrBLOaq-OROY2EA?userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA#OwOVAG5elBYzQE0W-m3okw).

The Naan was over cooked with an odd after taste, Roti was thick and doughy and the Rice was the only thing I had no fault with but then you can't really go wrong with Rice.

Upon paying we were asked how our meal was. Although we were asked they didn't really appear to the that concerned. Ok so they took a little off the bill (like $5) but then we barely ate any of it.

Yes.. the food is cheap but the quality and taste reflects that. I can't help but think reviewers are letting the price guide how they rate this place. We won't get going back.

Parking:
There is a covered parking lot right next door (at a cost of $7 a day) that I think may even be owned by the same people but a word of warning - When my husband and I went to collect our car nobody was there. We waited almost 10 minutes for someone to come back and when they did they went straight to our car and opened the door - the key's were also left in the ignition!!! Of a brand new car!! So if you can I suggest you don't drive.. or at least don't use the lot next door.
author: Emmalouise B.

description:
Omg they do take outs too!
I love their food!
Sadly it did take a while to get my take out , but you can have Chai tea while you wait, and that's if you dont get completely convinced to stay more due to the delicious smell of the food!
I have been eating here very often; but I will start doing take outs more..
author: Tatiana P.

description: There is a definitely places you just want to go to eat and nothing else. This place has a good food, I go there once a week, or once in two weeks. So the food is really good to be honest but the service needs some changes. The guys the food runners are so rude, I always want to punch them in the face. This is it, it is to you to decide, to go or not to go. I like the food they make and I go there because it reminds me The food in my country.
author: Azamat S.

description: Didn't really enjoy a lot of their food. I got the tandoori fish, lamb curry, chicken tikka and chicken biriyani. Only the tandoori fish was good (note- it's not boneless).
author: CS R.

description:
Amazing- ordered the Chicken korma- the owners son happened to be listening to us struggle what to order and he added a chicken BBQ to our order for free which was great. Rice was really tasty, the Nan was great- beer from across the street
Sketch area next to tenderloin but worth really really good and not expensive
author: James S.

description: This place was so good I almost don't want to give it 5 stars, so that it'll stay a secret.  You order at the front and have a seat.  Your food comes in a reasonable amount of time, even when they're really busy.  No frills, reasonable prices, very good quality and quantity.  Went back two days in a row on my last stay in SF.
author: Christian H.

description: Every 2 months when I come to SF on business I have to hit Chutney for a late night meal after entertaining customers. Best Indian food I have ever had. Restaurant has a very cool and casual vibe.
author: J C.

description:
Fast Friendly and delicious! You know when you're across the street from Shalimar and you're still doing great, you must be doing something right.

Give em a shot. :-)
author: Robert M.

description: We were making the rounds of Pakistani food in the Tenderloin District. We tried a whole bunch of stuff and nothing really wowed us. To be fair, we are Pakistani and have really high standards for Pakistani food. It's good but not as good as Shalimar.
author: Izzat A.

description:
This is my replacement for Naan N Curry on O'Farrell. The walk is a little farther and the streets can be scarier, but you just gotta keep your head up and walk without stopping.

I got my usual, the chicken tikka masala with garlic naan and mango lassi. Everything was great. Most importantly, my order was correct. You can also tell the food was made fresh as everything was piping hot. 

This place is not as busy as Naan N Curry, but that's probably because of the location.
author: L M.

description: Chicken tikka masala, naan, and mango lassi......what else is needed? Seating sucks here, always a crowd. Food is good nothing spectacular. Service...? What service, that is non-existing, lol.
author: Mrs. M.

description: Umm so delicious. For the price it was amazing. You get a free salad and free tea while you wait for your order to be ready.
author: Galina V.

description: Our FAVOOORITE Indian restaurant in all of the bay area. The chicken tikka is delicious and spicy, and the naan is crispy and chewy just like we like. The mango lassi is my favorite! Plus, they are open late. Definitely worth the trip from Sonoma
author: V G.

description:
on the busier side for indian restaurants in the TL

Chicken Tikka Masala - had more spice than the usual.  their breast meat is freshly grilled on a stick and put into the curry and was not as dry as other places.

Garlic Naan - fresh but not the combination of crispy and soft that i was looking for.

Mango Chutney - tried a spoon and it tasted like chemically preserved fruits.  had to stop after the first spoon.  for a place that's named Chutney, i expected more...

Free Chai Tea - scalding hot at less milky than naan and curry

overall a nice clean place for indian food in the TL, wouldn't mind comming here again and trying the more unique dishes
author: Tina A.

description:
Okay, been going here 2-3 times a week for 10+ years and finally stopped. These guys have been selling lamb meat as goat meat. 

I tried to complain about it, they did not bother to listen and claimed I was mistaken (been eating this for decades, I *think* I would know the difference!).

After the 4th time, I've taken my business to Pakwan (next door) and am pretty happy with the quality of food and the fact that they do not try to pass off stuff as something else.
author: T S.

description:
Ate there two nights ago and had the chicken tikka. The regular curry was alittle spicy but you can get it more spicy if you so desire.  I advise everyone to try the mango Lissa if you've never had it.  The Lissa compliments the curry and cools any after burn.  

The nan was great as well there were 4 of us and we each got our own curry as well as different kind of nan.  The cheese as well as the garlic nan went great with the spicy curry.  You will want more than 1 nan  per order we ended up getting another cheese nan.

Great place with a friendly atmosphere as well!
author: Anthony R.

description:
I truly do not know what to pen down in this review. Because I am so disappointed and the only word that comes to my mind, is "meh".

I have eaten at this Chutney in the past. And then I have eaten at the Chutney in Fremont. And I truly do not know what the reviewers who are giving this place anything more than a 2 star rating liken Indian/Pakistani food to be.

First of all, customer service here is a sham. We called them up last night to place an order to-go. 
Experience A) How long is your wait time for food delivery? Response - We aren't delivering tonight. Hangs up the phone.
Called back 2 seconds later.
Experience B) We'd like to place an order for pick up. Response - You know where we are located, right? Yes, I do know where you are located. "You called the Tenderloin branch. We keep getting calls but folks intend to call the other branch". Yes, I realize. 

We placedan order for 3 naans, 1 chicken seekh kebab, 1 beef seekh kebab, 1 chicken tikka masala and one matar paneer.

Walked in, paid monies, didn't see any roaches, walked out smelling like chicken tikka.
Came home, relished seekh kebabs. It was all downhill after that.

Chicken Tikka Masala - Tasted like rubbery premade chicken tikka kebabs thrown into tomato basil bisque. That's not how I remember it being. First of all, as a desi I should have known better than to order tikka masala. But come on, don't be feeding this to your patrons!

Matar Paneer - Where's the masala? Where's the gravy? Why is this even on the menu when the chefs don't know how to make it!?

The naan was not bad. A bit on the smaller side. But the taste was not enough to salvage the debacle that is the tikka masala. 

Aside from the food, what I didn't like was the fact that one of the cooks brought in a giant tub of tandoori'd chicken, only to be managing in with his bare hands. The f**k? I understand hangling uncooked meat with bare hands, because once cooked, those cooties don't stand a chance. But cooked chicken with bare hands?

Total order came to $25, which is not bad at all. But I would rather pay $100 and get served good food.

I typically don't like dishing out 2 stars to restaurants. But I truly cannot help it.
author: Ranjani S.

description: I wish I didn't have to give this one star. This restaurant doesn't even deserve that. I've been here a couple of times and that's only because I forgot how bad it was the previous time I went there. This time it was worse than the past 2 times I've been there. Their food was undercooked (naan, samosas) and it came out cold. We had to keep asking for the food we ordered because they'd forget to bring it out. It was quite busy but that's no excuse for poor service. Food is mediocre and the service is even worse.
author: Ashaba C.

description:
They dont know the difference between bhuna ghosht and goat curry ,for them its a same dish.
They also dont know how to cook chicken jalferzi.
Chicken tikka and seeikh kaboob was good.
No soap in bathrooms, also they dont accept american express credit card.
author: Shoaib A.

description:
Great indian spot, but the setup is a little odd, which is why i'm giving it a four instead of five stars.  You wait in line at the counter to order.  They give you a number and you take a seat, without paying.  The space is no frills, kind of dingy, and almost everything you touch is sticky.  Unclear whether you are supposed to set your own table and get your own water, all of which is stationed at the back of the restaurant.  I think it depends on the mood of the employees and how busy they are.  The food is relatively cheap for the portions, and delicious.  I rarely stray from chicken tikka and never regret it.

The most strange part of the dining experience was the fact that after you eat, you  pay.  Why don't they just have you pay when you order?  It's all counter service anyways.  We were pissed bc the line was out the door and we thought we'd have to wait just to pay, but the guy told us to just cut the line and pay.  So strange....but the food is good!
author: Lisa P.

description:
One of the worst food I have ever had. Coming from big curry fan, heard of this place from the review. I wish i could get a refund. We ordered, goat curry, tandoori chicken, naan, Chicken tikka, seekh kabab. First of all let me point out the goat was not goat meat, it was more like lamb or sheep pressure cooked with added spices to remove the smell. Yes lamb or sheep smells strong. Case in point Shalimar goat curry/ghost, is mind bogglingly good. Another complain was that sorry chicken tikka , too much half and half is too much half and half . Lastly seekh kabab with masala added?? Wt...
Total price was a wasteful 30$ which i would never get back. And lastly what is wrong with your chai?
author: Greg M.

description: Not bad I really enjoyed mu dinner there  I recommend for you guys its delicious and not expensive :)
author: Tahar Y.

description:
Chutney is a nice surprise deep in the heart of the 'Loin. Maybe not such a surprise since it's in the same local vicinity of Shalimar, Dottie's True Blue, and Pho Tan Hoa - all among my favorite urban dives. I can now add Chutney to this select list for serving some really terrific Indian-Pakistani dishes on par with Pakwan, Lahore Karahi, and Golden Gate Pizza & Indian Cuisine. In fact, their service model is exactly the same as Pakwan's. Go up to the counter, order, and wait at a table of your own choosing until someone legitimate takes your number away. 

As you wait, you get a pitcher of water and then a bare-bones salad of iceberg lettuce, tomato slices and sliced onion with a few wedges of lemon for dressing (see photo). It's good, and hey, it's free. My order starts to arrive. First off is the $2.99 Tandoori Chicken Leg, scorching hot but tasty-crispy-tender once the temperature climbs down (see photo). I had a $1.99 flat of Garlic Naan sprinkled with bits of cilantro (see photo). It was bigger than my hand. My main dish was not their curry (next time) but their $6.99 plate of Lamb Biryani (see photo). 

Really good stuff since it was a fried rice deep with flavor with huge chunks of tender lamb embedded in the generous mound of savory goodness. Service wasn't overly friendly but fast and efficient. Table turnover is a pretty critical component of their value proposition since the lines get long here. Expect it to be crowded, so you aren't disappointed with your first impression. It's definitely worth the breathless hike up Jones to try their extensive menu. Bargain meals of this level of quality are all too rare indeed. 

FOOD - 4 stars...savory tastiness with a Bollywood twang 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...comfortable inside, not so much outside 
SERVICE - 4 stars...fast and efficient 
TOTAL - 4 stars...really good South Asian food or a price that will please the economically downtrodden
author: Ed U.

description:
So happy I live on the same block as this yummy place. Went here for the first time last week. Shalimar is just across the street but I think this place is better. Definitely better service. And cleaner!

We had:
-Chicken Tikka Masala (yuum)
-Lamb Boti (my favorite.. soo good!) 
-Karayla Masala (bitter melon and okra.. was trying to be adventurous but not my favorite)
- side of rice and naan (pay extra)

Overall good value. It was less than $30 for everyhting. We'll be back!
author: Vol T.

description:
Large menu. Clean. Easy to order. Very reliable flavor and just plain great. 

You have your chutney lovers and your shalamar fans. Both should be similar but shalamar is a bit dirty, greasy and doesn't have such a robust menu.

It's a preference but I choose chutney each and every time.
author: Sharon S.

description:
Chutney used to be my go to clean and reasonable indian..but as i stood waiting for my to go chicken roti order i watched as the chef reached into the pre-cooked roti bucket with his bare hands and disturbed a baby roach on the rim..
Until the health dept closes them down order the pan cooked meals..lamb saag ..etc
author: chris h.

description: Love this place! Amazing tasting food, extremely clean, prompt service, and affordable!
author: Megan N.

description: Food is good, not as delicious as I was told. Worst customer service. Order taker doesn't give a crap about what is going around the table. I never seen him walking away from the desk and making sure all the clients are ok. I asked him what you guys are known for I mean what is the best dish I can try. He said everything is good with a little smirk on his face. I felt disgusted. I add more food to my order and it took them extra 30 minutes. No priority for customer waiting in table.
author: Jawad S.

description: This place is decent. Food was good and price was reasonable. I ordered chicken tikka masala, rice and naan. The rice was great. The naan was good for soaking up the sauce, but didn't have much flavor. The portion of chicken tikka masala was big, but contained mostly sauce (only four pieces of chicken). It's one of those places where you stand in line to order your food and they'll bring it to your table for you.
author: Koren Y.

description:
On the independence day on 15th and 16th of august 2015 we enjoyed at Chutney restaurants along with my family and friends we ordered and enjoyed the delicious foods  specially karhai paneer malai kofta fdaal masala biriyani, kabob naan and other sweet dishes 
me and my family enjoyed lunch and diner All items were excellent Indian mughlai taste as well as salad and Indian tea was really good 
The Taste of the all above foods was real excellent staff courtesies clean and well manner staff 
I can recammands to all Indian Pakistani people to visit  all festivals and all events 
good luck

raju raja
author: Fareed S.

description: Delishous food and friendly staff . Good bread and tasty chicken masala with lentil soup . The food prices is really reasonable.
author: Victor S.

description: Honestly this place didn't impress me at all. I remember the chicken in the tikka masala had a weird texture and the naan was dry; go over to Little Delhi for MUCH BETTER Indian food
author: Katelyn K.

description:
We ordered food to go, and my hon of hons husband double parked while I ran in to pick up our order.  As the guy was totaling it up, I noticed a cockroach on the counter.

And I ran right back out.

Gross.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Not bad for less money!! 

I ordered palak paneer and 2 tandoori rotis. Salad (onion , lettuce, lemons, tomatoes) was complimentary. I liked getting complimentary salad. Service was pretty quick and people were friendly. Size of roti was so big (around 45 centimeters diameter, I guess) that I was full in just one!! Palak paneer was fine n edible, but can be made much more better. 

I ended up paying $11 for the meal, a great deal !! Set up was that You go in, order ,get a number assigned, waiter will bring good to ur table, u pay in the end. It was good that I was asked about my experience with the food. Ambience wise, I'll say it's average.
author: Swati B.

description:
CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, NAAN and TEA.

Went back to Chutney two weeks ago, and it looked very clean, even in the corners! May have been painted too...very good! 
The food here is FANTASTIC. The tea is my favorite of all the Indian/Pakistani restaurants I've been to. Sux when they run out cause it takes so long to make more. We got Chicken Tikka Masala, naan, Lamb Seekh Kabab, rice, and eggplant. MUST get Mango Chutney if you get Lamb Seekh Kabab, they are so good together! I don't like their Saag Paneer, they purée the spinach and I don't like it that way. Everything tasted great, as usual. Was also happy with the prices! Woo hoo!
Place looked very clean and hygienic, thanks for cleaning it up guys, this is my go-to place when I want Indian food, will definitely be back again!
author: Lynn M.

description:
Some of the most flavorful biryani I've ever had, hands down. Great stuff. I could eat a whole plate on my own!

Otherwise, their food is just okay. The naans aren't quite soft or fluffy - they go stiff after five minutes on the table. All of the times I have been here, the chicken tandoori just tastes like char, not like delicious spices. 

I will commend them on charging fair  prices for their food - dinner for two with naan, chicken tandoori, biryani and okra for around $20.
author: Mira N.

description:
Famous for drug dealing, prostitution, hobos and crazy people, the Tenderloin aka "TL" neighborhood is avoided like a plague by most SF residents and tourists alike. Well, that's before they started opening speakeasy joints in the area, but I'll save that for another review.

Growing up 5 blocks from here, I never had the balls to enter the TL - yes, shocker!  My family never went there and neither did my friends.  The very first time I walked into the area was to go to Chutneys.  Located in the heart of the TL, you will never have a boring moment if you people-watch from the window.  The scene going on outside is somewhat like a soap opera and if you watch long enough, you might be able to catch a hobo fight or see a druggie getting arrested.

Now, DON'T discount this place just because of the neighborhood it's in.  Trust me, the food is worth it! Ever since B introduced me to this place, I've been back several times.

FOOD
Tandoori fish: This fish is flavored with red colored spices then cooked in the tandoori clay oven.  My dad calls it the "Devil Fish" because of the color. (He chuckles to himself when he says this). The result from cooking in the tandoori oven is a beautiful char on the skin and crispy edges while maintaining moisture inside the meat.

Chicken Tikka Masala: one of their most popular dishes, the chicken is tandoor chicken cut up into pieces and the sauce is creamier than most tikka masala's ive had.  I usually get this one spicy.

Chicken Biriyani: My favorite dish! It's a rice plate flavored with spices and onions.  The chicken in this dish is a dark meat that's always fall-off-the-bone tender. Delish!

Lamb curry: I like the flavor in the curry but the lamb was on the drier side.  I prefer my lamb with a little fat to add moisture back into the meat.

Garlic or Potato Naan: The garlic naan has little pieces of garlic sprinkled on top before it's baked; I like to get one of these and the potato naan.  The potato one has mashed potatoes and parsley inside, it works great to sop up the sauces from the curry and masala.

Chai tea: free chai!! Some people prefer not to add sugar but I'm so used to Asian milk tea that I add tons of sugar.  It really chalks up to preference.

Chutney: they offer two complimentary flavors of chutney.  One of them is a mango sauce and the other is a mint sauce.  I don't prefer the mango sauce on its own because it's too sweet for what I prefer, but if I mix it with the mint sauce it's actually pretty good.  You can find these in the soda refrigerator next to the Chai. 

SERVICE
The style is very self-serve where you order at the cashier, bring a number to your table, and the food is brought to your table.  Although I usually set the table myself, anytime I've interacted with the employees, they have been very nice and helpful.  Even if there's a huge line going out the door, the guy at the cashier who takes our order is always patient and doesn't get upset when you can't pronounce items on the menu. During the weekends, there's usually a line that goes almost out the door.  Don't be afraid! It moves really fast.

PARKING
There's only metered parking available in the area.  I'd suggest parking in front of an area with high walking traffic so it's less sketchy.  After 6pm you won't have to pay for the meters.

ONLINE ORDERING
I haven't tried this feature, but I've seen that they offer this on Yelp.  I'll probably try it next time I come.
author: Michelle W.

description: Have to say this place was better than I expected! Just ate here a couple of days ago. My friends and I came here late at night just about 40 min before closing and the food was on point! First time here so I will be coming back soon!
author: Isiah T.

description:
This place has really gone down hill from a few years ago. I came here for the first time probably in 2010. I was really pleased with the lamb saag I got back then. I thought the lamb was plentiful and the saag was flavorful and good. 

When I came back just a few weeks ago, I got the lamb curry with a side of rice. The rice was terrible. It tasted like pre-frozen, packaged rice that they re-warmed before serving to me. The lamb curry was not any better. Though the lamb was plentiful, the curry was very bland and nothing impressive. It didn't hit the spot at all.

My boyfriend got the veggie tikka masala and he said that the sauce tasted like packaged sauce as well. His naan looked burned and it was just an overall disappointing experience. 

I'm not surprised that Shalimar across the way is always busier.
author: Junel S.

description: I was searching the city for an Indian restaurant that had everything I wanted, and this one did. I ordered the chicken korma curry with garlic naan, a side of vegetable samosas, and a mango lassi. The chicken curry was absolutely delicious. The chicken was tender and full of flavor. It fell right off the bone. The samosas were crisp on the outside and fluffy and warm on the inside. The naan was fresh with a perfect mixture of crispy and plush. The mango lassi was ultimate perfection as well. The service was fast and friendly, the environment was clean and kept up, and the price was good, having paid under $20 for everything. Next time I am in the city, I will be sure to pay them a visit again.
author: Brianna R.

description:
I ate at Chutney earlier tonight after about two years (the last time the food was just average).

I had the litmus test meal for one:
- Tandoori Roti 
- Seekh (beef) kabab
- Daal Masala (Yellow chana daal)

If an Indo-Pak kitchen can't do these right, other more complex dishes will surely miss the mark.

The Roti was just average... not evenly cooked.
The seekh kabab was chewey and loaded with chillies (it was unpleasantly hot and I struggled to finish it)
The daal was heavy, full of oil. Taste OK-ish.

Congratulations Chutney, on not being the worst Indo-Pak restaurant in the 'loin. Shalimar takes that spot.
author: noflaps c.

description: I used to enjoy this place but was very dismayed the guy who runs the cash register/ manager  tried to rip me off last time I was there. I thought the total he charged me seemed like a lot. Turns out he charged me for a soda I didn't order. I asked him about it. He claimed he thought I ordered soda. I very cleary did not. Not smart,Chutney. You might have gained 2 bucks but you just lost a customer and hundreds of dollars of future business. I will never go back  to this shady place again.
author: Frank R.

description: The food is good and great value. Do not expect any service. From the owner sitting behind the counter to the  guy who brings your food they are all got soar faces. It seems your presence is a bother to them!
author: Adam S.

description:
Very good food
First time here, very busy restaurant and food is above average. I will definitely come back. Chicken messala is really good and authentic
author: Guss A.

description:
Delicious, and a great price performer. Five of us got a mountain of food to share, about 8 dishes plus naan, etc, for $81 all in.  Did not know that was still possible in the bay area.  And it was everything we could have hoped for.  I heartily recommend the gomen ghosh (? goat).  Since they take orders at the counter, you save the 4% SF waiter tax.

Helpful hint: everything is a la carte so don't forget to order everything you want when you place your order.  We realized when we were eating that we forgot raita (which was $1) but there was a line at the counter at that time so we didn't bother.
author: Doug B.

description:
The best and most reasonable Indian food in town. Keep it up guys. Tikka Marsala is the best.
Love the Garlic Naan.
author: chris n.

description:
I have several friends who really like Chutney.  The first time I tried it, I didn't love it, but it wasn't 'bad'.  Just waaaaaaay toooooooo much fenugreek in the saag (and the masala really).  It's all I could taste.  But, just figured not for me, oh well.  

Well several years later having moved into the neighborhood I figured I would give it another chance and order something else.  I got the chicken korma.  More like bone korma.  First.....I've eaten at a lot of Indian restaurants and NEVER had bones in korma, masala, or butter chicken, basically never in any dish that is really saucy.  Well good thing I didn't just bite in and I like to shred up the chicken so it can get all saucy.  I could have really hurt myself.  I would think in a dish that's all sauce you should note if there are bones.  Besides just not expecting there to be bones in it, it was a LOT of bone.  I took a photo and that's sans one bone that I tossed in the trash when I found it.  So, a good 30% of what I got was bones.  Though it turned out to be a good thing I was sorting through my food, there was a giant dark thing which I cut into and assume is the fenugreek pod.  Holy crap, glad I didn't chomp on that.  I was scared to eat after this, carefully sorting through my food and biting cautiously.  I won't go back.
author: McKenzie M.

description:
I walked in based on the high rating. As I waited for my takeout I read the reviews of the last months - they all talked of seeing roaches! :-/

I asked to pull my order and could I get my money back. No money back and no acknowledgement of the roach issue. I left without food. This is my 1st such experience. I'm thankful for the other reviews!
author: Renee H.

description:
If Meg Ryan came to Chutney she'd totally do that "yes yes yes oh my god yes YES" restaurant scene from When Harry Met Sally or Sleepless in Seattle or they're the only two rom coms I know so I hope its from one of them. 

Good, honest, authentic Indian and Paki food at insane, wacky-waving-inflatable-tube-man-outside-a-car-dealership prices. Like, 6 of us stuffed ourselves full of chicken tikka and lamb kebabs and naan and biryani for like $60. How. Does that even. Just, yes. 

Oh and you can BYO whatever booze you want. Beers go great with their spicy mint yoghurt sauce.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Chicken Korma was great, love most of the chicken dishes here that use bone-in dark meat...much more flavorful. Loved the Seekh Kebab, great whole wheat roti. Good free chai. Not sure if this place is BYOB like Shalimar, i went for lunch.
author: Brandon D.

description: For my first time eating Indian food this was a great place, I loved the garlic naan chicken tikka masala and the Bengan bharta (Mesquite smoked eggplant cooked with onions, tomatoes and spices). These 3 items were delicious but I definitely have to explore some other Indian restaurants to see if this was really the best. Overall I would definitely recommend going here.
author: Samantha J.

description:
Hi:

This was my favorite Indian Restaurant, NO LONGER.

Today at lunch, I had the Worst " Alu Gobi" EVER.  Few pieces of cauliflower and old nasty potatoes.

The Tandori breast of chicken tasted of Kerosene or cooking gas.  Was hard to eat.

Sadly, I do not think that I will return.

Could there be a new /bad chef????

ron
author: Ron M.

description:
Convenience.

General tips:
1. Walk up to the counter and place your order and take your number/tab
2. Seat yourself at any empty table of your choice
3. Food will be served 
4. Walk up to the counter after you are done with your order receipt and pay

Food - overall, this is the creamiest Indian food that I have ever eaten. 

Saag Paneer:highly disappointing. Bland bland city. No flavor whatsoever and very creamy. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: Mostly sauce and a few big pieces of chicken.  Again, very creamy. 

Mango Lassi: generous large glass for $2 - done!

Free hot chai: go serve yourself, it's in the back next to the fridge, paper cups should be next to the dispensers

Also, I suspect they might be using msg. :(

Definitely a hit or miss with the dishes so it really is all about trial and error.

I appreciate that it is clean compared to other Indian restaurants in the area.
author: Enjella L.

description:
Decided to try this place after being bored of Shalimar. 

The kabobs are excellent, but I did not like the Chicken tikka masala at all. Very bland  and tasted more like canned tomato paste and less like CTM.

Free chai is always cool.
author: Neesh Q.

description: Flavors were good. Staff friendly. But the chicken pieces were bone-in which was unexpected.
author: John C.

description: I went to chutney with my friend. Nice and serene ambience. Delicious food. Reasonable. I had their chicken biryani. It was awesome. Recommend it.
author: Tajinder S.

description:
Easily one of the best Indian & Pakistani meal you may get. Consistently delicious. 
Smell of the restaurant also boost your appetite. When they are busy its get smokey as well (actually entire block owns it's smells to quite few Indian restaurants there)  

Its a good advise to go there with clothes which already need to be washed;)
author: Lyra S.

description:
I was walking by a bustling Chutney late at night and overheard two people who just exited the restaurant raving about their food. Immediately I took quick peek at the festive ambiance, lookie lookie at their window menu and decided to join the crowd. With a hint of smoke in the air, the noise level was high as I sat among many large groups and South Asian families with small children. Their service protocol required me to stand in line to order by the kitchen and then return to the same spot to pay once the meal was finished. 

I thought my chicken tikka masala ($6.49) was fulfilling due to the thick creamy Bombay sauce with seven thick pieces of white meat chicken that embodied a faint smoky taste. The cream sauce was a bit sweeter than desired and it would have tasted better if the spices were more potent and penetrating. Luckily I asked for the dish to come spicy to meet my palate interested, and even at that the side plate of raw onions among the fresh vegetables were sharper and robust in flavor. My side order of rice ($1) was nicely seasoned and onion naan ($1.99) was a huge heaping piece of bread with nice crisp and fluffy texture.

It was overall a good portion and good value experience but I've certainly had better. I would only come back when I'm in the area and will likely to skip their curry for kabab and tandoori items instead.
author: Daniel L.

description: Good Northern Indian and Pakistan food, but not above average.  Pretty lousy neighborhood, and ambience reflects that.  No waiter service - you have to get in line and order at the counter.  On the bright side, prices are cheap and there are usually tables available.
author: Greg B.

description:
I love this place!!! It's my favorite place in San Francisco. I take every friend who visits me here, and they all love it. It's the best Indian food in the area. Get the aloo naan! It will not disappoint. 
Aziz is the best!
author: Erin D.

description:
I have gone to this restaurant a few times before, and noticed guy at the cash register is really NOT customer service material. He's progressively gotten rude over time, so much so that I feel the need to voice it on yelp. I think the food is ok but it's not good enough to be dealing with his attitude. I added two naans and a chicken wrap after our initial ordered had arrived (after 15 minutes) but it took so long that we finished the food and decided to leave, but he said they already started the food so we can't cancel. From then it took another 15 minutes for the food (two naans and wrap) to be ready -- did he lie about it....I don't know?

I won't go back again.
author: Raehaan K.

description:
I am finally getting an opportunity to write a review for Chutney.  We have been going to Chutney for about 8 years now.  It is one of our favorite hangout in SF for Indian Punjabi style food.  While it is no longer the hole-in-the-wall place anymore, we still go there whenever we get an opportunity.

My favorites are Chicken Tandoori leg, Fish Tandoori, Chicken saag, and Chicken Sheesh Kabobs.  

In the last 2 years, I have noticed that occasionally, the taste quality will go down.  When that happens, i am prompt in letting the owner/son know, and they are good about listening to my opinion. 

I have been to Shalimar restaurant too (in that area), and I prefer Chutney because the food contains less oil.  Be fore-warned that this is not a nice, quiet, sit-down kind of restaurant.  If you enjoy authentic indian/punjabi food, this is the place to go in SF.
author: Spreading The Good Word -.

description: I've been going here for years.  We loved the excellent indian-pakistani food.  I gave it a 5-star rating; we went 2-3 times per month -- for years and years.  In late 2017 we went several times and were disappointed with the food.  So I've lowered my review.  I'll take a few months off and try Chutney again in early 2018 and hope that the food is excellent again.
author: John H.

description:
Wow is all I have to say, FOOD was wonderful, owners are terrific

We had the Kabobs, Chicken Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken and Fish, Brain Masala (Excellent), Lamb Karahi, Chicken Curry, Garlic Naan and Rice

Tandoori Fish (was cooked to perfection) as a fishermen it's a SIN to overcook fish and many many do. This was done just right

FANTASTIC JOB WELL DONE I was very impressed
author: A M H.

description:
Hands down one of the best restaurants on SF. 

Food is good and money is cheap. Service? Ice water and free salads, and they remember returning customers. Good enough for me.

Tikka Masala series are just divine. Sometimes the flavor is little off, but usually it's just damn good. Get mango chutney on the side and it will enhance the flavor tons more. Wrap a bit of mango chutney with naan, dip the sucker in curry sauce and pick a chunk of meat in the curry - in my mouth. Holy my saliva...

Other good menus are brain masala, vindaloo, and TANDOORI FISH. You'll never get sick of their 'standard' menus but if you are in the mood of something different, try 'em.

Tips for 2 people dining - get either one of chicken or lamb tikka masala, tandoori fish, 2 naans, side of mango chutney. Your belly is full, but even with tax and tips you'll pay less than $30. Howbout that.

If you feel like curry or want to find out about curry, shut the hell up and just go to this place. You can thank me later. JUST GO!
author: Brandon K.

description:
Chutney is the best Indian restaurant in San Francisco. I always have the chicken masala, kabob, rice, and the naan bread. Whenever I eat their food, it always satisfies me. 

The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars because when I dine there I always feel and see that's it's not clean. Overall it's a great restaurant to go to if you like Indian food.
author: Diane L.

description:
Been coming since I was a kid, and through the years the tenderloin has progressed with my own eyes, as well as the Indian Pakistani cuisine in the area. There is stiff competition with several competing restaurants an arms length away. 

Chutney through the years have consistently maintained flavor and quality in their dishes. Every so often you run into a dish which misses expectation,  but overall ends up an enjoyable. 

The only new thing I don't really care for is the new cash register guy, who is not very friendly and does not seem to comprehend much. I placed a to go order in person as well as an appetizer while waiting. I couldn't be any clearer to this thick headed moron that I wanted the appetizers while I was waiting. And to no surprise he forgets to place the order and hands our food to go. Not until we remind him once again, he lapses, thinks, attempts to process what I am telling him and he finally goes and gets our appetizer, without even an apology for the misunderstanding on his end. Pretty much, provide better service and this would be a 4 - star experience.
author: Nabil N.

description:
Unless they drastically changed since I've been there, anything over 1 star is insane. Chutney is one of, if not the single worst restaurant I've ever endured. I ordered a chicken saag and got bones & beaks with some wet spinach covered in milk. It was like if you explained Indian food to someone from another planet and had them prepare their impression of it with fridge leftovers.

Looking at these photos of a clean restaurant with hearty fresh food in not filthy dishware I feel like I'm on the receiving end of a Twilight Zone plot. NONE of this happened in real life. The floors are filthy. The place is crowded and noisy. You order off these greasy IHOP looking menus. You wonder why they couldn't spend their health inspector bribe money on some Ajax and some actual USDA approved meat.

The last memory I have of this place is one of my friends trying to convince the rest of us that the food wasn't so bad. 5 minutes later he was leading the race to get back to the hotel bathroom.

Disgusting. Please condemn and bulldoze.
author: Mike S.

description:
Don't know where to eat late at night in SF?  Try the chicken or lamb tikka masala here with some garlic naan bread.  If you're afraid of the spice, counter it with a mango lassi.  Line up to order and grab a seat.  You can nibble on lettuce, tomatoes, and onions until your food is served.  Luckily, it's not a long wait.  Enjoy the meal and then pay.

Service is a bit slow, but company keeps you occupied.  Parking can be tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description:
If you fare looking for a good Indian food in SF I strongly recommend this place.
Casual dress code and great food.
author: Michael B.

description: Great curried and excellent  food.  Restaurant  feels like a funky diner,  but food redeems the lackluster decor.
author: Jim H.

description:
Pros:
Inexpensive
Generously portioned
DELICIOUS
Quality
One of the best deals in San Fran for a huge heap of inexpensive and yummy food. 


Cons:
Noisy and loud inside. A bit crowded too. (Totally worth it, though. Plus: there's always take-out!)


Here's what we ordered:

Somosas (potato, peas and spices stuffed in a thick folded dough, then fried)

Pompadoms (super thin crispy 'wafers' dotted with fennel seeds)

Chicken Tikka Masala (white meat tandoori chicken cooked in a thick red creamy sauce, tastes a bit tomato sauce-y and yogurty)

Bodi Chicken (tandoori chicken, breast meat chunks served with sliced onions and lemons with a savory thin "sauce" and chopped cilantro

Aloo Mattar (potatoes and peas in a flavorful curry sauce)

Plain Naan (soft and tender flat bread)

Garlic Naan (flat bread topped minced garlic and cilantro)

We loved everything. We(2 of us) actually were able to make 5 meals out of what we got--- and we were ravenous when we first tucked into our hot, fresh food so it's not like we were eating like birds or anything.

I was a little less enthusiastic about the Chicken Tikka Masala. I found it a little too creamy and felt like some of the flavor was a little diluted. But not bad at all. It was still  yummy. 

The Bodi Chicken was fantastic!! Only drawback? The to-go container was the soft papery kind (great for the environment and ideal when used properly) and all the liquid slowly absorbed into it and dissolved out. Fortunately we put napkins under it in anticipation. Missed dipping chicken into that liquid though. 

Aloo Mattar was incredible. This isn't one of my commonly ordered entrees but it is one of my favorites and Chutney did it so well. No hint of bitterness (from using too-old spices) as is occasionally found. A touch of sweetness and a lot of seasoning. 

The somosas weren't the best I've ever had but they were up there. I like mine not too spicy and seasoned heavily and these fit the bill. Great dipped in tamarind sauce or the green chutney stuff. 

The pompadoms were pretty good. I ordered them more for nostalgia than anything. 

The Garlic Naan was the best I've EVER had. Crunchy. Garlicy. Cilantroy. Soooo Flavorful. Sooooo Good with the food. Order 2.

So.... Here's the thing. I almost didn't come here. In fact I was going to go to their main competitor (so I assume: Shalimar) because soooo many people complained of a rude guy in a Giants hat. Well people: He was not there today. Or if he was, he was hatless and nice as can be. :P I chose Chutney over the other in the end because a lot of yelpers said the other place was greasy and had tiny bits of meat. 

Chutney had generous, flavorful portions. I would be happy to go here again. However I have one little annoyance: Rice didn't come with my dishes and it wasn't obvious until we were far away. So if you want basmati rice, make sure you order it. 

For what it's worth I've eaten Indian all across the country and this is a standout establishment, food wise. I will be back here on my next visit to the area. My guy even said to me "Do you think we should start ordering more Indian food back home?" Does it get better than that? 

To the yelpers: I love ya'll but if an employee is rude to you please don't just write a review... Call the management and let them know. If someone lies to you: give management an opportunity to resolve it. If someone is not polite: talk about it with someone who can do something about it. Don't just diss the place and close the book forever. You're short changing yourself in the end. -Usually- owners and mangers do care and would like to know if their staff is turning people off.
author: Nika T.

description:
Based on a glowing review from a friend, we made this our last meal in SF before we moved to the burbs.

The chicken tikka masala was sweet and very runny.  I don't want my CTM to taste like ketchup, and I don't want it to be like a soup.

The chicken botis were moist, yet they lacked flavor.

The seekh kabob was gamey.

The naan was big, but way too thin.

And the chai was not milky enough.

After this experience, we're reconsidering our friendship with the aforementioned reviewer.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
Solid good Indian food but nothing stood out. I ordered the Chicken tikka masala, Garlic naan, and
Mango lassi. The garlic naan was my favorite.  It was the perfect taste and texture. There were actually garlic bits on the top. 

This restaurant has a cafeteria feel to it. You order first then sit down, and they bring the food to you. You eat first and then pay after you're done. 

Although it's a fairly big room, you will still smell like food after you leave.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Indian food is the way to my heart.  Living in Santa Cruz makes this difficult, because there are only a couple of places I consider worth it, and one of them is only a once a week thing (for the record, they are Ambrosia and India Gourmet at the downtown farmers market).  So, when I venture over the hill, I almost always try to convince my fellow diners that we must have an Indian feast, which is precisely what I did the night that Chutney happened.

It's a walk up and order, eat your food, get your own Chai, and then pay at the end kind of place, which I generally prefer over fancier sit down Indian restaurants.  

Two of us shared the Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Vindaloo, plain naan, and rice.  The CTM was very tasty, but it lacked the spice I was looking for and the chicken was a tad overcooked and a bit dry as a result.  The lamb on the other hand was delicious!  The fall apart when you try to pick it up, perfect amount of spicy kind of lamb dish that I love.  The kind of spice that you and your date can bond over because your nose is starting to drip in your food.  And the kind that when you are left alone at the table with only a little bit left, you quickly finish everything before your friend can return...classy, I know.  

With so many Indian places in the area (seriously probably four on this block), I would be tempted to try others, but would definitely return for another meal at Chutney.
author: Josie S.

description:
I LOVE CHUTNEYS! its my absolute go-to Indian/Paki food spot!
My friends and I come here all the time cause you really can't go wrong with this place. The Tikka Masala is on POINT! and lamb Bo-ti is absolutely delicious. Nowadays it gets pretty crowded during certain times of the day but its totally worth it. It's nice seeing non-middle easterners/South-Asian people at the place as it used to be a secret that only we knew about. Now the customers are really diverse as the word about this great place spreads quick. ] The only bad thing I can say about this is that the waiter service isn't that great. You get up to get extra napkin/spoons/water/etc, and sometimes they can be slow with preparing your food. Other than that i recommend this place as a indian food fan, this place is legit :)
author: Mina S.

description: This place gave off a very late-night diner vibe for me. It's open late, not very presentable, and isn't the cleanest restaurant out there but it makes you feel warm inside as you're sitting there with your friends eating Indian food that's been quickly thrown together. The floor was greasy where I was sitting but I didn't mind too much because the food was pretty good. It's seat yourself and order at the front. Food was cheap and plentiful. Their spicy ground beef naan was amazing. I have a feeling this place would make for ridiculously good drunk food.
author: Philip W.

description:
Chutney is one level above hole-in-the-wall. You still order, pay at the counter and it's BYOB if you want to drink alcohol but it's less cramped, better lit and a more pleasant dining experience than most of the other 'loin Indian establishments.

Food is pretty authentic, not Indo/Pak food for white people. I can recommend the Panneer dishes (esp the Palak Paneer), Nans and Daal (I'm not a meat eater). The tandoori fish was a little bit bland, although the portion was generous. Meat eaters in my group seemed happy enough..

Yes, they're a little grumpy and prefer cash to Amex.. but really?! If those are your gripes - and you let it spoil your experience - then you're dining in the wrong place.

For the price I was tempted to give it 5 stars, but I'd want to explore the menu a little more to confirm that one of the dishes I ordered was a 'miss'.
author: Matt G.

description:
I am really so happy to found this place we always go there they really have very good food and good customer service I went today me and my husband 
The food was sooooi good delicious 
They have the best food ever
author: Sara J.

description:
Chicken masala and naan! delisious! The location is a little in the ghetto, but whats the fun without a little location risk? 

The food is good, however I have had better. The dishes are sold seperately even from the rice. I think thats a little stingy. But whatevs. Its close to my apt, so ill go back, but it isnt a place I would frequent.
author: Brittini S.

description:
First night in San Francisco me and my family went to chutney because of a unanimous group vote. We all love indian food so we thought it would be nice to eat something everyone enjoys . Upon entering I noticed that the place was stuffed. And by stuffed I mean people on every inch of floor the restaurant had. Luckily we found a table and ordered. 

I had the chicken kebab wrap (warning spicy) which was very satisfying. At my first bite I noticed a little burn but it went away after a couple if seconds and came back as I continued nomming on the delicious wrap.

It took about 10-15 minutes for our food to arrive despite the restaurant being filled which really impressed me as in a Denny's you can be the only one there and get your food after a day or so :) . 

Overall the good and service was good and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys quality indian food.

Any complaints?
1.not a lot of seating
2. You WILL smell like smoke after leaving
3.it is loud
author: Martin K.

description: This deserves a five simply because of the food, the price and the keep-it-realness. On Sunday's you got an old geezer taking orders - so old school but gotta love it. Today's daily specials included "Ghost brain". Not sure if it is what it sounds like, but I'm now a bit sad I didnt try it as I was a mundane westerner and ordered a chicken korma masala.
author: Alexander P.

description:
I love a good Indian meal and this place left me feeling happy and satisfied. 

Food: Aloo gobi was one of the best I've had. Chicken tikka masala was solid, if possibly a bit too smooth or sweet. I agree it might need a bit more spiciness or smokiness. The naan was good, slightly heavy with less butter than other places. 

Service: great. Order at the counter. Self serve chai.

Price: Excellent.

Overall: I'll be back.
author: Sven S.

description: Ambiance could be better. They could bring chutney to the table and greet the customers better. Looking past- the food is to die for. A beautiful blend of spices within their kabobs and tandoori chicken. Conclude your meal with a mango lassi and your day in the city will be complete!
author: Alim C.

description: They have the BEST BUTTER CHICKEN/CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA here. Seriously, it's the best. The sauce is creamy and luscious and full of flavor and there's plenty of chicken. It's mild without being bland. It's full of flavor without being spicy. Normally, I am slavishly devoted to Pakwan down the street. And definitely, the biryani at Pakwan kicks Chutney's ass. But for butter chicken, Chutney is the best. I also like that Chutney's curries do not come with an inch of oil floating at the top unlike (ahem) Pakwan. I've only ever gotten takeout here so I can't comment about the restaurant ambience or service.
author: Cat M.

description:
the food here is pretty good i have to say

ctm
lamb curry
bbqs
bryanis 

naans, how can i forget the naans

also the price is great for the size of portions and the quality 

you and one person can enjoy 2 dishes some naan and rice under 25$ dollars 

this is gourmet indian food people !
author: Ramiz B.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing.
It's definitely my favorite Indian spot in the Bay Area. The customer service was great and I will definitely be returning soon.
Te eggplant curry is the bomb!!!! And so is their garlic naan.
author: Rasela L.

description: It doesn't get any more traditional than this. We ordered a bunch of curries and naan....tandoori chicken from the clay over and masala chai to go.  One thing - the cashier "makes up" his own tax amount in his head. Be sure the math adds up from the menu as it appears on the bill. I quickly noticed he added $8 more (25%) to our bill and "didn't notice" until I asked to re calculate. Enjoy!
author: Vik M.

description:
I have rarely had bad food in the bay area. This was definitely one of those occasions. Palak paneer never tasted so bland! Tea seemed to be made out of limestone powder!
Even if you leave aside the food, the ambience reeked of unhygienic and unclean habits.
The second star is because it was open on Christmas day.
author: Deepanjan M.

description:
I came here based on all the positive yelp reviews and was incredibly disappointed. The portions were huge, the prices low, and it had a great hole in the wall feel to it. But the food was only so-so at best. The naan was too heavy and dense; the chicken tikka that everyone seems to rave about had no depth of flavor. The goat special was under seasoned and, again, just okay. 

I just moved to SF from connecticut, which isn't particularly known for its indian food. And I have to say that I would rank this as below average in the indian restaurants I've had in the last year. I think I'll probably try this place again, in case I caught it on an off day and because it was okay after all. But what a let down.
author: Christine T.

description: Had the chana masala. It was very very good.  Pretty spicy for the brave ones.  It's a perfect dish for vegetarians! Their naan was great!
author: Liron A.

description:
Boti beats butter.

Favorite memory of India: www.youtube.com/watch?v=i3qOUycE9QE

Otherwise the crowds and pollution were overwhelming, and the food was often too rich and creamy. Butter chicken? Not for me. Took a while to crave Indian food again.

After visiting Chutney tonight I'm craving it again.

Tonight discovered Chicken Boti. Skinless cubed poultry grilled and spiced. Huge portions that filled a huge piece of roti. Unlimited sweet chutney on the side.

Made one delicious mini roll after another. Couldn't stop. Didn't want to stop.

Service was welcoming and accommodating (changed my order at the last minute). Free tea and salad. Less than $10 with tax and tip.

Next time someone asks about India I'll be recommending a certain above and beyond spot in the Tenderloin.
author: Jason B.

description: Decent Indian food in the Tenderloin. We got palak paneer, vegetable tikka masala, rice, and naan. The palak paneer was creamy and the spinach was pureed. There were only 6 cubes of paneer in the sauce. The vegetable tikka masala had a bit of a kick to it. I'm not a fan of the way you order at the counter, sit to eat your meal, then get back up to go to the counter to pay. Why not just make people pay when they order? I thought Little Delhi was better than this place.
author: Al D.

description:
Hands-down the best-tasting Indian food I've had in SF. In the price/atmosphere realm of Pakwan, but soooo much better. Lots of great dishes but baingan bharta is seriously insane. Every bite has a different spice profile. You could put it on a dead cat and that would be the best dead cat you ever ate - by far. Gobi Ghosht (lamb/cauliflower) was much less spiced but it felt like if they plated it a bit better, it'd easily go for $22 at a non-Indian restaurant (it was like $8). No booze but you can run across the street and grab beer/wine at corner market and byob.

It is in the stabby part of town, so try to park close.
author: Michael B.

description:
Chutney serves very authentic and smoking hot Indian/Pakistani food. Its very sumptous, has a Dhaba feel to the food (Dhaba: road-side cabana like restaurants along highways in India)
The manager is very kind and its open late!
author: Sushant T.

description: Great BYOB indian spot!  You order at the counter when you enter, and they bring you salad before they bring the rest of your food.  We ordered a bunch of different stuff and everything was delicious.  The ambiance is nothing fancy, but it's a great place to grab an inexpensive meal with friends and bring a couple of bottles of wine/beer and enjoy!
author: Ruby Y.

description:
Pretty good food. Reasonable price. The local is spacious. The orders are taken from the counter. It's very casual, which I like.

I had the Baingan Bharta (eggplant curry), Chicken Biryani, and the Chicken Tikka Masala. The Baingan Bhartaa and Chicken Biryani were very good. The Tikka masala was just ok. (too tomatoey) I would definitely go back for the biryani and the baingan bharta.
author: R S.

description: Food is good, except wrap and chicken Tikka masala . Biryani both veg and chicken are awesome
author: Venkatesh M.

description:
Three chicken tikka masalas, four garlic naans, two basmati rice = $36

I have been here twice already and they haven't let me down yet.  The chicken was so tender and the sauce was amazing.  It was so tasty that I drank the sauce.  Yes.  I drank it like it was Gatorade. I don't care if the cream clogs up my already cholesterol laden blood vessels. The naan was so soft, fluffy and had the perfect amount of garlic.  The rice was perfectly cooked and seasoned.

The first time I went there, they didn't put enough chicken in my chicken tikka masala.  That didn't bother me because the sauce was extremely yummy.  We ate there after a night at Bourbon and Branch and I must say that the Chutney cashier was much more pleasant than our Bourbon and Branch server.  The Chutney guy was super nice and the restaurant looked really clean.

Today was a different  experience, but pleasant nonetheless.  I ordered my meal to go and the guy who took my order was so kind enough to ask what time I will be picking it up because he wanted to make sure that my order was made fresh and that it is hot when I pick it up. Bonus: They gave me a lot more chicken in my order.  I'm definitely going to be a regular here.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
Tonight was a cold and rainy night in the city, I was shivering and starving.
I was yelping my way to find a place to replenish myself, and hapening to be in the TL chutney restaurant came to my attention.

The previous reviews didnt lied... this place is legit!!!
I was raised on the Mediterranean border of the South of France so I have came accross my share of ethnic food in my life not even counting my multiple trips to London and Morocco, home of the best curries beside India.

The place was crawded, but I was able to seat right away and at the table of my choice (Tia table for one, again...miss you babe)
So this is how it works: you order at the cashier, grab your number, choose your table and wait for the hard working server to bring your meal.
The chai tea is bottomless and self serve in the back of the restaurant. So warm and comforting in a cold night away from home,  exactly what I needed!!!
The delicious smell of the spices floating in the air made my mouth watering,  I couldn't hardly wait at this point!
Thats ok, my meal was delivered piping hot to my table few minutes later.

I had the lamb tika massala for $7.89 
Extremely flavorfull, perfect balance of spices, creaminess and just the right amount of fire, a quick wihout burning your mouth to death. It came with a complimentary plate of fresh veggies: salad, tomatoes,  oignons, lemons...

I had the Nann garlic on the side for $1.99 (the indian version of our garlic bread) tender, flavorful,  delicious, perfect to grab that delicious tikka massala sauce!

My whole meal including the salad, lamb entrée,  huge side of freshly baked Nann, chai tea bottomless came up for a total of $10.39
Yes I said $10.39 for a 3 course meal and drink!!! Crazy cheap for crazy good! 
I will definitely come back and try more delicious exotic spicy delicious dishes and bring loved ones along with me!

And please, dont be a stuck up bitch and let few homeless poeple scare you... offer him a cup of tea on your way out instead, its freaking cold out there.
author: Tia D.

description:
Just go there and order the following:
1. Chicken Masala
2. Rice
3. Garlic nan

And ENJOY! Simply one of the best meals I have ever had in my life.
author: Omar G.

description:
Chutney can be a little hit or miss. The Tandoori Chicken was good.
It's clean, but stark.
author: Frank H.

description: Employees were very nice but it took them 30 minutes to bring out my food. Not only did it take a long time, the food was cold. Whenever i go to eat Indian food, I usually order a chicken vindaloo and that what i did here. I thought that it was not as flavorful as the past chicken vindaloo i've tried and would've felt like if i received it hot, then i would've rated it an extra star.
author: Chelsea T.

description: Very good chicken tikka masala!! I love tikka masala and am always on the lookout for the best and luckily I think I have found a good one!.  It's not a fancy place, but if you are looking for really good chicken tikka masala and an extremely good price, then this is the place.  Will definetly be back.
author: Cassy H.

description:
Had dinner here with a mate who highly recommended the food. Totally has the feel of a somewhat-divy no-frills type of place. You enter, order at the counter, find your own seating, and they bring it out. Takes some time, but that's because it's made fresh. And it is delish! Tandoori chicken was super tasty. And the portion is big (we ordered two pieces, but shared only one). The naan was also fresh out of the oven. Overall, the food was very very good. Authentic.

My only complaint is that when we asked for wine glasses (we brought a bottle with us) we got plastic cups. Yet, somehow the table next to us actually got wine glasses. What's that about??? Did we not appear worthy of actual wine glasses?!! Such service would probably prevent me from going back in the future.
author: Judi B.

description: I honestly hate going there. There service is so bad and the guy behind the register got zerooo customer service skills. I was there for 45 mint just for biryani lamb and at the end i went to ask him if my order was ready and he gave me an attitude like am asking him to give me the food for free. Then, I went to the restaurant on the corner in O'farrell st same order it was ready in less then 10 min. WoW. I swear no lie ... I wish i have a pic of the guy who is behind the Register.
author: M E.

description: The worst experience ever! The food is so so and lacks flavor. The service is the rudest ever! Don't waste your time standing in line. Find another Indian, Pakistani restaurant that actually treats people with respect and takes what they do, seriously. As I stated, the food lacks flavor in many ways. There are way better options in the area.
author: Edward B.

description:
