We also had a goat curry (I don't eat 4 legged things, so I didn't taste it, but my wife thought it was very good), and chicker cholley (this is not a typo - it's "chicker", and it's completely different from a dish called "cholley chicken"), which was an excellent chicken/chick pea dish. The chicken cholley was unlike anything I'd had before because the chicken was somehow blended into the dish so it added flavor, but no discernable texture. I'm not sure whether that sounds appetizing or not, but I was really glad we got it and I'd definitely get it again.

We enjoyed the free chai, which was unsweetened so we could adjust to our desired level of sweetness.

The owner's son took our order and was very friendly and helpful when we asked questions about the specials, and overall made us feel really welcome. We're jazzed that we found this place, and have already made plans to bring my wife's parents there for dinner on Sunday!
author: Chris S.

description:
This review is long overdue, but I am NEVER coming back here. I really don't like giving bad reviews but this is too much!

My issue here is with the seekh kabobs, which they served us with ROTTEN MEAT.

My body was ready to throw up the moment I took a bite and my mouth was filled with that disgusting pungent aroma. Spit it out right away. My mom went up to the dude in charge and told him in discreet that the meat smelled and it's expired. He said no you ordered lamb meat. Which was a blatant lie by the way because my family only orders beef kabobs, literally we only eat beef kabobs, even at weddings and dawats- it has the most flavor. Anyways so my mom was like look bro I make this all the time, I know the difference between lamb gosht and beef and when you're using bad meat. Then upon showing him the platter of seekh kabobs, which by the way were falling apart just by moving the plate and couldn't even stay in shape (!!!!) he apologized for serving us expired meat and we didnt have to pay for it. 

Man I can't believe I used to like this place.
author: Marmalade O.

description: Good food with great prices.  I tried three different curries, three different naans, BBQ and grilled meats.  I now have a food baby and I have named him Sebastian.  He wants me to go back sometime soon but I will need to wait as the thought of eating just one more bite makes me feel sick.  This place is best to go with at least one other fatty so that you can try more dishes and drink beers incognito.
author: Darin E.

description: Chutney is yet another indo/paki joint and menu is quite the same.  Their samosa tastes good and fresh.  We ordered chicken briyani, cauliflower curry, rotis and tandoor chicken.  That was so filling for two people.  The place is bit run down and tired of the way that we have to grab the utensils, napkins, plates, sauces, pitcher all by ourselves.  These arrangements remind of the ones you see in pakwan.  Is that their code or what in having an arrangement of this sort? lol.  The restroom was okay and kept clean.  The neighborhood is nice to walk around and very close to Bart.
author: Hema K.

description: Very good food in clean environment . Lahori choley r excellent .
author: T J R.

description:
I loooooove Indian food. You walk in, order your food at the counter, find a seat , eat, pay, leave feeling satisfied. Don't expect amazing service with ppl waiting on you hand and food...they are too busy cleaning and preparing your meal! I don't mind at all because I'm here for the food. Yummy.

Tandoori chicken-crispy and charred on outside, piking hot inside
Mattar Paneer-it was good but a bit too much on the thin liquidy side for me. I prefer mine to be thicker and creamy consistency
author: Lola D.

description: I think unicorns pee in the chicken tikka masala. Unbelievably good. Get the plain naan so that the taste doesn't interfere with the masala sauce.
author: Matt S.

description:
Chutney
SF Tenderloin
Friday December 31, 2010
2 Stars

Disclaimer: Food on NYE is never very good.  After seeing a whole bunch of Indian Food places, we decided on Chutney because they were a lot people inside and looked much better than Naan N' Curry.  This place is a little strange.  We ordered the Lamb Boti, Palak Paneer, and Chicken Curry.  The guy was like you should eat the curry and ordered something else for us.  You don't pay when you order and get a number and they serve you.  The food took 25-30 minutes to get to our table.  When it came, my lamb was cold and dry.  The Naan Bread was not very fresh or warm.  The Paneer was so-so.  The homemade cheese was worse.  The miscellaneous dish was not bad at all (if only I knew what it was).  After we finished eating, we had to wait in line to pay our check which took another 10 minutes.  However, everybody around us ordered the Tika Masala which was probably delicious. Oh well.  Overall this place was a pretty not good experience.
author: Leonard L.

description: We came from L.A. I went for lunch with my family and got experienced  really poor customer service. The guy was on a cash counter really an ass. He was very disrespectful. Its was shame to come in this restaurant. Try something different.
author: Sunil A.

description: They're nice and awesome. Especially recommend the curried eggplant. Great food, and BYOB. Stop at the liquor store across the street while you're waiting for your food.
author: Garen C.

description: I was around the area visiting from out of town and found this place on yelp.  I ordered the naan and the chicken tikka masala.  It was good.  The naan I was used to was a lot better though.  The one I had was a bit crispier than chewy, couldn't really taste the garlic.  The portions are big, but I had no idea I had to order rice separately.  But the price is very reasonable compared to what I'm used to.  It looks like a pizza parlor, I guess is a very casual place to eat at.  Nothing fancy.
author: Romina R.

description:
Great price and delicious. Good selection of vegetarian food.

Favorite picks here:
 Karalya masala - Bitter melon 
 Bindi masala - okra 
 Bengan Bartha - eggplant

Ask for extra spicy. 

Chai is free but not as spicy as I like. I like a good quality cinnamon, fresh ginger and black pepper. 

Dishes are a bit small for me, personally, however probably a good size for many when considering that food waste has become so rife in our American culture. 

Organic ingredients would be nice to have, as would certified humane meats. 

But overall, Chutney is a favorite spot of mine. I care about the food and price.
author: Garrett S.

description:
I'm sooooo sad in September I moved away from my apartment of 15 years in the Tendernob. I am no longer walking-distance to the Tandoori-loin and my favorite Indian place in the city, Chutney.

Top picks: Baingan Barta, Palak Paneer, Chicken or Lamb Boti

Word of caution: Some nights there are better cooks on so the food quality can waver night to night. I must have kept catching the bad ones for a while cuz I was getting worried, but then had a good one and told the guy at the counter about this phenomenon. I hope they have fixed it by now. 

Excellent place to take out-of-town guests who are looking for different food than they usually get at home.
author: Pickles P.

description:
We decided to try out this place after reading the reviews. Well, if you are from Pakistan or India, you are most likely not gonna like this place. All the dishes were lacking the spicy hot flavor that we are crave so much. Ordered tandoori chicken : thanks to lemon slices provided, we were able to eat it
goat curry : meat tasted ok, curry lacking in chilly and pepper and seasoning
karahi chicken : tasted more like tomato paste, meat was flavorless
brain masala : was okay, have had better
roti : horrible and tough
chicken biriyani : tasted more like achari chicken mixed in plain rice sauteed in oily curry - weirdly enjoyable

We are never going back!!!
author: I Love Good Foo D.

description:
ive only had a handful of indian meals in my life, im a fan of the cuisine. This is my first review of an indian restaurant i think. I've been to a couple in Fremont. I'm not the biggest expert in the authenticity of the recipes or taste, but I'm sure this place is pretty white-washed. Which doesnt bother me at all. The tastes arent as intense but i still get the feeling im eating indian. I usually order the chicken tikka masala extra spicy because. 

there seems to be some kind of one side or the the other with this place on the food. 

For me, its kind of like when you order a burrito from Chipotle, when theres a perfectly legit taqueria a block away. But your getting the Chipotle burrito because its a Chipotle burrito, and its not a legit burrito. does that make sense?

well, it will make sense to the people who really know indian cousine. 

i dig.
author: Anthony M.

description: The service may not be the fastest and the employees not the happiest, but the food was pretty awesome.  My standard is lamb curry, paneer, and rice.  All three were amazing.  The curry sauce really stood out to me and saved leftovers for the next day.  I'll have to come back and try some more.  The area is a bit sketchy, so just be street smart.
author: Neville B.

description: The chicken tikka masala!! Their naan is huge!! Love this place. It's so close to my work.
author: Becca I.

description: Tikka masala and naag are great! Friendly service and delicious hot sauces in the cooler at the back.
author: Justin C.

description:
I'm on the continued search for good Indian food in this city, which seems to be harder and harder to find.  Martin W. and I checked this place out with high hopes after all the positive reviews.

Not much atmosphere, but that's also not necessary for cheap food.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  I ordered the Saag Panner and garlic naan.  I was a bit taken aback when it arrived--it looked like whipped up baby food.  It was so smooth and overly blended that I wasn't even sure it was saag paneer, but instead thought it may be some sauce.  It had a weird sour taste and, after trying to force it down, I decided I couldn't eat it and ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala.  This was much better--better flavors and regular texture.  But, the servings were small and there were only about 4 small pieces of chicken.  
Definitely not on the top of my list---I'll have to keep searching.
author: Jessica L.

description: Worst Indian food/restaurant I've eaten. The food doesn't taste Indian but more like Mexican Chipotle. Don't waste your money here, go somewhere else more authentic.
author: Joe P.

description:
The place is loud and pretty busy. It's a lot of hype relative the quality of food. I think it is popular because the place looks nice and it is a good Indian food sit down option in the tendernob

Shalimar across the street looks drab and dirty but the food is excellent. And with Indian food, you really rate the quality of food by how your stomach feels the next day. For this I ask you to cross the street and take Shalimar-take out.
author: Dilip R.

description:
Had dinner there today on a friend's recommendation. The owner was super nice. The food was great. I had Chicken Byriani. For lunch  Then took a chicken kabob to go. For dinner. He wanted me to try the chicken tikka masala so he sweetly gave me some to try in my to go bag. It was yummy. I'll be back.  

It's not fancy one bit, but that was okay with me.
author: Kristy P.

description:
Great food, low prices!

One of the best Chicken Tikka Masala dishes I've had in the city so far.  Definitely beats Shalimar (across the street).

Portions on the curries are a little small, but still pretty good sized.

Also, seems cleaner than your average Pakistani/Indian restaurant.

Big plus -- they take credit/ATM cards!
author: R A.

description:
Chutney is The BOMB diggity,. no doubt about it... 

I've been a patron for almost a year now and have yet to find a competitor.

First and foremost prepare your stomach for an explosion of flavors, through primarily spices, and sauces. Secondly the dish that I have every single visit is the Lamb Tikka Masala. Add some spinich lamb, saffron rice, and regular rice, a couple of pieces of 8" naan (bread) and you'll leave the TL on a full stomach and with left over cash.

Plain and simply the most consistent, indian food joint in town. Clean, Large, fast, and affordable...

P.S The secret sauce is in the back Fridge, "Chutney" and you'll find the Delicious Chai Tea, to warm your soul right next to it......
author: Daryl N.

description:
I really wanted to like Chutney.   I was so incredibly hopeful upon seeing the spacious dining area, complete with pleasant interiors and tandoori smoke free air.  The salad bar and nice waiters impressed me, as did the chai, which actually tasted like chai.  And the man at the counter was so friendly!  Seriously, what a difference from other Indian restaurants in the same 'hood. 

But. it always comes down to.the food.  It may have been an off day, like a really off day, because otherwise I have no idea why so many people love this place.   The naan was limp and the chicken tikka masala was almost tasteless- I think they forgot an ingredient?   Something was seriously wrong with this dish.  And it contained exactly two small pieces of chicken, as did the korma curry, latter also not very good.   

The samosas were decent and I really liked my $1.99 skewer of seekh kabab, both of which saved the meal from being a total letdown.  

Later that night we both felt a little sickly.  I'd give Chutney the edge over Naan and Curry, but just barely.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Not my favorite Indian place in the city, but definitely a good choice! Chutney is right near my work and is a great and affordable lunch spot. For example, for $11 I got curry, garlic nann, and rice. I made three meals out of this! I ordered my favorite, Sagg Paneer, and enjoyed the cinimmon spices in the sauce. It was a great after taste. However, I wish it had been more spinachy (more of a solid texture) than it was. It was more of a cream sauce than anything else. 

In spite of these things, I gotta say I really like the service and efficiency of Chutney. I find the staff really personable, and like that I can get my food in ten minutes!
author: Alexandra M.

description:
The food is pretty good here [it really tastes like its from India], unlike other places, the folks here will set your table for you without asking.

Their mango lassi is extremely good and brought back memories of India for me. Eating the garlic naan  and lamb curry with my hand while sipping on the occasional glass of water. No substitute. I'd come back here again.

It's a little unfortunate this place is located in a "not-so-friendly part of town." I can envision more people visiting it - their staff is very friendly.
author: Jey P.

description: Absolutely terrible customer service. Never order from here. The people threatened to beat me up and sweared at me when I called to cancel the order immediately after i placed it online and discovered that it was for pick up and not delivery. The hosts name is Moe.
author: Marc C.

description: This plays is yummy! Delicious veggie samosas and great masala! Check it out!
author: Sara H.

description:
Bones in the curry.  :(

Tikka Masalas - chicken and lamb - both good, solidly B+/A-.

Chicken Korma - Um.  Awful.  Watery and strange.

Naan - Flat

Biryani - AOK.  Tasty, nicely studded with veggies, grilled onions etc.

Overall:  Not bad for the price, but I really hate bones in curry.  :(
author: Juliana C.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants to go in San Francisco. The place is in downtown, so sometimes parking can be a hassle. My fav is their tikka masala and their nan breads. You also can drink chai tea- all you can drink while you are there. What's different compare to all the other Pakistani-indian restaurant  is that they give you free veggies or salad if you want to call them, so it is good to have something on the side to gulp all the food down. The service is usually good unless if you come during dinner or peak hours, but this is never a problem. The food comes fast and the price is very reasonable. The portion can be consider small! but it is the right portion for me.
author: Bibi B.

description:
The food here definitely is bomb .com.  The chicken tikka masala is rich, creamy, and oh so flavorful.  It's also a bargain compared to other restaurants.  The naan is so fresh, it steamed up my bag! 

Ok...I have to admit, I did not enjoy my first experience because it took 20 minutes to get my food and I had only ten minutes to scarf down my food before I had to clock into work.  It's not their fault.  They were busy.  The guy who took orders was real nice and noticed I was eagerly waiting.  Then again, I was the only person ordering take out.  The restaurant itself was clean and had a nice ambiance to it.  The artwork on the walls distracted me from checking the time.  

Fortunately enough my friends, I found the secret to getting yummy chicken tikka masala during your lunch break.  Call in your order!  I called right before I left and my order was ready for me when I got there.  Just don't go in two days in a row.  The guy recognized me and asked, "Do you like chicken tikka masala?".  I'll be going in there with sunglasses and a scarf next time...
author: Lisa X.

description:
I loved every single dish i tried here.

-Chicken Tikka Massla
-Cheese naan
- kababs = beef,  lamb and chicken
- Byriani.

All at a decent price.. the only thin is that when its packed, its pain to pay at the end...

MAKE SURE to pay when you order so you are off the hook and can just walk out!
author: Fran M.

description:
I was not a fan of this place. It probably didn't help considering I'd been hearing about how wonderful it was for days and I was really hyped about it. After having been there, not impressed..

I will start by admitting that my boyfriend's chicken tikka masala was good and i ate a good portion of it. 

But...
I ordered lamb curry and I am personally not a fan of having to salvage any meat that is left on the bone of the lamb, which wasn't much. so bone-in meat and I ordered extra spicy cause i like it hot. It was lame. Not spicy at all. Disappointing for an indian restaurant. Secondly, there wasn't anything in particular but I got the vibe that the place wasn't very clean. and I know for the price, beggers can't be choosers.

but hey, i like boneless meat dishes, Spicy food, and a clean restaurant. can't help it, that's just me. 

oh and i also just have a pet peeve when restaurants don't have soda fountains. when they serve everything by the can or bottle it grosses me out and makes me think they're just trying to nickel and dime you for whatever they can get.

but like i said. if you like really popular cheap indian food on the go. this is your place. 

just didn't care for it myself.
author: Naura T.

description:
This place is fantastic. It's like a fast food service with restaurant quality food. Wonderful.

As far as Indian food goes, it's got to have some things that are a good as a standard. So far the tea was strong, with just the right amount of milk. Check. Naan was warm, fresh, and not spongy. Check. Tikka Masala was creamy, with just a hint of spice. Check. Great food.

Oh, the salad and water jug are a nice touch. You don't have to call for anyone to refill your water and have something to munch on while waiting for food.
author: Yelena K.

description:
For an unassuming place, Chutney sure does have some flavorful Indian food. Thanks to some helpful reviews my wife and I stopped in when we first arrived to the city. It is a very casual environment and there is a ton of action outside if you sit by the window. The food was very delicious and compared to what I am used to paying for Indian food, this was a steal.

If this were close to work or home I could see myself eating here at least once a week. Everything we ate had such flavor. The chicken tikka masala was amazing and personally I would love to swim in the sauce with a boat made of garlic naan!

Get there now - it's cheap and delicious!
author: Damien C.

description: I like this food because of lamb. The prices are affordable. I am giving 4 stars out of 5 only because of a bad location and outdated interior.
author: Andrei J.

description:
Review by a vegetarian--

Just about OK, in my opinion. The prices are pretty good, and to me, it looks like a (slightly) fancier cleaner of Naan and Curry. 

The person at the front counter is nice and is pretty helpful too. 

The Roti and Naan were huge, nice and hot. 

We ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala and Bengan Bharta (Eggplant). Panner left much to be desired. Bengan Bharta was better than what I had at other places.

Its a good place for a meal, if you are in the area. 

If I compare it to true Indian food, then I've had much better.
author: Manish P.

description: Hit or miss- the lamb and paneer dishes aren't so good, but the kheeme is usually decent
author: Romita J.

description:
I got the paneer naan for $3!  So cheap and so good!  My friends got lamb (I sampled very good) and some other things that I can't remember anymore, but they were all pleased with their dishes.

This place is also a bargain because you go up to order, so technically there aren't waiters, so you don't really have to tip.
author: Rona H.

description: Long wait time. Ok ok food. Nothing great. and really bad service. Feel like giving minus review.
author: Sonal K.

description: Delicious Indian food.  You order your food at the counter, they bring it to your table, you bus your own table, help yourself to water pitchers and then pay at the counter when you're done. The food takes a bit for them to cook it so don't come in here if you're in a big hurry. I'ts a pretty big place too so if you have a group of people than it can be accommodating. I recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala.
author: Vivian A.

description:
Just like everyone else says, Garlic Naan.. WHooooooa... I came in and wasn't exactly starving, and it was lunch time.. So I ordered the Chicken Tikki Masala and the Garlic Naan. 

It comes with a complimentary salad and some tea. But dude... that sauce for the Chicken Tikki Masala.. It's so rich, my poor naan didn't stand a chance!!!

Can't wait to go back.. and it will most likely be when I get my next haircut from PBS (shameless plug).
author: Jason C.

description: Lamb Tikka Masala was Poppin at this TL curry house--definitely recommended
author: N C.

description:
The food is OK, but it really depends on what you order. I ordered the lamb saag and it was rather below expectations. I expected something much creamier, cheesier and smooth. Instead, they really increased the spinach to paneer ratio and it wound up more like lamb with mustard greens.

My friend ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, which was much much better. The curry was thick and creamy as well as sweet and tangy. It just hugged and smothered every grain of rice you poured it on. They didn't add in too much chicken, but it didn't matter because the curry itself was definitely the highlight. Both of us also each had an order of garlic naan, which came out hot and fluffy, with a hearty helping of that garlic flavor.

Regardless of how you think the food tastes, the food is undeniably very cheap. It's simply a universal, collectively agreed upon fact. The restaurant also doesn't look too shabby for the Tenderloin. I'll definitely come here again, but I'll be getting something different.
author: Tian X.

description: Place is booooooooomb for late night Indian grubbing in the TL, or anywhere in San Francisco for that matter. Get the CTM of course, but also the Tandoori fish and any kind of biryani.  Owners are really nice, and you of course have to love any place that has free chai!!!
author: Eric S.

description: The best indian food in the city! In my life time, I have tried over 40 indian restaurants all around the country and none of them had the tikka masala as tasty and delicious as theirs, not even close!  Especially the sauce is unique  and unbelievably tasty!
author: Murat T.

description: Great value.  Their palak paneer is fantastic, and friendly service.  We were there on a Friday night, and it had a neighborhood feel.
author: Justin N.

description:
The ABSOLUTE BEST Pakistani food in SF.

That's pretty much all I need to say. If you want specifics... It's one of those charming non-fancy places you go to just enjoy food with your friends. Clean. The prices are awesome, the food quality is amazingly high, the complementary chai is delicious, the service is good and the atmosphere is perfect. I love the aromas inside the place.

My favorites here are their Chicken Tikka Masala, Chana Masala, Beef Seekh Kabab, and Keema Naan (which you don't see on a lot of menus). Occasionally they have BBQ trout on their "specials" board for like $10 or $11, and it's awesome. Be warned, it comes with salad and rice, so just this dish will feed 2 people.

No ghee! I love it!

Here's a tip. The Chicken Tikka Masala always comes with plenty of extra sauce. If you order a Chicken Boti (chicken breast cubes), you can toss it into the extra Chicken Tikka Masala sauce, and you now have a kingly pile of spicy Indian deliciosity.
author: I Stepped On J.

description: I just love this place.  What they lack in ambiance they make up for in great food.  The Tikka Masala with Lamb or chicken is so great.  I'm a naan dipper.  This place makes me very happy.  Never disappointed .
author: Gerald B.

description:
maybe i expected too much, but this place was just a cut above a-ok for me.

yeh:
-clean
-friendly
-yummy steamy naan 
-beef kabob
-chicken tikka masala has lots of sauce

meh:
-okra was ok, missing something
-chicken tikka masala was a bit bland, needed more smokiness?  spiciness?sweetness?  something!
-mango lassi was just ok.  not cold enough, also not sweet enough.
-free chai tea kept running out and was watery

i might go back, but lots of other places to try in the TL, so maybe not.  my vegetarian friends love it tho.

3.5 stars because staff is really nice, but really its more of a 3.25.
author: Josie M.

description: One word: Brain masala! Go figure!
author: Rabab M.

description: Great food!! Nice clean place.. Love the Tikkas here.. Just the right place for people who like Indian food.. With easy spices!
author: Amna F.

description:
If you don't mind going to the Tenderloin, this place is great. The restaurant itself is pretty clean and new for a Tenderloin Indian restaurant, and still pretty cheap, especially if you go in a big group.

Highly recommend the chicken tikka malasa. The cream and tomato sauce is addictive. I also like their palak paneer.

There's free chai in the back.
author: Grace Y.

description:
Is it possible to  eat good indian/pakistan food at more than reasonable prices? Chutney definitely shows that "yes, it is!"
The place is big, quite caotic and doesn't look particularly attractive, if not for the open kitchen where the frenzy and accurate work of the south american (in an indian restaurant ???) cooks can  be admired by the enthusiastic clients. A little annoying thing is that you have to order by yourself, as you would do in a crowded pub, but, ehi!, the little effort is well rewarded by the averagely very good food quality.  

Being my first time here and the menu so huge, I ordered two main dishes: lamb with lentils and chicken strips with mixed vegetables (mainly mushroom and paprika). On the one hand, chicken and lentils were both very tasty and well balanced in terms of spices. On the other hand, I was rather disappointed by the lamb: way too greasy, probably cooked too fast and definitely not melting in the mouth ... I can tell I have had much better "indian" lamb than this in the past. 

Together with my  main dishe(s) I also took naan bread stuffed with spicy ground beef which was pretty well done. My girlfriend took mixed vegetables with curry which was good, with a surprisingly light but flavourful sauce. 

Something that I really loved was the mango lassi I took as drink ... actually I took two of them, the second one as "dessert", in order to recover from the "shock" of knowing that they did not have kulfi, the indian "nutty" ice-cream  that I simply adore.

In summary, despite some imperfection,  I believe Chutney deserves a 4-star rating (maximum), since the ratio quality/price is considerably high. I'm sure I'll come some more times. However, for romantic dinners full of indian flavours and attention to all culinary details I would head somewhere else.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Oh Boy....where to begin.  Let me start out by saying that I usually set my bar at 4 yelp stars.  I wont walk into a restaurant unless it has at least 4 stars.  Jeez, I just admitted my yelp snobbiness.  I have to also say that this is one place that SF yelpers got wrong.  I would say that this place is a weak 3.  Maybe even a 2.5.  The 2.5/3 stars come from the price and a big menu.

The ordering process is chaotic.  Order, then eat, then pay? Very strange.  The food, the best way to describe it is uninspired.  Now I'm not Gordon Ramsey, but that was really the only word that I could come up with to describe it.  Garlic Naan tasty but undercooked.  Shrimp Tikka Massala tasted like creamy tomato soup that needed more seasoning and salt (odd - another yelper said their food was too salty).  It contained 5 large shrimp that were overcooked.  Their chutneys...aside from being in squeeze bottles, were watery and not really that tasty.  Their samosas were fried to perfection, but the filling was a bit flavorless.

So, the price is right,..but the food is WRONG, bitch.

PS - I'm quoting a movie here, not calling the owners of Chutney bitches.
author: Michael C.

description:
If you are like me, you probably have friends or coworkers who rant and rave about the fantastic food in some hole in the wall place, and you have yet to either discover one of the those places to contribute to the conversation or you find the food in those places to be rather questionable. I was in both situations for a long time, since I like spending money on good food, until I encountered Chutney's. I am unsure as to what piqued my interest, but there I was - in the sketchiest neighborhood of all of San Francisco (Tenderloin) traversing about to suddenly encounter Chutney.

The first time I went there, I ordered beef kabobs with pita, some type of okra dish, and maybe dal. Not to mention the prerequisites with every order - rice and naan. The food was SOOOOOO good. And SOOOO cheap! I swear that my partner and I ordered everything to our heart's delight, and our bill was less than $20. The food was spicy, but not too spicy. It was flavorful in the way I wish everything was flavorful - not one spice playing a major role. All the spices working together as a team to bring out the innate flavors of the vegetables and meats. Ahhh - it was delightful

I don't think you can go wrong ordering anything off of the menu, so be as conservative or adventurous as you like. Portion size was also nice. The interior was comfortable - not elegant by any means, but comfortable. Service wasn't particularly memorable, but for the price you're paying, you can't expect a lot. And after you are done gorging, grab some tea in the back, sweeten it to your liking, and walk away quickly to a safer neighborhood.
author: Hina K.

description: I really wanted to like this place, as I have heard many good things about it... however, it just didn't hit the spot.  I had the chicken tikka masala and the garlic naan, as recommended. The garlic naan was much more garlicky than the naan at other Indian restaurants, which I liked. I mean, why call it garlic naan when you can't even taste the garlic, right? +1 for being exactly what I ordered. The tikka masala....though it was tasty, it tasted sadly watered down. Granted, it wasn't really oily like other places and tasted "healthy", according to the bf... watered down curry is a no in my book.
author: Betty W.

description:
This place is amazing! I first came for my birthday and have been dreaming about it ever since. Finally went again tonight.

They have a lot of delicious vegetarian dishes and the prices are incredible ($5.95dish). The tikka masala is a MUST. The food is so good I ate more than I should have. But just thinking about it now I would eat another plate. It might just be dangerously good.

The atmosphere is nice. Low lighting, pleasing decor, and good energy. The staff are friendly too! I can' t believe people are scared to go to the tenderlion. Their loss!
author: Scarlet F.

description:
If I were laying on my deathbed and I was asked what food I wanted as my last meal my choice would likely be Indian food. Unfortunately, I have had the chance to eat at Indian restaurants in Frisco very infrequently. I'm very pleased to say that one of my few experiences with delicious curry out here has been in Chutney.

I practically live right across the street from this place and I just got back from enjoying my first meal there. Yummmmmy!

Two orders of curry, rice, and naan all for sixteen bucks. Plus free tea! Good stuff. When my man and I can both get stuffed for under twenty dollars it's a good thing. But I wouldn't expect the food to be so good for that cheap.

The guy at the register was totally friendly (major points for that always) and the service was pretty quick, despite the humungo group of people that were celebrating something in the restaurant.

I recommend it. And I will definitely be back soon.
author: Becca M.

description: I love this place! Have you ever gone somewhere that you haven't been to in a while? Then you are sorely disappointed afterwards because your mind remembers that it was better? NOT HERE!!! The cuisine is better every-time.
author: Jon T.

description:
Food. Was. A.maz.ing.  

I had to take breaks in between each syllable so I can stuff my face in between.  

The tandoori fish was cooked PERFECTLY.  The menu said it was a chef's special, and I was afraid I would be disappointed but when the dish came there was four huge pieces.  Have it with the green sauce, forgot the name but it's green.

The mango lassi - so good.  I could have had it in one gulp but I was supposed to share, that was probably the only downside of the meal.

Restaurant was clean and had plenty of room.  Prices are very reasonable.  Ok, have to go dream about the meal again.  

ENJOY!
author: Z C.

description:
Ordered take-out from here so this review is based solely on the food:

Not good. Kind of weird. The seasoning was off (ordered the chana masala and daal masala) and could've been much more flavorful/spicy. The garlic naan was fine (though I was disappointed they didn't offer onion kulcha -- with the onions baked inside the bread). 

I wouldn't recommend it for vegetarian options but perhaps their meat is better!
author: Richa A.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots to grab Indian food in the city.

It's not a buffet, but the pricing is pretty cheap and the quality of the food is great! I've come here on several occasions with friends and it's a nice place to sit down and play catchup. 

Sometimes I grab it as a late night snack for my girlfriend and I. We like to order (2) chicken tikka masalas, (2) naan and (2) garlic naan TO GO. It comes out $21 even and you can also request free vegetables on the side. The naan bread is pretty big too. It's very reasonable and the guy at the register is very welcoming when you order.

I personally love grabbing a cup of the tea as well. I'm so addicted to it! (but its probably because I fill it with sugar) :D
author: Andrew C.

description:
Pros: good food, reasonable price
Cons: homeless people, little spicy for the daughter
price 7 for chkn tiki masala1 naan 2 rice biriyani plain

I ate here because Shalimar across the street had a huge line.  I really liked this place and would actually pick it over Shalimar now.  So it was clean which is always a bonus.  Not the fancy michelin star type clean but clean were u dont expect diarrhea and roaches.  I am so boring but got the chicken tiki masala. Really good.  Not over powered by cream or yogurt.  The plain rice biriyani was excellent.  My daughter went to town and had a bunch.  They bring out a free salad plate.  Nothing amazing but gave me some greens to help things along if u know what I mean.  If you dont know then I tend to get constipated and it hurts to poop so the greens gives me fiber so I dont rip my butt while throwing down a deuce,  Sorry for that, the wife and kid are sleeping and no one to laugh at my jokes.  Great service for this type of restraunt.  Again, not compared to what u would expect not a Zagat 29 type place.  Homeless people made area feel unsafe.  Park close and go with friends which is always better then eating alone anyways.
author: Barry W.

description: I felt very comfortable in Chutney.  Clean, quick, tasty...and reasonably priced.  They've got that whole, order up front...food delivered to table...pay up front later thing...which can be a hassle since basically you have to stand in line twice, you just gotta time it right.  But the service was really quick!  And...free tea in the back!  :)
author: Jennifer A.

description:
This is a classic Indian Pakastani restaurant for all local food lovers here in SF- Hands down...the best Indian food ive had so far....Been coming here for years and was never disappointed.
Food is always tasty, hot and flavorful.
My favorite dishes:

chicken tiki massale: tender boneless chicken in a great curry sausce
Chicken Botti : HUGE pieces of boneless chicken cooked in a clay oven, but still tender and juicy.
Vegetable Korma: packed dish with all kind of veggies and spices: carrots, potatoes, peppers and much more...nice!

I haven't tried any of the beef or lamb dishes but my friends have and they seem to love it as well.

Pro's of this place: Awesome food- Big establishment- reasonable prices

Con's: only one cashier to order and pay (you pay afterwards and not when you order) so sometimes it takes a very long time before you can place your order or simply just pay for it afterwards...it kinda sucks that you have to wait in line 2 times...- ventilation is not always great, your clothes may smell like indian food upon arrival at home...so dont wear your fanciest suit to Chutney ;-)

Other than that no complaints whatsoever.....oh there is free Chai tea in the back of the restaurant...self service! ;-)

I strongly recommend Chutney if you are looking for great tasting Indian food at a reasonable price....Ill keep on going there on a regular basis!
author: Achraf S.

description:
Went here with a co-worker today. I ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala and she ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and added potatoes to the dish.

I must admit that the sauce was pretty good, but they gave me six small pieces of paneer cheese. SIX! I paid $6.49. I couldn't believe it. Rice was $2 extra. What a rip off.

My friend got maybe a total of six pieces of chicken, but at least she got a bowl full of potatoes. 

The tap water here is disgusting! It could have been that the pitcher and the cups weren't cleaned well...  The only redeeming factor was that they had complimentary tea. 

I can't believe that this place has won so many awards. The guy who took our orders wasn't the friendliest person either.
author: Carolynne R.

description:
I'm not a big fan of Indian food at all. But this place is good.

Usually I go there with friends. We always order lamb curry, prawn masala, the red fish, and naan. All are delicious. I don't know if all the curries are pre-made (cos it would make more senses for the restaurant to do so), but their food taste good. No signs of pre-made stuff.

Price is cheap & reasonable. 

ok service (I didn't expect much anyway).

Just don't wear your favorite outfit there unless you wanna add nice Indian curry scent to it. It sticks for several days...
author: Sue R.

description:
I had a business dinner here recently with eight other coworkers. We told the chef to bring us whatever he suggested and ended up with an amazing meal that was comparable in price to two meals from a much more expensive place! 

Chutney rocks!
author: Seth G.

description:
A family favorite. 
We're always ordering chutney on Take-Out nights when everyone's too lazy to cook. The food is amazing. The chicken tikka masala, chicken boti, seekh kebab, the WRAPS.... not a big fan of the samosas but definitely love the Chicken Jalfrezi they do on special days. 
Yummmmmmm.
author: Sia P.

description: Had the biryani; it was just okay ; ordered the prawn masala for take out and it wasn't impressive at all either. It's disorganized and very food fragrant.
author: Ehab A.

description: Really solid Indian restaurant with lots of choices for a small amount of money. Came here with the family for my dad's birthday today, so we ordered A LOT of food for four people. We had the lamb vindaloo, catfish tandoori, chicken tandoori, chicken biryani, 2 regular naan, 1 garlic naan, mango lassi, beef kabobs, and mixed veggie korma. It all just came out to 48 dollars! Everything was seasoned very well, but not overly salty or greasy. The chicken tandoori was an especially good deal (3 dollars for a very very large portion). The food came out piping hot and in a very reasonable amount of time. Get here before 7 pm though, as it starts to fill up afterward. You will definitely have trouble getting an order in at that time.
author: Danny C.

description:
A magical authentic Indian food joint with enough that will make you filled for days. I spent $7 on a curry with naan bread and after a few minutes I really couldn't walk anymore because I was slowly becoming horizontally challenged.
The only thing I found the problem was the location in the TL, do not go in this area past nine, there are homeless people everywhere trying to take any cent. 
TL sucks, food here is wonderful.
author: Jon-o G.

description:
Still delicious after all these years. 

Last night's dinner consisted of bhindi masala, chicken tikka masala, lamb biryani, keema naan and plain naan. All for $25 and some change.

My bf and I were stuffed silly, and we have a quite a bit leftover.
author: May T.

description: Beware. If you come on Saturday night, don't expect good service, and don't expect to get your food under 45 minutes. Sit as far away from the kitchen as possible, otherwise you'll walk out stinking like oil and smoke. And if there are friends of the owner who walks in after you, expect to get served AFTER them. And expect the server and cooks to appear frazzled and unfocused, which causes everything in the system to run extra slow. Other than that, the taste of the food is okay. At least they use authentic spices. I think the trick is to order at the counter before you get seated.
author: John R.

description: Not worth the walk. Check the math of the cashier, you food may have hair in it, and the Indian place on o'farrell is much better. If I want to get mugged and eat from a bad restaurant then chutney is the spot.
author: Joseph C.

description: A horrible day at work left me on the look out for some tasty Indian food. It was after lunch but before dinner and many places were closed so I wandered from the Civic Center to this even more savory area of town. I had heard great things about Shalimar, and was on my way over but I saw Chutney, looking a lot cleaner, lively, and more inviting (dont get me wrong, i love dirty, uninviting places, and I will try Shalimar soon) So I ordered the cheesse naan, shrimp tikki massala and the mattar paneer (My all time fav dish). The guy behind the counter was super nice and friendly. I then hightailed it back to my office to stink up mu cubicle with ethnic food.  Of course the food was piping hot and needed a good while to cool down. But the naan was excellent and when the food cooled down I was very happy with both dishes especially the tikki massala shrimp.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Moved to the area, and have been going to several Indian places for a while now. This was not real Indian food.

I ordered the Chicken Vindaloo. This should be made with yogurt, sometimes coconut milk, etc. So, it should be chicken in a thick red base. 

Instead, the Chicken Vindaloo I ordered from Chutney was essentially chicken, with bone in it, in some sort of transparent broth.

And you normally get rice to go with it. I did not.

I did also order regular Naan. that was pretty good. Hence me giving this place two stars (would have gotten one otherwise).
author: Tim M.

description: Cheap, tasty Indian food! one of the best pudina chutneys i've ever had!
author: ravi m.

description:
You ever been to a place and you know your stomach is gonna pay for it later, but you tell yourself it is so good that you don't even care? This is the spot. My girlfriend first told me about this place and it has become a staple for us when we're craving Indian/Pakistani food. Also glad they opened the Fremont one too for it has more room and closer to us. Anyways, our mainstay meals always involve the following:

1. Chicken Tikka Masala: orange sauce is spicy and hearty and the chicken is just so delicious drowned in that sauce

2. Wheat Naan bread: You take the bread and soak it in that orange sauce. Makes you feel naughty for even thinking it. LoL

3. Tandoori Chicken: Chicken is delicious, spiced well and has that nice char flavor that would have you ordering a second helping. 

These three dishes alone will make you come begging for more. Only drawback is it does take a toll on me the next day, but you know what, I've always been back since. So don't let my stomach stop you from coming here. The food is delicious and very affordable!
author: Shane R.

description:
Be sure you come with at least another person, not the safest neighborhood but the food makes it worth the risk :-)

The food and service was amazing and CHEAP! The establishment itself was was not too shabby for being considered a dive. I felt it was clean enough to eat off the table, not that I did. Hands down the best Indian food I've ever had! Must try the Chicken Tikki Marsala, the fresh made Naan is awesome, the Tandori is actually very tasty (I'm picky), there was a veggie dish with cauliflower that was super tasty as well.

Def paying another visit the next time out there.
author: Eva H.

description: I am addicted to their lamb biriyani! The chicken is good as well, but that lamb is no joke. And be nice to the crackheads (viva tenderloin) outside-- you'll get good karma.
author: Kazuma Y.

description: Excellent food. Great value. Great service. Personable staff and great mango lassi! Make sure to try the naan!
author: Ashley S.

description: I ate here while staying in SF for the first time. I really liked the seekh kebabs that I ordered. They were tasty and a great value.
author: Sofia A.

description: Bleh, ick, and gross are the words that come to mind when I think about the meal I just ate from Chutney. My boyfriend and I ordered takeout after reading the Yelp reviews since our favorite spot in the area was closed. Talk about a total let down. We got home and took everything out and every container was filled halfway with oil separated from what was apparently curry. We had two chicken dishes which were all bones and the only thing that was decent was the chana masala and the garlic naan.The craziest part is how busy this place was so I can only hope we just had a bad batch of food...sad eating times for us.
author: Alex M.

description:
Okay, so I will begin this review by stating that I just finished eating aloo vindaloo, onion naan, and some mango chutney, and I'm in shock.  And not the good kind.  

I've been wanting to try this place forever because of the reviews on yelp and that it was recommended to me by a coworker.  I don't know if I'm missing some sort of Chutney chip or something but my food just wasn't... good.  First of all, the reason one orders vindaloo curry is for the spice.  I even specifically asked for spicy, and what I received wasn't even mild; it was straight up bland (and strangely colored for that matter).  The naan was okay, but the whole time I ate it, I wished it was kulcha.  The best part of my whole meal was the chutney, go figure.
author: Laura C.

description: This is my favorite Indian food place in downtown San Francisco. It has the best chicken tikka masala. Great nice and delicious naan. Tried a couple of other dishes there frequently and have nothing bad to say about this place. Maybe that once in awhile the seating gets a little hectic. If your in the mood for some Indian food this is a must try.
author: Darin Bom N.

description: I used to go here ALL the time. If a restaurant cannot keep the appetite of the people of the same ethnic group, then that place is no good. The owner/order guy was completely rude and unhelpful. The naan was soggy; they were cooked completely and it felt like the chicken in the butter chicken was cooked separately and the sauce was added to the chicken. The day was not that busy and it was after lunch, so I do not know why they half-assed our food. I felt disgusted after eating there and its a shame because as an Indian, EVEN I like this place. Bad move people, bad move.
author: Manu M.

description:
I go here at least once a month to grab yummy prawn tika-kasara and chicken vindaloo.
someone says indian isn't healthy food though, for me, lots kind of spice recharge me especiallyehen I feel slicely sick or tired.

Their ordering and paying system are little strange, but it doesn't  bother their food.

Just one thing, I hope the front door can close completely, otherwise freezing wind sticks my skin...
author: Spinof P.

description:
My friend and I checked out this restaurant yesterday while we were in town.  

At first when I walked in I was pretty skeptical, because I when I go to an ethnic restaurant, I expect the cooks and staff to be of the same ethnicity.  I was surprised, when they were not...but I learned my lesson to not stereotype, because I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  

They first start you off with salad, which I was not a fan of.  The salad came out plain, no fluff, no dressing.  I wasn't really expecting fluff...but I was expecting dressing.  I ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala and it was fantastic!  I stick to what I know and I was not disappointed.  What I like about their Tikka Masala is that it is a little bit spicier than I'm used to and it was great.  It's not unbearable, it was just right.

Overall, the service and food was great!  I would go back to this restaurant again when I'm in the city.
author: Pritika C.

description:
My husband and I were looking for some good, quick, spicy food on a Friday night.  We saw the ratings were high for this place and when we walked up to it we were excited about the huge line and all the people inside.  Its a modest, well priced restaurant and we had a great meal.  We ordered the chicken Tikka Masala (which is as good as others say it is) and lamb chops.  We loved the food and the atmosphere.  The free salad and chai was an extra bonus!  We will be back here again!

A quick tip: if your going to do take-out call ahead and order so you dont have to wait in line! They are very popular!
author: Karie M.

description:
word,

I've never been to India but I don't believe in Indian culture they have an equivalent to the American type diners. However if they did I think it would be Chutney.

Like a diner its very casual eating experience. You order and wait for the food to be delivered to your table. It being casual there is no 'water guy' to fill your glass so your in charge of getting your water, there is also free tea by the way.

Also like a diner the food is simple and cheap. The dishes are good, but in no means complex palettes. You can get a good buttery tikka marsala dish with whatever meat you want and also more authentic dishes like foods in a chicken bryani or chicken saag. 

Lastly, like any decent diner the food is very cheap. You'd be hard pressed to spend more that $15 on yourself here.

All in all its a good place to eat with friends or co-workers, however I would not take someone here in order to impress them

yups
author: david h.

description:
Geez, I really need to catch up on my reviews. I ate at Chutney like a month ago! Sorry if this review isn't as detailed. Chutney is another great tasting, no fuss Indian spot. I love when you're with a big group because you get to dig into lots of people's dishes haha. This turned out to be a great thing because while everyone else's dinner was tasty (hence 4 stars!), I was quite displeased with my own.   

I got a pretty typical Indian dish, the Palak Paneer. It's basically spinach cooked with spices and home made Indian cheese. Usually it's one of my favorites but Chutney's version was a bit unappetizing. Instead of chopping up the spinach, they pureed it. And it wasn't just pureed spinach but pureed spinach with the spices and even some of the cheese. WHY?! I felt like I was eating baby barf. I know it all goes down the same but while I'm eating, I like a bit of texture. 

While my curry was disappointing, I'd like to note that the Naan and Roti are super fluffy and hot. MMMM! It was perfect with all my friend's dishes haha. They are also the same low price of one dollar! So why not go healthier? Whole wheat all the way baby. The Chicken Kabab Wrap was pretty bomb too.
author: Julia T.

description:
Chutney is awesome because it's cheap, quick and delicious.  It's my go-to place when I'm craving indian food.  We got:

Chicken Tikka Masala = very good
Aloo  Gohbi = very good.  perfect mix of potato, cauliflower and spices
Lamb Biryani = very good and they're not stingy w/ the lamb chunks either
Chicken curry = good
Lamb vindaloo = good but it could be a bit more spicy.
Naan and plain rice = good
author: Michelle T.

description:
This place has some great Indian food for a very low price.
The atmosphere could be a little nicer but hey, that's part of the experience.
Chicken tikka masala is my favorite!
author: Tobi K.

description:
We came at 10.30pm, it was full of people.  But we still got our table very quick.

Tandoori Lamb Chop - Not too much flavor from the spices but moist
Chicken Tikka Masala - good
Bengan Bharta (eggplant dish) - good
Garlic Naan - good but will order normal Naan next time since there is not much diffrence after we dipped in the sause
Basmati rice - good
Chai - free always good

I'll come back again to try other dishes.
author: Manda W.

description:
It is not a fancy place but this reminds me of my college days back home in India  and also in Pittsburgh where I did my MS .
A decent place decor wise, but awesome and cheap food

Found the ultimate place for lamb based dishes.
Their lamb biryani was tasty and not at all dry. 
Their lamb curry is so tender and soft.

The person at the counter to take the order is helpful, you can relax, and eat and take your time.

Open till late is also a big plus in my books.

The only negative point is the salad which they give upfront. I did not like it at all , but its complimentary so either eat it or refuse it when they bring it to you.

If only they add thumsup to their list of beverages, then it will be my go to place for all seasons :)
author: Utsav M.

description: As everyone else had pointed out, the garlic naan is great. A true evaluation of this place would be incomplete without a comparison to both Shalimar and Pakwan, however. Shalimar is clearly the greasiest, which has its own appeal. Pakwan is the spiciest (on par with Lahora down the street. Chutney has the freshest ingredients. While it may be more pricey that the other Indian/Pakistani restaurants on the block, it has excellent decor/atmosphere, friendly staff, and of course, superb dishes.
author: Drew V.

description:
Me: "Do you have anything on the menu that is or could be made vegan?"
Chutney: "You would love [unintelligible] Chicken Tikka Masala."
Me: "That has meat in it."
Chutney: "Yes?"

-_- no thanks.
author: Tony G.

description: In good days, it's solid 4 star but in bad days, it's two star... The food quality is not very consistent here unfortunately.
author: Yuko K.

description:
I returned here to have dinner twice in one weekend. Great, because: You can call ahead for takeout, because it is so busy, there is chai tea, for free with a meal, that is self-service in the back.

The meals are spicy, but delicious! The wheat naan is better than the whole wheat naan and the potato naan. The vegetarian meals are wonderful, I recommend the green peas, and potatoes.
author: Emily B.

description: I loved their Chicken Jal Frazi
author: Abdull S.

description: Love the very non-authentic food but excellent regardless. Dodgy neighborhood in the Tenderloin, and a few health things for those who are squeamish but way better than the nearby comparables shall we say. The odd roach, given, the overall context, is nothing that I've ever seen and wouldn't deter me anyway and I've been there dozens of times. Go there and feast for $20. Love the place. Pack heat after dark (kidding, but use a cab.....). No booze as it's a muslim place but that's not the point of it...
author: EM T.

description:
Love chutneys. Its cleaner than Shalimar's (across the street) and the food taste great. 

only one issue I have ever had with them, the first time I ate here when they first opened, I noticed they charged me different from what was advertised on the menu. Of Course I brought this to the attention of the cashier and they gave me the run around. It was only a few dollars more. 

BUT.... since the food was great.... I had to come back and try it again..... and again... and again..lol 

No overcharging problems after that first time though... so thats a plus.
author: Ish A.

description:
Great cheap Indian food.  One of the best places to eat Indian food in SF. I live in New York and miss it dearly.  Cheap and quick food that rivals most of the top notch restaurants that charge double.

I say this is cheap & quick, but the inside is nice.  This isn't a complete nasty dive or hole in the wall.  If you're looking for good Indian food in the Tenderloin, eat here.
author: M E.

description:
Okay.
I'm guilty for revisting Chutney's...AGAIN. 
Second time this month.
I just LOVEEEE IT!! 

Since I'm so obsessed with the Chicken Tikki Masala, we decided to order that as well as a Lamb Tikki Masala. I just love the creamy orangey curry that comes with it. For two people, we shared two curries, and 3 naans: 2 garlic, 1 onion.

CHICKEN Tikki Masala vs. LAMB Tikki Masala
Chicken is sweeter. Lamb is not as sweet, more on the spicy end.
Chicken pieces are dryer. Lamb pieces are more fatty aka tastier.
Chicken curry is less oily. Lamb curry has more prominent oil marks.

Overall, I really enjoyed both. Halfway through, the Lamb Tikki Masala got a bit too spicy for me but grab a bottle of their Mint Chutney from their fridge, dab a bit on and you're good to go. Promise!
author: Heidi C.

description: Liked the baigan bharta , garlic naan was good in taste except for burned bottom because of which I had to let go a decent portion. However , the size of the naan was huge in itself so that payed off. Ambiance ok , cleanliness ok . Meal is served with complimentary salad and tea. Another plus point.
author: Katty D.

description: Food was good and the prices were great.The food could have been great as well, if it was'nt mildly cold! Whats the point of asking for your name if your not going to call it out when your order is ready Mr. Man with the SF cap. Shame on you.
author: Carlos A.

description:
The Marsala Chicken, Spinach and Potatoes, beef stew, so GOOD.

After the Marsala Chicken, you dont want anything else, it is that good.

Anybody that is human needs to try this dish, cause the sauce is the best part, dip your Naan in it, mix it with your rice, eat it with your other dishes, just try the Marsala Chicken.
author: Dave C.

description:
this place is cool.  i like there food and the people there are really friendly.  my first time there, i was there with my family they we ordered a shit load of food.  we also ordered to go for my other family that wasnt able to go.  but god dam i think i walked over to the counter to order 3 times.  
it was cool that the guy gave us 4 mango lassi even though i only ordered and paid for 2.  the the lamb here is softer and better than naan and curries.  but the curry at naan and curry was better.  
i dont really trip about it being in "shady" area because...i just dont trip aite.  the only real thing about the "shady" area is that someone let off a m-1000 once on the corner and i was standing near the front door.  it just shows that some people dont have better things to do.
author: Steven K.

description: If you want to eat the worst Indian food you should go here. I would definitely recommend it so that you may appreciate good Indian food when you eat somewhere else. No service. Untidy. This place is best example of how you can go wrong with a restaurant.
author: Anurag G.

description: This place used to be wonderful. Paneer tikka masala WAS the best. Has undeniably gone downhill recently. Not quite sure what happened but definitely on the hunt for a new place to call home.
author: Jacq H.

description: Alright so everyone knows about Chutney now. It's the best Indian food in the city. They used to charge $3.99 per dish, but with all this hype they jacked it up a couple of bucks. It's still pretty cheap and the food is the best. Did I say the best? It is the best.
author: Camille R.

description:
Before, I used to avoid indian curry. The first time I had it, the spices and spiciness were too much for me and the situation afterward was unfortunate.

Since then, I had slowly started to eat spicier things but had not yet gotten over the previous experience. However, my friends really wanted to eat curry so I decided to go along and try it again. If it was too spicy, I knew at least I liked the bread. 

Long story short, the point is their mild is good for me. I love their shrimp Marsala and I had a lamb wrap type thing that I don't remember the name of... but it tasted really really good.

Also, really really want to come back here again when I'm in the area

There was one thing that I found kind of funny/interesting though (not in a bad nor good way, just different I guess): their water has a slight wood smoked flavor or herb smoked flavor...?

Edit:
OMG, why in the world is it that whenever I come here, I eat so much! I don't order that much and I feel like a stuffed (chicken...? elephant...? pig...?) animal by the end of the meal! Their cauliflower and lamb dish thing is super good but a bit too oily. I'm really interested in trying their cauliflower and potato but still trying to justify ordering vegetables... absolutely amazing!
author: Christina W.

description: Like the food here so much! I've been here twice, and so far everything I tried are delicious! I like lamb tikka masala, lamb biryani and mango lassi. It takes some time to wait for the food at dinner time. So coming early for dinner can save a lot time. Really like the biryani!! Just finished my big dinner, and I already think about next time. Wish I could try more times.
author: Chao L.

description: the boyfriend and i love coming here when we can find parking.  food is good and we always leave absolutely stuffed.
author: ashley d.

description:
The blandest Indian food I've ver had.  Curry had no spice or kick to it.  The naan was cold and dry (probably because they wrapped it up in a torn paper bag, instead of in foil).

You're MUCH better off going 1 block down to naan n curry.
author: Mack D.

description:
All right. I'm vegan, but I've heard amazing stories of this place called Shalimar... I figured it's Indian/Pakistani so they'll probably be able to accommodate my boyfriend and me. Well, not so much since we couldn't order naan or rice. Sucks, too because it smelled amazing in there!

Well, saddened but still hungry for Indian food, we skipped across the street to Chutney. We figured that this Tandooriloin, and they definitely had vegan friendly things, so it must be good!

Nah. Not really. It wasn't spicy enough, it wasn't flavorful enough, it wasn't what I'd call good Indian food. Well, the guy who took our order told us straight up what didn't have dairy in it when we asked, so that was something that was okay here... They still weren't that good, though.

Seriously, we should have stuck with what we knew and went straight for Pakwan, which isn't the best, but it's definitely better than Chutney.
author: Miss C.

description:
Came here with 16 people, called the night before and managed to get a reservation which is always great.

Simply put, the food here is really good. I had a tasty lamb tikka masala with the ground meat naan. My friend's dishes were good as well. I highly recommend this place.
author: Jeff S.

description: The day when people stop adding tomato in biryani that day can be celebrated as the day of authentic biryani .... Indians wouldn't enjoy this place ... All the dishes r completely in Pakistani style
author: Vamsi P.

description: Great food!the location is simple, but the food is simply delicious!order everything in the beginning though, if you want more bread etc later it might take too long due to their order system!love this place
author: Charlotte O.

description: Food is very well done. they have the best chicken tiki marsala and naans in the city. other than the 2 I mentioned others are good but it is very greasy. this place is not good for sit down dinners as the enviroment you are in is little rough but great for to go...
author: Seda M.

description:
ive been going to this spot for yeeeeears. and they have never disappointed. everything is just so flavorful, all these spices, sauces, ugh it's so good! ive had most of the menu already, and had been made a bigger fan of lamb and goat. and their mango chutney is sooo yummy, you gotta mix that with everything! the curries, naan, rice, i can eat a spoonful by itself. and it's only a buck!

oh but don't fret, their vegetarian options are just as scrumptious. i was a regular when i swore off meat for two months. their vegetable curries are just as great, eggplant dish, and potatoes will make you not even miss the taste of animals. i left just as full as a veggie head.

it gets a little stuffy in here and you gotta take your coat off immediately before sitting down, otherwise your sweaters and jackets will reak of curry and smoke. unless that's your thing ;)

amazing food, reasonable prices, can't go wrong, seriously! 

check out my cousin's review of our usual order :)

http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=6hba2n5q9Zb1Ah7Z5ag3Rg&q=chutney
author: Mitch N.

description:
I never miss this spot when I'm in San Francisco. Excellent quality of food. The chicken tikka masala with naan is extremely tasty. Don't miss out on the tandoori chicken!

Parking will be tough, that's the case with anywhere in SF. However, there is a garage that chargers $10 or so right next to this restaurant.
author: Alan S.

description: One of my favorite Indians. Chutney had the free chai great prices and great food. The chicken tikka masala naan and the tandoori chicken. And the nihari which is an item not always available. It's soo good. And it's renovated unlike other Indian places ex shalimar.
author: Amien P.

description:
If you like Indian food, this place is pretty good. Strong, exotic flavors and very affordable prices make this a great place for you and some buddies, although I wouldn't take a date here.

When you walk into the place, the smell of spices will wash over you to reassure you that they don't skimp out on those ingredients even though the prices are so low. I like my food mild, and too many other places equate "mild" with "make it more bland," so I really appreciate that they successfully use lots of spices while still having the heat level stay mild.

The portion sizes are more than satisfactory for me, but since I'm a relatively light eater compared to most of my friends, that probably means that most people would consider the portions to be medium or medium-small. However, since the vast majority of their curries are in the $6.50-7.00 range, I still think that the price-to-amount ratio is very good.

That being said, you do need to pay extra for rice and naan bread, which will bring your total up to about $10. You can probably share rice with a friend though, or two friends if you stretch it carefully.

Also, soda drinkers, be aware that you'll be paying $1 for a can of soda, no refills. Your table will get a big pitcher of water that they'll keep full for free, but still, I'm always a little sad when places don't have free refills.
author: James L.

description:
The girlfriend and I decided to try this place on a whim and were surprised with our meal.

We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken Breast, and Naan.  The food was pretty good but the portions could have been a little bigger.

The workers provided friendly and quick service.  The restaurant was kept very clean and organized.  Unfortunately, the restaurant got crowded quickly since there was limited seating.

Definitely a surprisingly good meal.

Parking was also very difficult to find, though not surprising for a restaurant in the city.
author: Joseph A.

description:
I went here on a recommendation. My good friend swore it was better than every other place I would frequent when in SF, so I took a chance.

After parking the car, I passed by a man who looked me dead in the eye as he huddled on the sidewalk and smoked crack. I was too through.

However, making it INSIDE was an Oasis. Very clean, pretty spacious. The prices are INCREDIBLE and the food is ridiculously good.

2 Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Biryani, Vegetable Biryani, 2 naan and drinks didn't even come to $30 bucks.

I understand that this is not one of my more entertaining reviews. That is because I find nothing funny about this place. Only deliciousness.
author: J X.

description:
Dude no way.  NO WAY is this place better than Lahore Karahi, Tikka Masala, or even Shalimar.
I ordered the same thing as always (chicken tikka masala, side of rice, garlic naan).
The consistency of the CTM was like soup, but like, soup for old people.
There was no salt, no spice, no heat.  It was terrible!
The garlic naan was decent.
DEFINTIELY does not deserve the ratings.  There are MUCH better Indian places in the TL!
author: Meh M.

description: If you want good food this is the place we loved the. seekh kabobs and bhindi masala and tandoori roti was freshly made to perfection.
author: Timmy T.

description:
We came to the city to see Wicked which got out at 11:00 pm and headed up to Chutney after the show which was a perfect end to our night. You order at the counter but they have waiter service after ordering and bring your food and drinks to the table.
WOW - It was dinner for 20.00 for both of us including tip! 
It was fast, tasty, a clean place and very friendly service and all you can drink chai tea. 
The tandori chicken was fantastic, my mango lasi drink was smooth and fruity, the chicken tiki masala was really good and the garlic naan was perfect.  
You cant get a better meal for 20.00 we were satisfied happy and stuffed - Wish we had one of these in the far east bay! 
I usually pay 50.00 for the same amount of food at most Indian restaurants near us and I think this was the yummiest I have had in a while.
author: Erin M.

description: I thought I would end up with leftovers because it felt like I ordered too much. The food was so good that my bf and I finished everything! Good prices, generous servings.  Service was great =)
author: Ami N.

description:
Super sketchy part of town, but I guess worth risking my life for a good meal.  We came last night for a late dinner at around 10:15pm.  I went with three other friends and really enjoyed my meal.  The portions were on the smaller side, but we all walked away very full on just $15 per person which included two orders of dessert.  

Favorites:
Goat stew (excited to see this meat on the menu)
Tandoori chicken (juicy and tasty)
Naan and roti (perfectly baked)
Chutneys (nice and spicy)

Not so great:
Benghan bharta (not very flavorful and better at Pakwan in the Mission)
Saag paneer (one of the worst that I've had)
Lamb vindaloo (not nearly spicy enough)
author: Catherine J.

description:
the tenderloin has never tasted so good!

$20 = a mountain of tasty dishes

we order out a lot, but have also spent many nights dining in at Chutney. the naan is only a $1.00, and by far the best in the city.

they have specials everyday so be sure to ask or look on the board before ordering.

the family who owns it are super nice, and go out of their way to make sure you're happy. that's the shining star of my experience.
author: Bruce A.

description: I'm giving this place 5 starts only because of the food, its the best indian food I have ever ate....EVER. As far as service...horrible, and seems to get worse the more you go (we tip good too!) even though the same people work the counter they are always difficult.
author: Sam M.

description: An excellent authentic Indian Restaurant.  Tastes home-cooked.  We went twice on vacation and loved both the Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian dishes.  Mutter Paneer, Bhindi Masala, and Chicken Tikka Masala were amazing.  Not to mention the complimentary hot Tea.  This restaurant doesn't try to impress you with the fancy decor, just good quick service and delicious food!!
author: Veena B.

description: Not a huge Indian Food fan, but Chutney is alright in my book.  They prepare the food really fast.  Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan were tasty.  If I HAVE to eat Indian Cuisine, I guess I'd eat here, but it's kind of near the crackhead part of town so maybe not.
author: Dee H.

description:
the. food. is. amazing.

by far the best 'nann-n-curry' type cuisine in san fran. It's tasty, fulfilling and most importantly, it never lets me down.

-chicken tikka masala: i wish they throw in a couple more pieces of their delicious chicken, but the sauce is heaven. I always need a million pieces of nann to soak it up!

-lamb vindaloo- spicy, tasty, yummy. A regular dish for me. The lamb is fall off the bone good! also comes with pieces of potatoe1

-mango chutney! a must get. it goes so well with everything. I love laying on the chutney, the spicy green sauce then slapping on whatever the dish I can salvage from my hungry friends. IT IS DELIOUS!

good prices, great service. great dining experience!
author: Alex C.

description:
I like it cant help it. 
Tandoori chicken legs!
Tikka masala sauce only without the piece of chicken
Potato Naan
and Alloo Mutter great!
author: Mina T.

description: I don't come here anymore, I go to Pakwan just across the Street. They drove me away the last time I ordered Chicken Keema and somehow the cook didn't put any spices in it whatsoever, it was throughly bland and tasteless. Also I once ordered chicken vindaloo and it consisted of one chicken neck with absolutely no meat and a bunch of pieces of potato.
author: Mira L.

description: This place get's an A+ for flavor. However, both dishes I ordered were super greasy: lamb with spinach, and lamb with lentils.They don't skimp on the chicken in their chicken salad. The chicken is well seasoned but  salty. The lettuce in the salad, however, could be fresher. The folks behind the counter are friendly and courteous. The place is good but I'm not sure I'd go there again with so many other highly-rated restaurants in the neighborhood to try.
author: Jon L.

description: Very good cheap Indian food. Found this place through Yelp while visiting SF. Service was great too!
author: Susan S.

description:
I got addicted to indian food b/c of chutney! I wish this place was located near my house in sonoma so I could eat it everyday! The food is amazing and cheap, the service is quick, and the staff is nice. My fav is tikka masala, the eggplant curry, and of course the many different naan. Also the free tea or chai is good. It's loctated in the back and its self served.

The only thing I didn't like was the location of the restaurant. It was hard to find parking, so we would always park in a lot that cost $. 

The only thing I miss about my sf days was this place :(
author: Michelle C.

description:
Every time I am in SF (which is often) I try and make a stop at Chutney's - a no-frills/no-hassle spot that is really delivers EXCELLENT Indian fare for cheap.  Granted I am a Pescatarian, but friends and associates have ordered the Chicken Tikka Marsala and raved.  Myself, I always order the Bengan Bharta (Eggplant) and either Mattar Paneer or Saag Paneer, rice and either Onion or Garlic Naan.  So, 2 dishes, rice, and Naan all for under 20 bucks.  Realistically, one dish is enough but when its good, why not over indulge.
It was bummer that they lost their license to allow you to bring your own beverage (this is the Tenderloin, so there are plenty of shops nearby for brew) but nonetheless, if you are looking for tasty grub on the cheap, hit Chutney's.
author: Mark K.

description: I've been coming to Chutney for close to ten years now. It is my go-to spot for Paki-comfort food. It's pretty much the premier spot for consistently good Pakistani fare at a very reasonable price. Just last night, I had dinner for less than $8, with hot, fresh, aloo (potato) naan, tandoori chicken and a drink. These guys are well known for their Butter Chicken, aka Chicken Tikka Masala, a dish with chunks of spicy barbecue chicken swimming in a creamy, lightly spiced and fragrant sauce. It goes best with their fluffy naan, cooked in a clay oven. You can also get traditional Pakistani favorites like Biryani, Nihari, and some fresh takes on the classics, like Chicken Jalfrezi. But be forewarned: although this place is a smallish, cheap spot, do not consider this a fast food joint. Service is attentive, yet food is slow. This is the place to relax, bring a few friends, enjoy the free sweet chai and linger over food and conversation. Just don't linger too long, because I have to eat there too.
author: Zehra A.

description:
Not a lot to say about Chutney. You're close to Little Delhi, so if you want four stars, go there. That said, Chutney will do just fine.

Pluses: Inexpensive, good-tasting, fast.

Minuses: Too many bones in the chicken, too much cardamom in the saag, next day, my hands still smell like Indian food.

That's about all I have to say.
author: Jeff H.

description: I've lived in the area for a few years now, and I'd always go to Lahore Karahi (which is down the block from Chutney) because everyone told me it was the best Indian food in town. I finally tried Chutney and not only do I like the food better, but I much prefer the atmosphere and service. I feel stupid for not trying Chutney sooner, because now it's one of the main places I eat.
author: Tyler K.

description:
I love hanging out on the filthiest corner of the tenderloin surrounded by piss, shit and pigeon feathers, talking to an insane man with no teeth because our to-go order is taking so goddamn loooong to come out.  Does lamb take longer to cook than chicken?  According to the dude at the counter it does but I think he might have lied.
