Although, they don't serve alcohol we were able to jolt across the street and get a bottle of wine which they gladly allowed us to bring in. They give you a lot of food and that is always a plus.
author: Leslie A.

description: This place was GREAT.  All of the items were ala carte, in fairly small portions, but both of us got really full for like 17 dollars.  It is easy and fun to order a bunch of little stuff and a bunch of naan and try it all.  if this is an introduction to Indian and Pakistani food, you couldn't do much better.  The staff was very helpful and super nice, they seemed like they had many regulars.  This would be a great place for a couple or a group.
author: Jerad D.

description: Horrible vegetarian food! Vegetarians stay away from their very greasy and flavorless veggie offerings!
author: Ratna K.

description: This food was off the friggin chains enough said but I only give 3 stars because me and my friend had the bubble guts right after and we had to walk far for Starbucks bathroom. And I can't say it's because of the type of food because I've eaten Indian food ALOT and never had the bubble guts before.....
author: Jacky I.

description:
like the stars say 
its ok not the place i would suggest
rather go eat there.

again they are here to make just "money" like  all the curry restaurants in the city.
author: Bunty P.

description: In comparison to all the order-at-the-counter joints in the neighborhood, Chutney is practically upscale, a place you could bring parents who recoil at the sight of water spots on a spoon and think anything other than chicken chow mein is more exotic than they can manage. You'll find all the standards, like chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, tandoor lamb chops, and naan, at dirt-cheap prices. Most of the dishes are underspiced, so don't be shy about letting them know if you prefer your food on the hot side. The preparations may not be as authentic as those in the other local dives, but at least you won't be making a mental note of obvious health violations while you eat.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Contrary to many yelper's opinions, Chutney does not have the best Chicken Tikka Masala in the Tenderloin let alone the best in SF. Want to know why Im so confident? I tried them. In one night. We called it the 2010 Tikka Tour. Yes it's a bit cheesy but think about it. When you taste wine you need to taste them side by side to have a frame of reference. So last Saturday night we went to three different Indian places in the Loin to see which has the best Tikka Masala. Chutney ranked number 2 behind Shalimar but beat out the place that is actually called Tikka Masala. Chutney had the nicest decor and a friendly staff but we all thought that the Tikka was had too much tomato flavor and not enough chicken or spice. They did make us a garlic naan on whole wheat which was noteworthy.
author: Kris N.

description: Love this place. The achaar chicken special is delicious and their naan is SO GOOD. Also love their biryani!
author: Rabia K.

description: One of the cooks called my friend a slut in spanish for grabbing a table before we ordered.
author: Anisa E.

description: Chutney is a cleaner and more friendly addition to the Pak-Loin area, but that doesn't take much when compared to Shalimar, Pakwan, etc. I personally think the food here is pretty top notch. I've gone here a few times after hitting Swig for happy hour and always with deliciously-filling results. Fresh naan, solid vegetarian dishes and very nice chicken tikka masala means I'll be coming back for more. As with most Pakistani joints, it's BYOB. There are two stores across the street, one of them has Indian beer too!
author: Nish N.

description: Hands down the best Indian food I've ever tasted in my life. I use to go here all the time after work because it's only 10MIN. walking distance or 5MIN. if you take the bus (i mean, if you're that lazy). HAA. Anyway, everytime I go here I get the chai tea, chicken tikka masala, rice and naan. Mmm. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.. lol. The workers are really friendly and everyone's super nice. I love going into Chutney's because there's so much diversity. One of my favorite restaurants in Frisko.
author: Criselle O.

description: I absolutely love this place. Roughly 5 years ago my friends and I just arrived in town and wanted a quick bite to eat before a show at the American Music Hall. That's when we randomly came across Chutney. We were slightly sceptical about the food seeing how cheap their menu is. Anyhow we proceeded to order when we noticed there was no alcohol on the menu. I asked the cashier," No beer or wine?" He smiled and replied," Sorry, but you're more than welcome to go across the street to the liquor store and bring in whatever." That just bumped up their rating. Not only did they allow BYOB but the food was Delicious. I've never had any complaints. Yet another reason I the miss bay.
author: Randall P.

description: This is good, good, good Paki food. It's also HELLA cheap. Which makes it even better. You can eat and eat and eat and eat until your tastebuds fall out. Which they will, because everything is so tasty.
author: Ahnui Y.

description: Incredible food! We out-of-towners probably shouldn't have gone trotting through the Tenderloin at night to get there, but it was totally worth it. The best chicken tikka masala I've had yet, basmati rice cooked just right, and wonderful garlic naan. The boyfriend and I both had dinner for less than $20, including our mango yogurt drinks. Win!
author: Dana D.

description: Awesome! I always get excited when I know I'm gonna have Chutney's. Try the tandoori fish! The best fish I ever had! Has bones but it's worth it! Chicken Tikka Malasa is the best in town. Friendly staff too and if you don't like something you ordered, they will replace it for free! Can't beat that! I'm going now. See u there!
author: Tai Y.

description: I heart Chutney! This casual Indian/Pakistani restaurant is delicious and cheap. You order at the counter, don't necessarily have table service during your meal (though they bring your food to you) and you pay at the counter at the end of your meal. It's very laid-back, but the crowd is always pleasant (and noisy)! If you're not looking for an intimate setting, this is the perfect place to meet friends for dinner. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Anne A.

description: This place is sooooooo good. opened late, great price. great food. I had the naan .. normal one and garlic one...  with goat curry, and this chicken curry. It was SO GOOD. The Lamb biryani was DELICIOUS. love it. It sort of has a mexican feel to the food. Like cilantro and sliced tomatoes in the biryani, it was awesome. They also have free milk tea too...that was really really good too. I also liked the free salad too. very good indian food!!!! Theres a bunch of bums outside tho haha. but its tenderloin so yeah.
author: Cindy L.

description: Came here in a late Sunday night, I love Indian food and I'm super excited to try out this new place! In fact, there are a bunch of Indian restaurants in the city which are waiting for you to try them out~ I ordered Chicken tikka masala, biryani and naan, these 3 are good, as always. Then I tried the prawn with potatoes and spicy curry, ist Vondali? Well, I never tried a 'vondali' before so I thought I should, but I did not like it.. The taste is too light for me, I guess I am gonna jst stick with the classic! The service is pretty good, and the atmosphere is nice too... I dont like the location tho.
author: Marlis T.

description: Eeek! I love this place. Delicious food and BYOB. If you think of it, pack a bottle opener too. It's yummy, fast and inexpensive.
author: Megan D.

description: Everyone who says this place isn't spicy enought is either lying or has an ass made out of US steel. I had the Chicken Vindaloo there yesterday and it fogged me up real good. Yes, I've had spicier, but this was an ENJOYABLE spiciness. And the garlic naan is better at Kennedy's. Or maybe it's just saltier. Regardless, the decor is dark but welcoming, the space is open and two people can essentially feast here for around $20. I know I'll be going back...
author: Jeremy W.

description:
if you haven't noticed, i've been on a mediterranean and indian food kick of late. why? hell if i know. probably because i'm sick of the same old shit. 

along with shalamar, this place is in my neighbourhood and it kicks major ass. although it took a long time for my food to get to me, the food was at least pretty effing good. i'll have to try more things on the menu.
author: James J.

description: Good service, great food.  Luv that garlic naan !
author: Chuck W.

description:
I feel like Cush in Jerry Mcgurire on where he wanted to be drafted.  Surf or ski or go and eat at Shalimar or Chutneys for Best SF Indian food.   Both places have the great Indian food and some phenomenal dishes but if I have to choose I would go with Chutneys.  I do not think you go wrong at either place.  The pluses about Chutneys are that it is a clean nice looking place so if you are going out with adults or a chick definetly go to Chutneys and managament is really nice.  All workers are very friendly and good people.   The food is great and inexpensive also.   I enjoyed the somosas and the Spinach lamb dish a ton.  The Chicken Tikki Masala sauce was very good and hopefully next time alittle bit more chicken but still great.  I heard after I ordered the chicken wraps are amazing so will be getting that next time.  This place is great and now that I live downtown I will be eating here a ton with my buddies from the Tenderloin.

I am now bumping my rating on Chtneys to 5 stars due to teh Chicken Lettuce wrap for 5 bucks.  SOOOO GOOD...Love the Chuts
author: Harry E.

description: Love it!  We live 6 hours away and this is always our first stop when we are in San Francisco.  Don't expect any frills, just excellent food.  The Lamb Tikka Masala with garlic naan is to die for!  It's in the 'Loin, but well worth the walk through the homeless and other interesting characters.  Don't let the neighborhood scare you from going there.  Only 3 blocks off of Union Square, so pretty easy to get it to go and take it back to your hotel room...we do that a lot!
author: Stacy L.

description: Amazing place for Chiken Biryani. They also take orders over the phone for a pick, which is very good for us coming from San bruno. All we need to do is pick up the food and get back. They serve amazing food with good service. Unlike Naan n curry who charges extra for little chutney and vegies to go, chutney gives it complimentary and insists on trying thier chutnies as well.
author: Shilpa H.

description: As a vegetarian, the spicy flavors tantalized my taste buds. I ate lunch with a group, sharing entrees. So, I'm unsure as to what *exactly* I ate. Lots of spicy potato curries. The chai was bit bitter; perhaps I'm unaccustomed? Would visit again!
author: Mars H.

description: I like this place .. decent , quick  , cheap Indian food . I didn't really like the Chicken Tikka Masala .. I don't like the flavoring of the sauce . I didn't really like those puff things filled with peas and stuff .. it tasted kind of dry and weird . The naan with spicy ground beef is okay but gets tiring real fast . I think I still prefer the original naan .. their naan is pretty good . I LOVE their curry style okrah .. it's kind of spicy and pretty flavorful  . The mango lassi is decent . I like their free tea too . Add some sugar to it and it tastes kind of HK milk tea =)
author: Eileen L.

description: Grab a beverage, find a table, and then go stand in line for some delicious Indian/Pakistani cuisine. Although, I am still trying to figure out what those raw vegetables they put on your table for?
author: K. C.

description: This place is horrible... anyone reviewing this place and saying it is good has obviously not had good Indian food... Check out Lahore around the corner, best of the bay like a million years in a row.
author: SFone D.

description: Consistantly good food, for a good price. Not real spicy, but they will make it that way if you request it, as well as have a good assortment of spicy pickles on the side. Good sized portions and a great environment.
author: Jason D.

description: I really like this place. I like how you order at the front and they bring it to you. I got the chicken tikki masala with white rice and garlic naan. The curry was reallllly dellcious and while there were only about 5 or 6 chunks of chicken, it really filled me up. Pretty cheap and laid back atmosphere.
author: Sofya G.

description: This is the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco so far.  Way better than the self-proclaimed "Best Indian Food in the City" Shalimar across the street- where the food is oily, and there are little to no vegan options.  While the service may not be best at Chutney (may have to wait a half hour for your food if it's packed)- the food is worth the visit.  I love their bhaigan bartha and channa masala- YUMMY!
author: Sima S.

description: i love how yelp removed my review of chutney recently, without cause.
author: Ethan L.

description: I loved it!  Everything was awesome.  Cheap and good.  It seemed a bit more authentic than some other Indian places I've been in the city too.
author: Chard M.

description: At first I was hesitant, to try Indian food - this marks my first experience. And the name of the restaurant I could not pronounce, but my friend and I ventured in, yearning for something different. Ah, ooo, yummy! I'm not even going to attempt to spell the dishes we ordered, but the chicken was so spicy, like the way I like it. And there was this sort of  garlic pita/bread that I loooooooved! Until next time!
author: Haven L.

description: Great food, great prices.  Very casual atmosphere - perfect for weeknight  dinner with friends.  Too bad they don't serve alcohol.  Try the whole grilled fish.  outstanding.
author: Yevgenia F.

description: Blah.  You might as well goto Naan n' Curry ... this place is just plain Indian food.  It's probably as Indian as Denny's is American - it's a bastardized greasy version of the real thing.  It's good if you haven't developed a taste for the food though.  That reminds me ... who wants to open up a Denny's in Karachi?
author: Omar S.

description: Reasonably priced, nice atmosphere, fast service, and clean restrooms.  Did I mention good food?  Mmmm order the chicken tikka masala...
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
Chutney is another CHEAP EATs place.  There place gets crowded during lunch and dinner, as the food is GOOD and CHEAP.  SImilar to Pakwan, but much larger like a large cafeteria.  Do not expect service, as you are visiting for good cheap Indian/Pakistani food.

Too bad Los Angeles does not have a Tandooriloin.
author: nick t.

description: Best of the TL Indian places.  I've been to all of them within a few blocks, and this places wins.  Food is excellent, service is better than any of the others, interior is better than any of the others and they occasionally have outdoor seating so you can enjoy the fine streetside entertainment - I prefer the interior window seating watching the street, but sometimes you just need to sit in the sun.
author: Heidi P.

description: A shear disappointment. Walked 2 miles to find a dirty little resturant. Poor food quality. Poor service. So untidy ambiance. Will never go back again.
author: Nav T.

description: Lamb curry needed a bit more flavor. Naan was good. The ground beef sticks (not sure what you call these) were very tasty and better than the lamb sticks. I thought this place was better than shalimar across the street.
author: Nori L.

description: At this location was the first time I had ever experienced Indian food. I was so amazed. Looking at the food prior to eating it, I couldn't believe that a blob of green sauce could taste so yummy. And it was the time when I fell in loooooooove with chicken tiki masala. I could eat that stuff for life! It gave me the best Indian food impression of all time, and for the price! It's relatively cheap for Indian food. That's why I give it 5 stars. =)
author: Karen L.

description: A big step UP from Naan-N-Curry, with a pleasant interior, and more luxurious table service. They bring the utensils to your table! AND a complimentary little lettuce, onion, lemon tomato salad. Some great people-watching window seats, friendly service, big doughy naan, and pretty good chicken tikka masala. Glad it's right around the corner. I'll definitely be back.
author: Dave K.

description:
After hearing raves from my Indian food-loving uncle and cousin, I was prepared to have my tastebuds blown away by the food here.  Unfortunately, my tastebuds and I were let down, but I think that may be because we ordered things that I don't necessarily like.  

We ordered the chicken korma curry, the lamb curry, the tandoori chicken (both the leg and the breast), and chicken biryani.  We also tried the naan, the garlic naan, and the aloo naan.    Out of the entrees we sampled, my favorite was the tandoori chicken leg- it was flavorful, juicy, tender and fresh out of the oven.  The chicken was just delicious with a hint of smoke from the oven and a crisp exterior.  The tandoori chicken breast was okay, but the breast was a little dry.  The lamb curry was a little gamey, but with a good balance of spices.  I'm not a fan of lamb, so I probably didn't appreciate it as much as my family, who all thought it was delicious.  The chicken korma curry's sauce was good, but the chicken breast pieces that came in it were too dry.  The chicken biryani was a big disappointment, only because they decided to mix in a large amount of fresh cilantro into the rice.  I HATE cilantro, so needless to say, I didn't have much of it.

The naans were all very fresh and hot out of the oven.  My favorite of the three was the aloo naan, which was naan stuffed with a layer of mashed potatoes.  When dipped into the curry sauce from the chicken korma, it became absolutely magnificent.  The garlic naan was good, but I think it could be improved by having the garlic cook a little bit more- it was too raw for the garlic fragrance to absorb into the naan.

Overall, I liked the fact that they have an extensive menu, where most entrees run about $5.99.  For five people, our bill came out to be about $35.00 and we were all stuffed.  The restaurant is very clean, and even though you are ordering at the counter, the dishes are all brought to the table.  There is also free chai, which was a great way to end the meal.  I would be back to Chutney to try some of their other dishes (making sure to request no cilantro in any of them) and to have the aloo naan and tandoori chicken leg.
author: Angela H.

description: My wife and I followed our noses in to Chutney and are leaving with a smile straight from our gut. The eggplant ("Indian baba ganush") was great and like many have said - nothing like we have had before. The chicken tikka masala was just great. The staff is friendly. Just don't forget to get rice (this was not obvious to us). Easily rectified..
author: Ido W.

description: Great prices, tasty food. But I don't like how the chicken vindaloo was chopped up on the bone--it meant spitting out many, many bone fragments. That took away from the enjoyment of eating out.
author: Maximillian M.

description: my favorite restranut in the city. I wish they had a parking lot! if they did i would go there every night!!!! Also my favorite thing is the chicken tikaa masala !!! i could drink that like soda its just so good. It makes me hate every other indian place ive been to in my life, its that good!
author: Yosof R.

description: this is the place to go for cheap good curry grub!  love the chicken masala.  Gotta order the potato naan and you just can't go wrong with the eggplant.
author: Shum S.

description: For a neighborhood restaurant, the ambiance is rather upscale and very clean. No need to worry about water spots on silverware or tables not being wiped.....very comfortable and the customer service is efficient. I'd recommend the chicken masala.....it's a religious experience!!!
author: Maurice R.

description: My cousin took me here for my first time eating chutney, and it's so freakin good!!! The tikka masala had great flavor and at a good price. Whenever I get the chance to visit SF, I always insist in coming back here.
author: Crystal C.

description: THis was the first place that we ate when we arrived in SF. Great food. The best Saag that I have ever had. Very authentic. Highly recommend!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Definitely worth the money, which could be less than 10 dollars by having one dish and one drink like Mango Lassi.  

4 stars because I don't think their curries are excellent.  However, they serve many good dishes such as "Fish Tandoori", "Biryani", etc...  

Fish Tandoori is surprisingly good here.  I can definitely recommend ya!  If you are looking for better curries, "Shalimar" would be great although the atmosphere etc is much worse than "Chutney".
author: T T.

description: tip the bums to watch your car (or not to mess your car up) and get the fish...with the tikka masala...
author: mike k.

description:
3.5 stars

not the best i've had, but it'll do just enough to make you feel satisifed

I've been here for lunch on a couple occasions on both a weekday and weekend and there were no problems finding a seat after ordering. You come in, order at the counter, and seat yourself at any available table. There's free tea if you care for it. When your order is ready, they'll bring it to the table. Maybe 10 mins tops...not bad of a wait at all

I've had the chicken tikki masala, vegetable korma, tandoori chicken, reg naan and aloo naan, lamb curry, and chicken biryani. The spice levels are tolerable and are not overwhelming...just a hint in a couple of the dishes I mentioned.  

The tandoori chicken and both naan are very good. You may want to select the leg piece over the breast piece to avoid eating any dry meat. One order is good enough for two people. We ordered one each and it was way too much. The curries were pretty good, but not great. They are home style so the sauces will be a little more runny rather than the thick type of curry. Fyi, don't be surprised if you get a whole plate of sauce with only 5-6 meat pieces. Staff is friendly. Prices are fair.
author: Veronica H.

description: Went there with coworkers for a group lunch. The food was good, we found it very tasty. The problem was with the bill. They charged us $65 but when one of my coworkers, a former accountant added everything up she got $45. We asked about gratuity and figured the bill should have been $53. When we brought it to the cashier, he got angry and became very rude. We had him do the math and eventually paid the right amount. It was very shady. The tika masala may be heavenly, but their math skills are diabolical. Be warned!
author: Timoteo K.

description: This place is just way more organized than the others. They seem to have a better system in place for ordering and service, which makes the dining experience a whole helluva lot less confusing. Not to mention the fact that the place is a LOT cleaner in appearance. Food was good too. All the standbys are prepared quickly and tasted fantastic. And kudos to them for accepting credit cards. It's my go-to for all things curry!
author: Marie M.

description:
Love the place. 

After an indian friend of mine recommend this restaurant to me. I have been eating there almost every couple of weeks. The Mango lassi is very thick and dilicious!

In the past the only indian dish I usually order was chicken tikka masala but now Chutney's chicken korma is one of my favorite indian curry. Biryani here is also very tasty too and it is very good to eat with curry. The price of the restaurant is very cheap compare to other indian place I have been to.
author: P O.

description: Really awesome food--and it didn't even give me GI issues, in contrast to it's more popular counterpart (NNC).  The prices are reasonable and the chutney is mmmmm.  The mint and tamarind sauces are also a lot fresher than other places'
author: Grace M.

description:
oh god chutney-- i miss you...
   I knew that moving to Chicago would be bad for my Indian food intake.  And it is.  I discovered Chutney pretty much on accident-- the line at Shalimar was too long and it smelled good in there.  
  I very much prefer Chutney to Shalimar (both locations)-- The service is fast(er) and friendly(er), the place is cleaner (which isnt saying a lot) and the food is more consistent.  
   I pretty much ate there at least once a week for two years-- I've loved every entree i've tried and have never waited long for my food or a table-- even with a large party.  Its byob and they have never once given me the evil eye when i've stayed to finish a bottle with friends.  
   the best thing is the price-- esp compared to the slop i have to eat here in chicago---  I once fed 6 large and hungry australians (and myself) for $60-- I dont think i've ever spent more than $10 a person no matter how much food i ordered!

I love you chutney and i miss you-- if you have some cousin in chicago i dont know about let me know!
author: Janna V.

description: OMG I had never tried Indian food before and now I am addicted. I love this place!!! They are very friendly and the food is delicious and reasonably priced. I always leave feeling satisfied and stuffed. It is not in the best part of San Francisco, definately a hidden gem.  The resturant itself is simple but clean. Very relaxed atmosphere perfect for a casual meet up spot. Check it out.
author: B H.

description: Someone else said it -- it's pretty upscale for an over-the-counter Indian/Pakistani place in the Tenderloin. The food is excellent, my only complaint is a personal disdain for what I presume is the Pakistani habit of leaving the bones in everything (never had this experience in a straight Indian restaurant). If I had to choose between Naan N' Curry and this place, I'd go here.
author: Darren M.

description: Good food.  Some dishes can be a lot spicier than others.  Larger restaurant than other Tenderloin joints so it can be better for groups.
author: Atif Q.

description: Love the chicken tika masala and the service is great!
author: Catherine R.

description:
I see the mixed reviews, but my experience at this place has always been good. Never had problems with the food... I've had problems with parking.. but not the food. My two main dishes.. the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Lamb Vindaloo. I've ordered also the Daal, Chana, Bhindi Masala dishes which are quite tasty and of good consistency on their respective sauces. 
My new favorite at this time is the Bengan Bharta.. and I'm not even a fan of the eggplant, but this dish is soooo sooo good. 
What I like about this place is that for less than 20 buck two people can get full and then some... 
What I don't like about this place??? 
It takes me foreeeeeeeeverrrrr to find parking... 
...And the neighborhood sucks too... I feel like i need to watch my back every time I'm around this area. If ever you see a parking place and a group of people are lingering around that spot.. look for another parking area... my friend's car got peed on the last time we were there. 
That is why I usually make others drive when going to Chutneys... or usually I'll say " Hey!! ... I'm the one driving from SSF, now you drive" :)
author: Alex H.

description: Chutney's has some ok Indian food.  While the food quality is good, the quantity can sometimes be straight stingy...it's a hit-or-miss.. sometimes you get decent quantity of food, other times, you'll be thinkin', wtf is the rest of my food.  Definitely worth trying if you've never had Indian food before.  But if you want some Indian food that's a bit better in quality and much cheaper, you should check out Shalimar.
author: Minh V.

description: So, I hate to break up a string of good reviews for this place but a girl's gotta do what her stomach tells her to...which is how we ended up here, in 2 starland. The menu of this place always looks enticing but I just keep being disappointed in the quality. Avoid the Tikka Masala in my view and if you're still reading this, may I also suggest that you avoid the garlic naan- unless you are prepared to kill people for a week as a result of it's...potency...
author: Megan W.

description:
We opt'd to try Chutney tonight. 
The food was good, but I have to agree with another reviewer, VERY slim on the substance of their dishes. We ordered chicken tikka masala- 5 small pieces of chicken. Saag Paneer- 6 pieces of paneer.
The service was sketchy. I think its worth noting that I did not see a single Indian person on staff, many of the servers did not speak english well either. 
Lastly, the reason why I couldnt give it anything beyond 2 stars... as we finished our meal, a roach graced us with its presence by running across our table-Enough said.
Good Luck Chutney
author: Anita W.

description: Tastes amazing, the garlic naan is my favorite in the whole city. Plus this place is super central and there are many tables for dining in. One would think that since it's in the tenderloin it would be scary and inaccesible--quite untrue. It's clean and a reasonably comfortable environment. The prices are very low, suspiciously so for this particular ethnic food, about 7 or 8 bucks per dish! Delicious!
author: Amoeba D.

description: Very bad food , no taste in such a small quantity that I actually had to order some more food . Briyani was tasteless and cold . I wonder how are they surviving till now infront of Shalimar which is the king of taste . Never go again and never recommend anyone to go .
author: Sam N.

description:
Well, once we gave this place a great review but after not going for a couple of months and ordering take out last night...
we are so upset! It has been completely Americanized! Not spicey at all, Lamb Tika Masala was fatty, and the Spinach Paneer was like soup. A total change from the first few times we went. 

Just a few months ago we gave 5 stars and said...

This was one of the first places we went to eat after just moving here and thought, "wow this town is going to be great!" I still love San Fran but much of the food since has been dissapointing. (Though I may be a bit of a snob) I loved the idea of ordering at the counter and the service was fairly quick given the large crowd. My boyfriend (born in Bombay) was equally impressed. They are half the price of any other Indian place in town and you save even more by bringing your own Indian beer (purchased at the liquor store across the street)! I would say the food could have been a bit spicier (because we like it 911) but when we asked for a side of pickle to spice it up we were given an assortment at no charge. Lamb Tikki Masala and Spinach Paneer..to die for. LOVE IT!!!
P.S. Please please...
Anyone know of an Indian grocery store? We found one in Berkely with a poor selection and a small bottle of Pickle was $6, compared to back home where you find it EVERYWHERE in giant jars for $3. (I may be a snob but Indian food should be cheap)
author: Ericka B.

description: Hands down the best chicken tikka masala in the Bay Area.  The staff is friendly and the vibe is good.  Don't forget to bring along a bottle of your favorite wine or beer.  Bon appetit.
author: BG M.

description: Ok so hold on. Being a Brit raised on curry and living in Ventura county if this is the best Indian that SF can offer it's pretty sad. Having said that I thought the food was OK. The chicken tikka massala was one dimensional and didn't burst my taste buds with flavor, all yogurt based no onion in the gravy and lacked some whole spice like cinnamon, cardamon and cilantro. The lamb vindaloo had potatoes but no vin (wine) typical of this portuguese inspired dish. The lamb was beautifully cooked but the sauce had no depth of spice, sadly lacking in cumin, mustard seeds, tomato and any firely black pepper kick. Shish kebabs were hand made and not dry but litle spice and sadly missing in fenugreek leaves. It was decenly priced but some of these reviews are a little over the top. Inside has a nice atmosphere, lots of Indians eating which is a good sign but if your looking for a great Indian taste explosion and you eat a lot of Indian food then it's overated but nevertheless authentic, cheap and fresh. Worth a look, yes. "Would you like a box for that?" No!
author: Nick O.

description: Not so much on ambiance, but very tasty food. This ranks with my favorite Indian restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Josh K.

description: It is quick and cheap, but the food was just ok.  I didn't like the channa. The veg korma was fine.  The best thing we got was the aloo gobi.  The roti and naan were good, but a bit dry.  it was decent, but i've had better.
author: Nikki C.

description: i'm on a pakastani yelping role.....this restaurant is nice and clean and serves awesome food. Spice me up! Nothing like pakistani food with a little chai to wash it down- I love everything about the food here. The chicken tikka masala is unbelievable. Reasonable prices, area not so great so bring a friend.....
author: Ricquel N.

description: Looking for good Indian/Pakistani food that feeds 2 for under $20?  Lookey here y'all- Chutney is awesome!  I only dinged one star based on it's location which can be challenging to find parking and a bit scary late at night but man oh man is the Chiken TIkka Masal to die for here!  I'm so in love with this dish, that the only other dish that I've ventured out to try is the Chicken Vindaloo with Butter and Garlic Nan- "Yum wah" as furby once said.
author: Alicia W.

description: Yummy! Super cheap, super good. We had lamb and chicken tikka masala, brought our own bottle of wine, and had dinner for four of us for under $50.
author: Jack B.

description: With 839 reviews and four stars, there is probably very little I can say about this place that hasn't been said already. But it was so so good that I have to add my two cents. It's a fast food type Pakistani place (one of those where you can see all the foods behind the counter), but with lots of seating in a clean environment. There is also free tea which is a nice added touch. Now for the food - everything was so delicious! My favorite was the lamb biryani - one of the best I've ever had! The meat was cooked to perfection, melted in my mouth and the entire dish was spiced perfectly. We also had the brain masala. I grew up on my mom's brain masala so this was the first time I had it in a restaurant and it was delicious. They add some tomato to it so it is slightly soupy. The naan and tandoori chicken were also delicious - the naan was fresh which makes all the difference.  A lot of South Asian food is overly spiced to the point where you can't taste the meats, but all the dishes here were perfectly balanced. A must go if you are in the area! In fact, we were in town from NYC. Our friends live in Oakland and we were back in Oakland for the evening after having spent the entire day in SF. They suddenly remembered about Chutney and actually insisted we drive all the way back. I am so happy we did - the drive was totally worth it!!!
author: Su R.

description:
Love love love this place. 

Took the hubs there for the first time on Friday night to pick up food (cause we already had a movie picked out at home!). He marveled at how clean and busy the restaurant was for 6:30 on a Friday.

Dinner was chicken tikka masala, bengan bhartha, rice, garlic and plain naan. We ate and ate and ate - way past hungry and into I-love-this-food-I-can't-stop-myself. AND we still had enough left overs for dinner on Saturday night (we did stop by after running errands on Saturday afternoon to pick up 2 orders of naan, cause we ate it all the night before). 

We rarely eat food from restaurants, but the hubs now wants to be regulars here.
author: Tina P.

description: I have to be honest and say I haven't experienced much Indian food, but I was not impressed with the chicken kabob I ordered today at Chutney. It was too dry and the flavor was very strong, spicey. I love spicey food but i was not impressed with this flavor and dry texture of minced meat. I also ordered the rice, which I thought would be flavored. It was not. Tasted like plain white rice. That's not a complaint. It just is what it is. The staff was nice enough, the place was clean, and the price was right. It was just not my thing. Lastly, the whole practice of stand in line, order, sit down, eat, then stand in line again to pay is pointless. They need to stream line that process.
author: Alisa C.

description: Kudos for the whole-wheat tandoori rotis- much less filling than the white madha most Indian places mix in.  But butter chicken was overly sweet, and food totally bland.  I guess it's fine to cater to the spice tolerance of the masses, but at least turn it up a notch for those who ask, especially if you are going to take almost 2 hours to deliver.
author: Dilli S.

description: ew. this place was pretty gross. I'm surprised at all the good reviews. i love Indian food and i am not picky especially when it comes to food. Besides the abundance of fruit flies buzzing around our heads, my chicken korma was extremely watered down and texture less plus i had to sift through cartilage and connective tissue to find a chunk of eatable meat. Also the free tea was really watery and tasteless too. i was almost insulted that they would serve food like that. my boyfriend had an equally yucky experience. won't be back.
author: April H.

description: Chutney is cheap and delicious in a no-frills atmosphere.  I always get the Vegetable Korma and it is amazing.
author: jen h.

description: They Deliver. It was good. We had a craving for Indian food and didn't feel like going out so found this place on Delivery.com. Would much rather go to Pakwan or India Garden but this place had to do. It was good. Ordered a lamb dish and the Chicken Tikka Marsala which were both good. It satisfied our Indian food craving.
author: Hyung L.

description: Saturday night, after sleeping all day recovering from a hangover I went to the one place where I was told dinner is served past 11pm. My friend was lagging, as usual, and so I was sure that we wouldn't be able to get any dinner.. well at least not any good food. But to my surprise, he took me here at around 11.30pm and the place was packed! I had the best chicken tikka masala ever. The garlic naan was fresh, the chicken was juicy white meat (not like most places where the chicken get dried out from the grill).. and the masala sauce had a cream base which toned down the spicyness. perfect for me since I don't really like things too hot. mmmm can't wait to go there again.
author: Marina K.

description: This really isn't that good, for Indian food. Baingan Bharta (eggplant) was WAY overcreamed and underspiced. Mutter paneer was OK but sauce was too oily and bland. Same goes for the vegetable korma. Naan was quite big, and pretty good. Free chai is a nice touch, and service was pretty good, but there's no way in hell I'm giving this place more than 3 stars.
author: Rohan N.

description: This is probably the best place for the Grill Items...the lamb comes out tender and juicy, not dry like most of the othe places. The portions are a lil small, but cheap and so is naan. The tikka masala is tasty and the lentils were very good. Palak paneer was okay.
author: Dustin L.

description: Kind of dirty, but that's to be expected with the order-at-the-register-then-sit-down-then-they-bring-the-food-then-go-back-to-the-register-and-pay-there model of South Asian restaurant. More importantly, the food wasn't good. My sister had a tandoori chicken that was bland and salty. I had a *tiny* portion of chicken tikka masala that tasted like campbell's tomato soup. Boo.
author: Josh K.

description: I used to come here with my Indian friend and the food was always good.  Then one night I came here with my boyfriend and the food wasn't that great. The chicken tikka marsala was mild and the other things we ordered were just "okae."  What happened to the good food? The perverts in the kitchen had a staring problem, and to top it off, the dinner gave us a really bad stomach ache the whole night!  It really ruined the night.  We had to go buy cammomile tea to settle our tummys, but that didn't work either, so I give them 1 star.
author: H. A.

description: Our company has been to this place numerous times for birthday lunch and we love the food.  We don't mind the location.  The person taking the order is not very friendly though.  It's been very costly every time we go.  Lunch cost between $13-$15 person.  I had a suspicion that we were over charged on numerous occasion.  This time, we took the time to double check the bill and found out that we were overcharged $15.  We are very disappointed about this and will not be going back anymore.  When you have a big party, beware and add up your bill to double check to be sure you're not been overcharged.
author: Karen T.

description: I've been to this place three times and it has been delicious every time. I think this place is way better than naan n' curry, but unfortunately chutney closes at midnight. its a nice place to grab some good food before you begin your drunken adventures.
author: salomon r.

description:
Decent late-night eatery.  Absorbs the alcohol well.

Good selection & good prices.  They have all the favorites - samosa, naan, lassi, etc.  The samosa were a bit doughier than other places.

Has a busy cafeteria feel.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Like other hole in the wall indian food places e.g. Naan and Curry, Punjab Kabab House, etc but food is tamed down to be milder when it comes to spices and heat. Good place for someone who is starting to get  adventurous in tasting Indian, Pakistani food. For hardcore enthusiasts I recommend Punjab Kabab House or Naan and Curry.
author: Siddhartha S.

description: My favorite hole-in-the-wall Indian eatery in the city.  Cheap, good, fast.  what more do you want?  parking's a bit iffy but you can nip into the neighboring Bourbon & Branch bar for a drink as an added bonus.  Remember the password!
author: Dev K.

description: I have to say, wherever I go, no matter how fancy or shady the indian restaurant gets, it's never as good as Chutney's!! Thanks chutney for all the yummy  food and please be more and more anal about the cleaning, cleanliness of the restaurant is the only thing which keeps me coming to any establishment!!
author: James z.

description: My favorite place in the loin- it's  byob! They have excellent biryanhi dishes and the prawn masala is to die for.
author: Dylan M.

description: Best Indian food... It was my second time there and the food is still amazing.. CHICKEN MARSALA is a hit!!
author: Dj J.

description: Holy Moly this sh*t is good! After the Swig happy hour last night, myself and a rather large and slightly unruly crowd headed over to Chutney for some good eats.  Aside from the fabulous food - prawns vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and some delish veggie options - the staff was very kind in accommodating about 10 people with an additional walk in of about 5 more after the fact.  I'm in agreement with Nish in that this is a nicer, cleaner alternative to many other Indian Restaurants around.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great food, great service, great prices! We ordered the lamb tikka masala and chicken saag, mango lassi, rice, and naan.  That was THE BEST naan i have ever had - so fluffy and fresh out of the oven.  They made a mistake on our order and accidentally brought out chicken tikka masala but we ate without realizing they got it wrong.  Then they brought out our correct order, but didn't charge us for the extra dish.  The curry is quite plain - literally just chunks of meat in curry, and i'm no indian food expert but I thought it was delicious..lighter, and different than other curries I've tasted.  The mango lassi is a great deal for $2, you get a ton.  All the dishes are less than $10.  I would definitely come back here again.
author: Emiko M.

description: I had Tikka Masala with no meat, just potatoes and tofu.  But I don't know if the guy misunderstood me or just forgot, he did not put potatoes in my tikka masala which made me sad :(.  so i just had tofu. but the sauce is good, a little creamy.  There was  a lot of sauce so i had to save the other half for lunch tomorrow. All in all, I think its pretty good and most likely will come back again.
author: Edith L.

description: I love Indian food and this place is pretty great in my opinion.  I love the alloo ghobi and my boyfriend had this great chicken tandoori salad that he thought was "perfect".  The prices are nice and low so you can experiment and eat as much naan and raita as you want along with their other exotic dishes.  As is customary, chai tea is free but you can actually BYOB which should be done at more places because it is such a winning draw.  Not to be confused with BYOW which usually leads to eating massive amounts of cheap Indian in the first place.  I would rather go here than the over-priced Indian in my neighborhood.
author: Jill D.

description: Every time I've been here, it's always been busy.  But the wait for food is never too long. They've got good samosas; I also enjoy their Channa Masala.  It's inexpensive, as well. Though maybe not the best Indian food in the city, it is undoubtedly more dine-in friendly than nearby joints.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Going to the Tandoori Loin became a weekly habit. Found myself at Chutney more often when the original Naan-N-Curry moved. The eggplant curry is fantastic. Briyani & Chicken Tikka Masala- okay. Tandoori chicken, tasty with more bone to meat ratio than I'd like. The vegetarian dishes here are better than the meat ones. At times the service can be a bit rude. Order quick.
author: Judy L.

description: the food is to be desired. we had the seekh kabab, biryani (how can you call yourself a pakistani restaurant and make weak biryani?), palak paneer. I much rather the not so nice looking but much better food Pakwan Mission or Shalimar across the street. The decor is nice and the staff were great too...but when im craving too tikkah...nope.
author: Naureen H.

description: Had the best goat curry of my life there tonight.  It was fantastic and halal. The mango lassi was the perfect amount of sweet. The chai was free and yummy. The order and pay at the counter system with such a nice large seating area threw me off at first, but it was fast and easy. Only down sides was the garlic naan was a little dry/thin, but OK and the tamarind chutney was too liquidy.  But, the tamarind sauce on the veggie samosas, to die for.
author: Cara J.

description:
This place is super! The best Pakistani food in the city hands down...
It's got adequate seating, fast service, and their food is consistently good. The fish tikkas, the biryani, and most of their curry dishes are excellent. Oh and don't forget the free yet yummy chai in the back :)
I hate to let the secret out but this place is very reasonably priced as well!
author: Sal Z.

description: By far the CHEAPEST and BEST indian food I've had in San Francisco.  I love their masala sauce and the mango juice is awsome!  You can get out of there stuffed for less than $10
author: Jared F.

description: My favorite Indian food in the city, and the price is unbelievable.  BYOB option is great.  Perhaps the best value equation in the city.
author: Cully W.

description: I must admit, I had the "safe" Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan - but the sauce was heaven.  Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.  Very affordable.
author: Angela T.

description: I cannot rave enough about Chutney. It is, hands down, the best Pakistani/Indian restaurant in San Francisco. The neighborhood can be sketchy, and it's not a fancy joint, but who cares. If you're looking for good curry, decent service, and fantastic prices you've got to try Chutney. It's SO much better than the other dive restaurants in that area, and most importantly all the tables and chairs match! Chutney rocks...I kid you not!
author: Matin N.

description: BEST CURRY AND NAAN!  I recommend ordering the Chicken Tikka Masala, mmmm..I can just slurp their special Bombay sauce off the freakin' plate, haha it was mighty good.  Or it can serve as a dip for your Garlic Naan.  For my fellow carb lovers, the Chicken Biryani complements the Chicken Tikka Masala.  The Chicken Biryani is the best fried rice I've ever tasted in my life!  And it's none of that dry sh*t you get at Chinese restaurants.  This stuff is creamy and savory.  Really good restaurant and it also passes my "cheap" radar! :)
author: Joellene B.

description: My fav order at the counter Indian resturant.  So spicy and delicious.  I love their Chicken Tikka Masala and anything with lamb.
author: Katie M.

description: My sister and I come here for lunch all the time ... and we only come here for 2 things .. tiki chicken masala & garlic naan. Their portions have actually gotten bigger so we need 3 naan to finish the marsala between the two of us. We were pretty full during the 2nd naan already. The price is reasonable as well. However, I dont' recommend drinking the water, it smelled funny.
author: Jen P.

description: Not really friendly, small portions, okay tasting food.
author: F K.

description:
escaped to here from the black friday zoo with genki m.  The chicken tikka masala is delicious, lamb saag is plenty spicy.  place is great, it's cheap and gives me gas!

The Orda:
chicken tikka masala: $6.50? not sure
lamb saag: $6.50
some kabob, dry and not memorable.
free tea!
garlic naan, $2, my favorite type of naan, spicy and stinky.
author: Chris T.

description: Love the CTM--chicken tikka masala.. absolute best!!  garlic naan. mango drink. tandoori fish/shrimp/chicken. all amazing...love this place--such great energy..don't feel rushed to leave ....BYOB...plus I have a crush on the tall man who takes my order-- believe his name is Ahmad...
author: Trish t.

description: The Chicken Biryani came with almost no chicken, but plenty of bones and cartilage.  Gross!
author: sam e.

description: Chutney is the only place that can provide food educed euphoria, the guy at the register holds down the fort while the rest of the team gets you your meal before you can say Tikki masala. You know it's good Indian food when 50% of the patrons are indian. Really a diamond in the rough of the tenderloin!
author: Brett R.

description: I ordered about a week ago and came to pick it up and guess what, the food was given to someone else to make it even worse i was fasting and i was supposed to open up my fast with some food from chutney but I had to go to subway instead. This place used to be real good, but now since the prices are up and the quality of the food has lessened I truly wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Sajjad S.

description: Pretty good and really really spicy if you ask for it spicy. Their chicken dishes are fairly good, and if you feel adventurous try the bitter melon vindaloo or curry. Fairly casual ambiance and actually really affordable for the amount of food that you get. The naan didn't stand out to me too much though.
author: Gina R.

description: I went to Chutney with a friend of mine and the food was AWESOME! Chutney is a a casual eats place with a lively atmosphere. Come with an empty stomach because the food portions are generous and delicious. That rhymed, yes I know. I'm craving Indian food just thinking about the restaurant...
author: Leslie C.

description: I am full-on addicted to the Paneer Tikka Masala with a side of raita.  I'm trying to recover,  but at my worst I was getting this dish take-out like, 3 times a week.  I've scaled back -- tried a few other things, have a nice selection of faves.  The staff are really nice and they're pretty fast.  I can get a mountain of food for under $10.  Can't beat that.  And it's really damn good.
author: Kate C.

description: Definitely one of the better ones. Fresh and they always seem to make what I want! No "daily specials"!
author: Riz N.

description: Everyone I've ever taken to Chutney has become somewhat addicted to the place. Even people from out of town! When I'm with some friends and we're deciding where we should eat out, Chutney is always mentioned. Even if we don't go there, it's in the back of our minds. The chicken tikka masala and the bengan bartha are my two favorite dishes there. Their samosas are a great appetizer as is the shish kebabs, if you can handle the spiciness.
author: Aaron M.

description: Not the best, but not bad.  I kind of like the environment and the crazy Indian dance/techno music they play.  Their onion naan is awesome.  You'd think their chutney might be good, but no such luck.   The food is decent, although Americanized - I guess you could just see it as more mainstream-friendly.  If you're looking for authentic, head directly across the street to Shalimar, but if you're looking for a cooler place to eat with some friends or guests, Chutney does nicely.   Oh, and I recommend walking down from Geary, not up from O'Farrell.  The SRO hotel across from the smoke shop on the corner of Jones and O'Farrell is one of the scarier ones in the neighborhood.
author: Green T.

description: I started going here when it first opened.  All I heard about Ofarrell and Jones was, Shalimar, Shalimar, Shalimar.  Went here, have gone back every week since.  That was over 2 years ago.  Most of the reviews here are very accurate.  Place is simple, fairly clean for a Pak/Indian restaurant, and pretty cheap.  Lately it seems the word has gotten out.  IT is harder to find a table.  Also, if you like beer with your food, go to one of the many liquor stores in the area and pick it up before you go.  They don't have a liquor license.
author: Kapeli M.

description: This is my most fave cheap fast indian jizoint in the city.  It is clean, fresh and very tasty.  Yummy chix tikki masala, saag paneer, all the standars are amazingly delicous here!  highly recommended!
author: Caroline S.

description: The Chicken Tikka Masala is up there with my top five favorite dishes in the whole city.  If I could buy the sauce in mass quantity and drink it from one of those camper camel back things as I walked around town, I would be one happy gal.  I used to try other things on the menu - they were all just fine, but now, if I'm there, its for CTM, with their wonderful naan - any variety, and rice.  I think eating in is fun too - always lively and the guys who work there are great (I used to work at the Blue Lamp around the corner during the day shift alone, and they used to walk my chicken fix over to me, and I have never forgotten it.)
author: Melissa G.

description: To me, this is the best Indian food restaurant.  You have to order and pay at the counter, however they do have waiter service who brings plates/water and clean up the tables.  The neighborhood is pretty scary especially at night.  I love prawn tikka masala, bindi masala (okra) and the ground beef wrap around the stick then bbq.
author: Lily K.

description: My friend who lives in SF brought me here cuz it's one of her favs.  It was ridiculously cheap for indian food.  We ordered daal chicken, mixed vegetables, rice, and 2 naans for like $18.  They even serve a complemetary salad, which is nice.  The naan was burnt a little bit on the bottom but it was HUGE.  I will come back if I'm in the area.
author: T M.

description: Lost in the Tenderloin? Shalimar too dirty? Looking for a change of pace from the usual Naan-n-Curry? Then Chutney is the place to be! The curries are flavorful, the lamb is fresh (and halal!), the spinach is fresh and plentiful, and their biryani is satisfyingly spicy! prices of the dishes range from $6-9, and the ambiance is much more inviting and cleaner than the other curry houses around
author: Jessica h.

description: Again, Indian "fast" food that's not really fast food?!  AMAZING!  I wish they'd create one of these in LA.  I'd be there once a week!  GREAT tandoori chicken, awesome vegetable tikka masala--everything here was good.  Three thumbs up!
author: Sara L.

description: Chicken vindaloo's on the menu.  Also a bit cleaner and open than Shalimar across the street.
author: Tinou B.

description: I used to love going to Shalimar across the street, ever since it first opened. Back before the Tenderloin was known as the Tandoorloin... Then Chutney's opened it's doors. Actual decor, far cleaner, better portions, better prices, better service and better food. Family owned and operated. Feast on authentic Pakistani food that is prepared to order (takes a bit longer) and very reasonably priced.
author: Miguel L.

description: Still a winner after all these years! I think I went around 5 years ago, and recently hit up Chutney again. Great curries, delish naan, and fast service. SO cheap too!
author: Joy C.

description: I love Indian food, period. But this place makes me want to eat Indian food everyday. I go there often enough for the staff to recognize me, and give me that "hey, you there, again" smile. I usually order the paneer tika masala and it's delicious. This is not a fine-dining operation, for those of you who are looking for a fine-dining experience, go somewhere else, but if you're just going out to eat something, this is the place to be. Food is good, staff is friendly and it's not expensive. They even give you enough food to enjoy the rest at home.
author: Helen D.

description: i think the majority is alright, the lamb biryani is what i always go back for :)
author: H H.

description: So I went to Shalimar (across the street) last week, so of course I have to compare the two. Shalimar has no ambience and lacks good service, but the food is slightly better (albeit greasy). Now, if I had company from out of town, I would bring them to Chutney because the overall look of the restaurant and service is awesome! The two of us ordered chicken tikka masala, chicken boti, beef kebab, rice, garlic naan, and naan (what fatties!). This placed was PACKED on a Monday night and they still had fast service. I'm totally coming here again!
author: J. L.

description: rough neighborhood but amazing food at great prices!!
author: f m.

description: Went it because it was across the street from Shalimar, and Shalimar was closed.  WOW!  Great menu and great staff.  Javier helped me with an on the spot catering order for 6 people in my office and could not have been nicer.  Then Zabe came in, the owners son. They packaged everything beautifully in half pans and boxes and brought it to my car and loaded it into the trunk.  Our clients LOVED the food and I saw a couple of them go back for seconds.  Happy boss, happy clients = repeat customer! Thanks Chutney, you have a new loyal customer.
author: Lucy B.

description: I find this restaurant very nice. Ambiance is pretty good and clean. You can get tasty food for very reasonable prices. Staff is friendly. Serving time is quick enough.
author: Sanky C.

description:
why i love chutney and find great comfort in knowing it's in our fair city:

* quality food at incredibly affordable pricing. indian food is deceptively pricey, but here, you can get tasty bites for cheap. for instance, a plate with a mountainous pile of juicy sizzling chicken boti is only $5.99. 

BUT, other dishes like palak paneer and tikka masala come up disappointing in portions: a pool of  sauce (perfect for naan dipping) with a paltry ration of meat - five, maybe six cubes of cheese/meat. it's almost formulaic. but still, it's fair considering what it costs (not much).

* the bangan bartha is bangin'

* the free, soothing chai at the back of the restaurant

* it's open late!

* the roti is incredible, and the aloo naan is addictive

* it's great for groups
author: jennifer y.

description: Solid place. Food is consistenly great, the bang for the buck hard to beat, and the scene outside the front door unpredictable. Sure its sparse, sure there isn't any actual "service" that occurs, sure the plateware may have come from a thrift store. One of my fave spots for indian in the city.
author: Jeremi M.

description:
Did some volunteer work this Sunday and afterwards a group of us decided to get something to eat.  We ended up at Chutneys as we were only a few blocks away.  My first time eating here and though I love Indian food I felt this was average at best.  I had the chicken tandoori (my favorite) which came with a huge salad and a lot of garlic naan.  Mind you, the prices are great.  It only cost me a whopping $5.95 for this meal.  But, the chicken was dry and the salad tasteless even with a yogurt dressing.  The garlic naan, however, was soooooo good.  I love naan and love garlic.  So, of course the combination is going to win me over.  But, garlic naan does not a meal make.  The portions were huge, this was more like two meals.  I could only eat half of it.  So, although the chicken was dry and the salad tasteless, I ate the other half for dinner.  I am not going to write this place off, I'll give it another try and see if perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing.  My friends seemed to enjoy their dishes, so it's a possiblitiy.  However, until then I can only give it two stars.


UPDATE:

Yes, I did indeed order the wrong thing.  I went back two days ago and ordered Tandoori Chicken, rice, lentil dal, mango chutney, and raita.  All was good.  I wish I had more of the raita but, oh well, need to go back again I guess.  Changed my rating to four starts (from two).
author: Magdalena ..

description: The best in the west expecially chicken tikka masala.
author: Riaz S.

description: If you can stumble your way past the crackheads to get into this restaurant, you will find a culinary delight!  Awesome food, reasonable prices and they're open pretty late.
author: Aileen B.

description: Great Chicken Tikka Masala.  Superb spinach dishes.  Then I finally tried the Chicken wrap...awesome!  No wonder I come here week after week.
author: Floyd F.

description: Clean, good, cheap - not the best not even very good. If you're not afraid of spicy (really spicy) Pakistani food and REAL holes in the wall, then run across to Shalimar instead.
author: C P.

description: The food here is very good.  The staff could be a little friendlier though (especially on the phone when ordering a pick-up).  I am new to the city and looking for good spice and good Indian food and this is the best I have found thus far.  The location is a little shady, but other than that I would recommend this place for the food.
author: Rise G.

description: So this is definitely a dive. If you're looking for great ambiance, Chutney doesn't have it. What it does have is great chicken tikka masala, sheesh kabobs and naan. Their tandoori wraps are pretty good. The prices are even better. They also have free chai in the back of the restaurants. All I have to say is that they should open up multiple locations around the city so I don't have to go to the 'loin everytime I want some good  indian/pakistani food.
author: S K.

description: Yummy food, cheap prices, clean place.  What more can you ask for?  We ordered the chicken tikki masala, spicy cauliflower dish (actually too hot for me), and lentils.  Everything was very tasty.  The mango lassi drink was SO delicious!
author: Mon L.

description: I've eaten at Chutney a lot.  It is cheap and tasty Indian food.  Almost everything I've had there has been solid - anything with paneer and choley chicken are my go tos.  It is a great place to go with a group.  Every time I eat there I think that I should really go more often so that says something.  They loose a star for the naan - its just alright.
author: Julie P.

description:
at the hotel i was taking a workshop at, i approached the concierge with a simple request:  i wanted indian food and i wanted it to be the best place in the area.  she warned me, you'll have to walk about 10 minutes and walk through some rough spots.

i then thought to myself, this place has got to be hella good then.  and it was!

had the seekh kabab, palak aloo methi, saffron rice, naan and a side of raita... all was excellent!  the kabab had a nice flavor and the spice blend in it was really good.  the spinach dish had huge chunks of potato and went really well when i scooped it up with the naan.  they had really good chai in the back and i even refilled my starbucks travel mug with it and didn't get 'tude from the restaurant staff!  hahaha!  it was pretty clean and one of the staff was constantly spraying down things and wiping tables.  i didn't venture into the bathroom only because i didn't want to break the spell... and $11 for all this food.  just for me!

i'll definitely bring my bf there to give him his first try at indian food.  and also to have him protect me from the vato's that hollered at me on my way there... uhhhh... yeah.
author: Christine P.

description:
1. This place is hit and miss with quality of food. More often it is good (again for the price in city).
2. This place is not a hit and miss when it comes to rudeness. The people on the counter are always rude. I guess a cheap place like that you cannot expect any politeness. These morans really need to take some professional training on how to serve customers.
3.Not a hit and miss with cleanliness. Always filthy and dirty. Restrooms - don't even dare. But then there are enough junkies there who make it dirty.  Also they need to wash hands, I agree with other posts, the people there smoke and do not  wash hands and touch food.
4. More importantly they are known to over charge you on your bills. 2 occasions on take out orders I left the tip portion empty and they added 10$ when I got my statement. I disputed the charge. Also when I called the restaurant to report this they said they must have made a mistake, I asked 2 times and they hung up on me.
author: Food C.

description: Tasty but does not match up to Shalimar. Some of the dishes are very good but some just lack flavor. But a good alternative if you're waiting in line at another place.
author: R J.

description:
Naan and Tandoori Chicken were better than what I have had at Shalimar and Pakwan. Lamb Curry was not at all appetizing to look at and tasted very ordinary. Lassi was good. 

Not worth another visit though.
author: Tabassum K.

description: Cutting to the chase, great food, and really good people work here!
author: Aidan G.

description: Flavors rock, food is so affordable, you can bring you own drinks, portions are large, everything is great.  Best indian food without a doubt.
author: Steven K.

description:
Let me get to the good stuff.  The Shish Kabob reminded me of those classic bbq's my grandfather made for us when we were kids growing up (thank you bapa...though my arms would ache after waving the cardboard over the coals to get them to burn faster..."old school technique").  Lamb on skewers.  You could see the green onions through the tender lamb, the warm burn of the masala after each bite and only the cool chutney and lemon juice to refresh the pallet.  Wow I've found it again at Chutney.  Add some grilled onions, naan, and a beer and you've got a perfect meal.  My mouth is water right now, definitely a must if you make it here.
As for the 4 stars, the other items we order were good but the portions were small (6 chunks of chicken in our CTM...chicken tikkha masala) and the palak paneer had too much cardamom or was it cloves.   Overall the place is clean and comfortable, definitely worth repeat visits.
author: Bhavesh M.

description: This place makes some pretty decent chicken tikka masala, their lamb chops are quite good as well and the garlic naan lives up to it's name well.  I'll be returning to sample some more of their menu as I saw some pretty interesting stuff.
author: Derek D.

description: I have only been once but it was very tasty. Bare bones but friendly.  Prices are downright cheap.  I need a second visit to solidify the 4 stars.  Mefhil is still number one for Indian food though.
author: Narendra R.

description: SUPER DELICIOUS!!! Tons and tons of food!!! ( well, 6 plates) and some other couple bought us someone else that was tasty. First time in a long time that i had food from this part of the world and it was delicious. I can't wait to go back. Not only is the food tasty, but seeing the hookers and the passed out street kids and cracked out people twitching out on the street corners and doing the meth-head shuffle always make me smile. This place is San Francisco.
author: Dustin H.

description: The food here is great.  I wish I can give them 6 stars.  I don't eat too much Indian food, and when I do, I usually go to Naan-n-Curry.  But I think I found a new Indian spot to go to for my fix.  The chicken tandoori was so tasty, and juicy.  You can tell they use good product here.  The naan was good too.  If you can get pass the land of crackheads, deadbeats, and the weird known as the Tenderloin, then go.  Just remember it will be spicy and will give you the shits.  Not a good first date spot.
author: A L.

description:
two words: tandoori chicken.

chutney has tasty cheap indian food, but their tandoori chicken is a real stand out.  did i mention it was cheap?  i'm talking $2.99 for the tandoori chicken; how this is profitable for chutney i have no idea.  they certainly aren't making it up with beer/alcohol sales -- chutney is byob.

one quick warning -- be careful about either i) wearing nice clothes to chutney or ii) going to chutney before a big night out, because you WILL smell like curry for the rest of the night -- guaranteed.
author: Brad W.

description:
We ordered:

Vegetable Tikka Masala

Daal

Samosa

Garlic Naan


All were Very good, accept for the UNBEARABLY HIGH QUANTITIES of GREASE. Yuck. I guess If you can handle grease, and are incredibly hungry, then this is the place.

Before eating here, I had never consumed a Samosa that you could literally squeeze the grease out of, but hey, we were hungry. 

I have to admit, their spices and flavors were spot on, but I will not be returning.

5/10
author: Ant T.

description: fast service ..really yummy food and very reasonably priced!!
author: BayAreaExplorer B.

description: this is the worst indian/pakistani food inthe city. I give it a star cause it was a 2 block walk. I recommend you go to shalimar across the street ot to a real joint like Lahore Karachi on o'farrell.
author: chad l.

description:
Absolutely terrible. The lamb vindaloo was not only bland but tasted burnt. Vindaloo is supposed to be very spicy not this flavorless rubbish Chutney serves. Moreover, there is no excuse for burnt food ever being served. The chicken tikka masala tasted like their chicken boti kabab floating in was seemed like a diluted approximation of the masala sauce, more like cream of tomato soup. The lamb sheekh kabab might have redeemed this place were it not  overly salted and the Aloo palak methi was below par. The chicken shahi korma was entirely forgettable.


Overall extremely disappointing. It looks like the kitchen would rather serve food quick at the expense of quality. There is nothing gourmet about Chutney.
author: Arun R.

description: I'd probably consider this the TGIF's of Indian & Pakistani Cuisine.  The atmosphere is very laid back -- something you take your friends and family to and not spend a lot.  Great for cheap dates too!  Not quite romantic though.  The food is authentic enough (even though the cooks aren't Indian) to appreciate!  Every Indian person I've taken here has recommended it to their friends.  Good food & low prices!  Don't expect phenomenal service at these prices!
author: Richard L.

description: good food, clean environment. Like to switch it up between there and Shalimar which is across the street. both have it going on.
author: Kay L.

description: Having just moved to the "TendorKnob", I give the place 4 stars for the nice decor and the eating experience.  I felt the food was "good", but not great, and the prices reasonable..... Not a bad find, you just have to avoid the panhandlers and the homeless....
author: Belayet K.

description: My favorite things about Chutney is that it's fast, very cheap and better than average. It's not mind-blowing good food - but it's decent quality and they give you a lot of it - which is good enough for me! A friend of mine and I had tikka masala, chicken curry, samosas, garlic naan, aloo naan all for freakin $20!!!
author: Sung P.

description: This place is just okay. The only reason I'm giving it three stars instead of two is because it's close to my home, it's cheap and I actually have had a decent meal there. Unfortunately the last time I went they gave me some watered-down curry and rubbery naan. Yuck, I won't be going back - it wasn't all that great to begin with. I'm still trying to find a good Indian restaurant in SF!
author: Adelle W.

description: Amazingly good! The real deal. I am addicted to the Aloo naan (potato-stuffed) and the dahl is thick and delicious. Get some!
author: Heather G.

description: This is a pretty low key Indian restaurant that's fast, tasty, and cheap. Total bill per person is under $10. It has the benefit of being right in the middle of things in downtown San Francisco and only a couple of blocks away from Union Square. The immediate surroundings are somewhat sketch, but as long as you can avoid the bums hanging around the liquor store you're good!
author: Luke R.

description: There is one core reason you should try there: the quite down to earth atmosphere, that gives you a feeling that you're eating some not americanized Pakistan food.  In general, the food is okay and above average, I would suggest to try dishes with lamb.  Should try the self-help "free" tea at the corner definitely.  For me, the dishes are not spicy at all, I am sure it's been adjusted down.  The most disappointed thing is about the Nam, it's too thick and tasted like ready made. Anyway, don't put very high expectation and it shall give you a fair meal.
author: terrific h.

description: Saturday, after shopping, we needed food. Hmm where to eat... I had the idea to wander to TL and see what's there...we saw an indian place with a lot of people inside of it, and I remember my friend C told me she liked it, so we went in. You order at the counter, then take a number to the table. It seemed cheap. We sat down, and got a pitcher of water, which I like, because I hate when places are stingy with water. Then they gave the 3 of us this tiny thing I guess you could call a salad, with whitish wilting iceberg lettuce and a couple discolored tomato slices. One tiny one for all of us. We didn't want to touch it anyway. It had a slice of lemon on top as dressing. Our food came, and it was tiny. A got chicken tikka, I belive, and it only had THREE pieces of chicken. Yes, just 3! And some sauce. J got a lamb dish, which was also small, with some fatty lamb in it. I had the grossest one, it was lamb saag. I usually love saag. So here is a small dish of extra grated up burnedy tasting spinach, with a bunch of BONES and a few pieces of FAT and about 2 bites of legit lamb. Seriously, one whole section of the plate was piled with fat and bone. Disgusting. I choked down the bad spinach with my naan. I had plain naan, which I usually love, but this one, while not bad, wasn't good. It had no taste. A and J had cheese naan, which they thought was the best part of the meal, but still didn't taste much cheese in it. All 3 of us had some watery mango lassis, which weren't bad but definitely not good. I can't for the life of me tell why on earth it has a good yelp rating, or why there were people in there. We spent $40, which is cheap I suppose for 3 meals, but since they were small, fatty, no meat bleh meals, it was expensive and a waste of money. I had a stomachache after :( and we were all hungry.
author: Merredith L.

description:
Went with my sister, her boyfriend and my girlfriend last night and boy was it a letdown.  My sister raved, raved, raved.  I like the BYOB aspect though, fun to open a beer with your fork!

We order the goat curry, chicken tikka, ahloo vindaloo and daal masala.  All were bland, lifeless and the chicken tikka came with like six pieces of overcooked chicken.  We were given rice for four and it was maybe six spoon fulls in total.

In all I would go to Shalomar over this place in a heartbeat, or Pakwan for the value.
author: Matt W.

description: I love this place. Went here before heading over to Burbon and Branch. You order up front and then sit down. You can order more if you want since you pay at the end. Good service, not big on ambiance but it is cheap and serves it's purpose as a place to stop on a night out and fill up on good food so you don't get too wasted.
author: julie q.

description: Ew - I could not stand this place.  The people working there were really nice but the food was not good at all.  We went here a while ago but I think I had the vindaloo and my boyfriend had the chicken curry.  Portions were smaller than most places (probably why it's less expensive than most).  If you're trying to find a good Indian place, try Saffron Grill instead - you'll be happy you did.
author: Julia J.

description:
i actaully dont care for the food here.
it lacked flavor for me - especially the vegetarian/curry dishes
very plain - need more spices.
not in the greatest neighborhood.
sorry
author: Janet W.

description: I dont know why I went here when Shalimar was across the street. The naan were way overdone, they were more like crackers. I ordered the tandoori fish and chicken tikka masala. The tandoor fish I didnt get to eatting but my sister in law said it was good. I had the chicken tikka masala, it was average...Overall okay. Nothing special.
author: Shabnam S.

description:
This is a Indian place for people who like Indian places.

Being of Hyderabadi descent, I'm not one to really bother with Indian food places unless they are great.  And this place is great.  If you want a classic meal, order the Seekh Kabob (spicy), Chicken Tikka Masala (known as CTM by those in the know), Aloo Gobi, and some Raita on the side with a couple of fresh Naan.  Wash it down with a Mango Lassi.  Boom.  You'll be hit with the spice weasel (figuratively) and you'll walk out with dragon breath and a new outlook on food.
author: Farman S.

description: I have been going to Chutney at least once a week for the past 2 months or so, and so far Im a fan. I work in the area and when I need a quick Indian fix this is the place I turn to. Sure I like Lahore Karahi a bit more, but that place takes forever. Also I think being a frequent customer helps out too, its always pretty good.
author: Vilen G.

description: My go-to for cheap "Tandoorloin" curry.  Their curries are amazingly smooth.  other places will serve tikka masala with little red droplets of oil throughout, but not chutney: it's all one color, hearty, and delicious.  Their naan is excellent to: not too buttery and plenty fluffy.  I'm not a big fan of the samosas.  They're ok, just don't have a lot of oomph (just straightforward potato-and-peas interior).  However, I had had almost every kind of curry they serve and have never been less than satisfied.  And the price is right.
author: Eliza L.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala is the most amazing food ever! 

You must try the Mango Lassi, my personal favorite. 5 stars for service and quality of food.
