author: Dean M.

description:
We really like the food at Chutney and it's very near to our place so it's a no-brainer whenever we have a craving for Indian.

A couple of weeks ago, we ordered to-go for five people. We eagerly opened up the food only to find that they'd forgotten to include all the naan we ordered. I called Chutney immediately and was very upset about the mistake (it was 8pm and we were VERY hungry). The staff who took the call didn't know how to resolve the issue and even hung up on me. I called back and ended up speaking with the owner's son who promised to comp our meal the next time we visited.

Yesterday evening we ordered to-go again but this time it was a smaller order. I explained the previous situation and the staff on the phone said he was also family so he would 'take care' of me. When I picked up the order, he charged me $20 for a $36 order. I was very impressed by their willingness & initiative in rectifying a bad experience.
author: Grace T.

description: good value for money! chicken tiki marsala is very good. you have to order (and pay) at a desk. was not really obvious since they get you the menu at the table.
author: Christoph S.

description: The baingan bharta, aloo ghobi, and okra are excellent!  Really affordable and very consistent.
author: C P.

description: Perhaps the best Indian/Pakistani food in the city.  All the dishes (that I've had at least) are damn good, particularly the tikka masala and daal dishes.  Get a side of garlic naan and you are guaranteed to stink like delicious Indian food for at least three days.
author: Kevin M.

description: Great dive for Indian. They have bitter melon, not a usual item at your average Indian place. There is little charm here but the food is pretty good. I hit this place every time I visit SF. The Sikh kebabs make my turban spin!
author: Dave R.

description: This is my favorite Indian Restaurant in San Francisco.  Service is good, food is amazing, it's affordable, and you can bring your own drinks.
author: Cliff W.

description:
The food is great. 

I appreciated a different kind of spicy with each meal- I found Nan and Curry has one spicy and it's in each plate. Chutney has many flavors for cheap and you can bring your own wine or beer. If you forgot to get it at your local market there is a corner store or two for you when you get there. 

There is outside seating but I normally go for dinner, so why would I sit out in the cold in the TL eating?
author: alexcia d.

description: Not gonna lie: I love this place. Why 3 stars?  Well, the price and the BYOB policy are my main loves. I'm a cheap bastard and I can't complain about the amount of fun my friends and I have here every Wednesday. The lamb vindaloo is pretty fire, both in spicial content and yumminess. But I've had many Indian joints that are better. I love the Tenderloin, and I'll continue coming here every Wednesday indefinitely. And the people who run the joint are legit.
author: Jonny W.

description:
I'm all about bang for your buck - if I pay a lot for a meal, I expect the quality and taste to be on par with what I'm paying.  Definitely no bang-for-buck issues with Chutney.  It's like a much cleaner version of Naan and Curry or Shalimar - the place doesn't feel as dingy, and you don't walk out of there smelling like what you just ate.

The daal and saag (lamb or chicken) dishes are my favorite - the saag is spicy, but in a way that doesn't overpower all the flavors of the dish.
author: Irene W.

description: My favorite Indian place in the City.  I first went while I was still going to school in the Tenderloin area, but I keep venturing back to the Loin to eat at this place whenever I can.  Unlike other places I've tried, their lamb is very tender in their tikka masala.  I've also had their Palak Paneer, which is very good.  Their naan is huge, and they offer Roti (whole wheat naan), which is a huge plus.  Their basmati rice comes in a very healthy serving size.  And the price can't be beat.  Overall, very good.
author: Alan C.

description:
The food here is just tasty and affordable. It's clean and not so crazily loud like other Indian restaurants in the neighborhood.

My favorites are their chicken tikka massala, Tandoori fish and the lamb curry, even though I am not a big fan of lamb. After several visits, I found the naan and the tandoori chicken are better done off rush hours.
author: Amy C.

description: Delicious, tasty, hearty, spicy, authentically done Pakistani food. Love the Lamb Biryani. Great Naan and Curry. Come hungry.
author: imdan a.

description: Another good review for chutney. This place is awesome! The food is delicious and it is soo inexpensive. If I lived in Frisco I would come here once a week.
author: karla b.

description: A Bangladeshi friend recommended Chutney as a cheaper alternative to good Indian food and I'm glad he did. First of all, the place was pretty jumping, which I always take as a good sign. Although all of the cooks were Latino, I find that they often makes the best cooks in all different kinds of restaurants, so no points off for not staying pure Indian/Pakistani.  The Boyfriend and I ordered some food to go - he got his go-to favorite, chicken tikka masala, and I was jonesing for some chicken biryani and a mango lassi. We also ordered basmati rice and some garlic naan on the side. The service was pretty prompt. The tikka masala was really creamy and had a nice smoky tomato flavor and the chicken was tender and flavorful. The biryani was good - the chicken fell right off the bone. The naan was a little burnt and I've had better but for the price, I'm not going to knock off points for it. The one drawback to the place is its location. If you're craving cheap good Indian eats, just brave the prostitutes and druggies who prowl the neighborhood.
author: Christine P.

description: I haven't had Indian food in so long I can't remember but I'll tell you that I'm glad I revisited this type of cuisine at Chutney! It was so damn good that my boyfriend and I came back a day later to eat it again, no joke. And talk about cheap! I don't know how they do it but goodies to me for knowing about it! The 1st time we ordered we got the lamb vindaloo, a chicken dish (it was a special and I can't remember the name), garlic naan, and a mixed pickle side order. All that was under $20 (including tip). The lamb vindaloo was amazing!!! the lamb was sooo tender. You know what, that was the best prepared lamb I've ever eaten. Hands down. The vindaloo was a little spicy with an amazing clove flavor. The chicken special dish was good too (we requested that to be spicy) but I can't remember too much about it because the lamb vindaloo blew everything else outta the water! The garlic and cilantro naan was excellent. The mixed pickle wasn't what i expected...good, but it had a very intense salty flavor. You have to find the right thing to pair it with as I'm sure it would be great as a garnish on something. You will get the gas attack if you're not use to eating the spices and chilies they use, but its well worth it. When we came back a day later we ordered the chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken (leg), onion naan, and papadams. All for only about $16 we left very satisfied again. No gas this time as we didn't order anything spicy. I wish I lived in SF so I could eat at this place at least once a week!
author: Niki P.

description: So here's the thing about Chutney. It's good, but it's not as good as Shalimar. With Shalimar, you go home, and you need to take 2 or 3 showers to get rid of the smell since you WILL reek of it once you walk out--there's no avoiding that. With Chutney, you can go home and only take one shower to get rid of the smell. So with Chutney, you're trading in having to reek of curry for less tasty food--Chutney is basically a less grimier version of Shalimar in terms of cleanliness. It's still delicious, just not Shalimar delicious..so, think Shalimar, but 3.5 notches down--yea, still good. I ordered their saag paneer which seemed more watery than most places, but it was still good. Their CTM (chicken tikka masala for those new to pakistani cuisine), was decent. Naan was soft, so that's always a plus. I walked out, and smelled my hair, yep, smelled like Chutney--but at least body spray masked it (this method will not work at Shalimar).
author: Sami A.

description: Make sure to try the homemade chai in the back of the restaurant.  It's free, hot, and delicious.  You reach a form of nirvana-- the realization that the overly sweet stuff from Starbucks is to chai what Taco Bell is to Taqueria CanCun    I could live on the chai alone.  Best value for the dollar in Indian food in the city.
author: Mel B.

description: The best Indian food I've had in San Francisco.  Very cheap.  Excellent service.  Get here early, it fills up fast!
author: william e.

description: Chutney's is the best tasting Indian food I've ever had. What's great and awesome about it is that you can't go wrong with the prices. I was on vacation recently and found the place close to my hotel. Defiantly a good find. If you want some good food at a great price this is the place to go. Plus the owner is really nice. You could also call in your order, go pick it up and eat at your hotel. Trust me, you'll be in heaven when you eat their food. It's DELICIOUS! Yum!
author: Jason H.

description: This place is amazing! Perfect amount of spiciness in the chicken tikka masala- possibly the best i've ever tried (finally trumping House of Curries in Berkeley) . The garlic naan is always soft, perfectly baked, and has lots of garlic. The guy that always seems to be at the counter in the evening is so friendly and the food is -gasp- cheap!
author: Melissa L.

description: theres a bunch of spots rite here, shalimar, pakwan and chutney, and i go to all 3 depending on what it is that i want and what specials each are having and just to mix it up and keep the neighborhood on lock. i dont eat chicken tikka masala (i boycott the brittish colonialization of india and appropriation of their cuisine). i urge you to try all of the various different dishes at all the spots.  the quirky thing that i like about chutney is that they give you a mediocre-at-best salad with your meal. nice touch.  this one is definately the cleanest of the 3, so if you are a panzy and care about that kinda thing definately come to chutney, as you aren't missing out on a higher quality food if you choose to eat here over the other two spots.
author: christopher a.

description: best chicken tikka marsala in the city. so rich and creamy its the only thing i ever get. its in a shady neighborhood but worth walking pass the bums.
author: Ashley H.

description: $4 veggie wraps are good, but why in the world would you include mayo in them, especially when you have such great chutneys?  tandori chicken is always well-seasoned and never dry.  naan is cooked to order, can't go wrong.  lassi's are way, way too sweet.  spiciness can be out of control, even when requested level is specified.  line out the door is well warranted.  takeout recommended, but be sure to double-check your order.
author: Ariane R.

description: Their goat curry is one of my favorites at Chutney.  I don't like the consistency of their Palak Paneer, but overall Chutney is a good Indian restaurant.  However, I am still searching for the Ultimate Indian place in town....
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: My favorite Indian place. A lot less spicy than Shalimar (which is across the street). I love the Paneer Tikka Masala, and the mango lassis aren't bad, either.
author: Anna J.

description: meh.  i was really craving indian food, and i came here (next to my favorite thai restaurant), and over ate, and felt very dissatisfied.  it just didn't do it for me.  the food is kinda... bland?  i mean, crazy since it's indian, but i have no clue, just wasn't that great.
author: H. L.

description:
there is absolutely no way this place could have LEGITIMATELY raked up an average 4 star rating....... the world must have gone mad or become taste impaired...

this place first caught my attention when i was standing in line at dotties.  i was famished..... "HARK, what is that sweet sweet aroma of curry? is it an olfactory mirage?  GASP!  why look there!  across the street... there's an interesting indian restaurant, let me check it out on yelp..."

and so i did... i beamed... "wow, 4 stars?  must be good.  gotta go.  gonna go."

and so i did.... with a couple of friends, we ordered a grip of food.  the waiter came (40 mins later) bearing our "food."  i hadnt known we ordered green broth with a 5 cubes of something, diluted orange stuff with a parsimony of chicken bones, and watery brown goo with a sprinkling of lamb.  i thought we ordered spinach curry with cheese, chicken masala, and some lamb curry.... my mistake.  my memory isnt what it used to be.  ahh!  but at least i got the rice and naan right.

jokes aside, i will not come back..... unless my life depended on it.  it was thoroughly yucky.  if youre hungry and in the area, i recommend that you steer clear of Chutney and go across the street instead, to Dottie's or Shalimar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/shalimar-san-francisco#hrid:iw0vFqtOwv73Wfj9gt2B-w).
author: Christina L.

description: lamb tikka masala, garlic naan - self-serve cans of coke and pitchers of water.
author: dave w.

description: So after years of being terrified of trying any Indian food , my co-worker and I gave a few places fair shots... Some great and some were gross...But this place has great Indian at great prices... I live in the area so I am used to the sketchy people, hookers, and drug dealers, but who cares about that anyway, they are in every hood in the city as it is so I am not gonna let them scare me into not getting good food!!!... It can get kinda noisey in here so I usually get my grub to go and call the order in... no more that 10-15 mins and its ready, piping hot, and de-lish! I have told a few friends about this place and they all said the same things I have... It's a winner! Check this place out when you can!
author: D. M.

description: I am no expert on indian food, but I know when something tastes good and this does!  Easy parking next door in an enclosed garage.
author: Roby R.

description: Ok, this is the TL...Jones and O'Farrell. Passing by last week, I noticed the restaurant, which looked fairly decent to me. I haven't gone to an Indian restaurant in over 25 years...seriously, and it's not because I had a bad experience or anything like that. There are just so many good places to eat in the Bay Area. Anyway, I stopped by for lunch the following day and ordered the lamb curry and keema naan. OMG!!! these dishes were screeming! The lamb, in the mild spicy sauce, was tender and the sauce was flavorful. The keema naan came temperature hot and fresh and I used it to dip into and wipe up that delicious spicy sauce. With a can of soda, my meal came to $8.50. I'm hooked now and can't wait to try other dishes on the menu. Indian food, I'M BACK!
author: David D.

description: just TRY the best mango lahsi this side of the loin --- and sweet chai, even if you're really full after all that naan and chicken or paneer tikka masala, the bindi masala, and the hot pepper leaving your taste budlets burning ...
author: Holly F.

description: oh chutney - i can't get  enough of you! if the chicken tikka masala (butter chicken) wasn't so artery-clogging, i'd be there every week! i only eat the chicken tikka masala with regular naan (its fluffier than garlic naan - and less burnt).. of course the free chai is a bonus. great, now i wish i didn't write this review so it could be kept a secret...
author: Nancie T.

description: So so so good!  This restaurant as well as Lahore Karahi are my 2 favorite Indian restaurants in San Francisco.  My favorite dish is, of course, the chicken tikka masala.  Naan is good too.. very traditional.  Everything is good here though.  Service is pretty fast, but during dinner time on Fridays and Saturdays it can get a little packed, so be prepared.  You won't be disappointed if you go here!
author: Blushed M.

description: I usually frequent Shalimar but at the request of one of our friends to try out Chutney, we switched and I can say I think I am officially switching.  The food was great but I'm gonna write more about the service and cleaniness of the place.  Out of the party of six, only two of us showed up on time.  It was pretty packed when my friend and I arrived and we didn't know if we needed to wait till everyone arrived or if we could just grab a table (like the less formal spot, Shalimar, across the street).  The host was all smiles and was totally fine with us holding a large table even though our other friends had not arrived.  We had also brought wine (again, perfectly common at Shalimar) but I grew hesitant when I glanced around the restaurant and it didn't appear that you could byob.  I asked the same smiling host about their policy and he was super chill and told us it was perfectly fine and offered us a wine opener.   Portions border just right to a little small.  Don't expect any left overs.  All the dishes were delicious; the lamb in spinach was superb.  Chutney is definitely much fancier in appearance, but equally as easy on the pocketbooks as it's Indian/Pak neighbors.
author: Mabel L.

description: This place is better than all the Naan 'N' Curry locations in the city but not as yumyum as Punjab Kebab House. It's also just a little more expensive than NNC but less so than Punjab because of location. I was bought over to them from NNC because they have lamb tikka masala, not just chicken tikka like most places. Also, they have seekh kebabs (beef), which NNC got rid of (they only have chicken seekh). Their tandoori chicken is very good, very moist, better than NNC + Punjab. Also, this place gives you free salad: lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and lemon wedges. But, NNC on O'Farrell + Mason does this too now, as well as Punjab. I must say that this places has nicer decor than most Indian/Paki cheap eats, almost like more fancy, and the bathroom is nice. Of course, you order at the counter here and they bring you the food. They also bring you the plates and utensils and water but you get your own free cha (tea) at the counter. The neighborhood, if you're not rough-neighborhood savvy, you may not want to walk there alone. It's in the Tenderloin so there are drug addicts and some dealers and a lot of impoverished people around but I'd say it's safe. It's only half a block from inbound+outbound 38 Geary bus stops. This place is good and I've never seen any type of vermin in here. It can get full on weekend nights but I've never noticed a wait.
author: Kimberly D.

description: I can't believe they messed up my order AGAIN!!! I even repeated it to the guy twice.  Definately not ordering from them again.
author: luisa p.

description: My nephew asked me if you love Chutney so much why don't you marry it?  If they delivered I would!
author: S M.

description: This is the best Indian food around and the price is great too.  This place is always packed with tons of people.  The food is sooooo yummy and I have to get my fix to get it at least once a week.  Their Chicken Tikka Masala is to die for, have tried this at many other places but no one beats how Chutney makes it.  The owner and his sons are really really friendly including the staff they have always making you feel welcomed.  They will stop by to chit chat to make sure everything is okay.  This just reminds me that i have to get some Chutney tonight, cant wait!!!!
author: Emily S.

description: The only reason I don't give this place a full five stars is because the ambiance is non-existent.  Other than that the food is great.  The tikka masala is great, the lamb curry is yummy, and all the different kinds of naan (pita bread) is mouth watering! the garlic naan is sooo good and the cheese one is to die for.  The staff is friendly. Definitely try it!
author: Esther Y.

description: Best Indian in food in the city and a great, yet clean relaxed atmosphere.  I highly recommend.  (They make it hot and spicy - mild = hot.)
author: M B.

description: Seriously no frills, but GREAT Indian food.  Neighborhood's a bit sketch, but I visit regularly.
author: Melinda G.

description: This place is amazing. I loved the lam tika masalla, and the seekh kababs. Services was a bit slow but for sure worth the wait. Will forsure come here again!
author: Jesus I.

description: Chicken masala, chicken tandoori, and chicken bryani are all my faves here.  The extra salad with onions is also a good touch for someone like me that loves raw greens.  The garlic and potato naans are so good that I think I just might try and make a naan ham & egg sandwich some day!
author: John C.

description: Excellent cheap pakistani food. The service is friendly and prompt, and even on really busy nights, everything runs smoothly. We went with a group of 6 last Friday during prime time, and we were seated in about 10 minutes and our food was in front of us 5 minutes later! It is clean and inviting, and it is BYOB! We brought some great beer and enjoyed it with our meal. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in need of a speedy, cheap bite in the downtown area.
author: Jammy M.

description: I used to love this place, but now I avoid it because the quality is hit or miss. The Aloo Ghobi, spicy cauliflower and potatoes, was my favorite but the last two times I ordered it it was sandy; I don't think they washed the potatoes enough. And one time the potatoes tasted odd and were mealy. Kind of a shame really because the food is good when it's good.
author: Greg M.

description: really goood indian foood, even though it was my first time eating indian food
author: dragon r.

description: i use to go chutney with my friends now and then, i used to order lamb curry every time , the food tasted ok but i got sick more than once( not just me , my friend and his wife too!) so i decided to stop eating there and swich to shalimar across the street  ... it was the right decision to take.
author: james b.

description: consistently YUMMYY. i literallly inhale the food when i am there.. and then lick my fingers clean.. not oily like shalimar (which is such a disgusting sight!! ) and way yummier than nan n curry which has in the recent past caused me to become sick after eating one of their biryanis! best indian food in town :)
author: Aditi M.
